Text

[Bébée]101-bébée sprang out of bed at daybreak . [She]101-bébée was sixteen . It seemed a very wonderful thing to be as much as that — sixteen — [a woman]217-a woman quite . A cock was crowing under [her]101-bébée lattice . [He]218-he said how old [you]101-bébée are!—how old [you]101-bébée are ! every time that [he]218-he sounded [his]218-he clarion . [She]101-bébée opened the lattice and wished [him]218-he good day , with a laugh . It was so pleasant to be woke by [him]218-he , and to think that [no one in [all the world]220-all the world]219-no one in all the world could ever call [one a child]221-one a child any more . There was [a kid]222-a kid bleating in [the shed]223-the shed . There was a thrush singing in the dusk of the sycamore leaves . There was a calf lowing to [its mother]224-its mother away there beyond the fence . There were dreamy muffled bells ringing in the distance from many steeples and belfries where [the city]225-the city was ; [they]226-they all said one thing , " How good it is to be so old as that — how good , how very good ! "[226-they] [Bébée]101-bébée was very pretty . [No one in all Brabant]227-no one in all brabant ever denied that . To look at [her]101-bébée it seemed as if [she]101-bébée had so lived among the flowers that [she]101-bébée had grown like them , and only looked a bigger blossom — that was all . [She]101-bébée wore two little wooden shoes and a little cotton cap , and a gray kirtle — linen in summer , serge in winter ; but the little feet in the shoes were like rose leaves , and the cap was as white as a lily , and the gray kirtle was like the bark of the bough that the apple - blossom parts , and peeps out of , to blush in the sun . The flowers had been the only godmothers that [she]101-bébée had ever had , and [fairy godmothers]228-fairy godmothers too . The marigolds and the sunflowers had given [her]101-bébée [their]229-their ripe , rich gold to tint [her]101-bébée hair ; the lupins and irises had lent their azure to [her]101-bébée eyes ; the moss - rosebuds had made [her]101-bébée pretty mouth ; the arum lilies had uncurled their softness for [her]101-bébée skin ; and the lime - blossoms had given [her]101-bébée their frank , fresh , innocent fragrance . The winds had blown , and the rains had rained , and the sun had shone on [her]101-bébée , indeed , and had warmed the whiteness of [her]101-bébée limbs , but they had only given to [her]101-bébée body and [her]101-bébée soul a hardy , breeze - blown freshness like that of a field cowslip . [She]101-bébée had never been called anything but [Bébée]101-bébée . One summer day [Antoine Mäes]102-antoine — [a French subject]230-a french subject , but [a Belgian by adoption and habit]231-a belgian by adoption and habit , [an old man who got [his]102-antoine meagre living by tilling the garden plot about [[his]102-antoine hut]233-his hut and selling flowers in [the city squares]234-the city squares]232-an old man who got his meagre living by tilling the garden plot about his hut and selling flowers in the city squares — [Antoine]102-antoine , going into [Brussels]1-brussels for [his]102-antoine day 's trade , had seen a gray bundle floating among the water - lilies in the bit of water near [[his]102-antoine hut]233-his hut and had hooked it out to [land]236-land , and found [a year - old child]237-a year - old child in [it]233-his hut , left to drown , no doubt , but saved by the lilies , and laughing gleefully at fate . [Some lace - worker , blind with the pain of toil]238-some lace - worker , blind with the pain of toil , or [some peasant woman harder of heart than the oxen in [her]239-some peasant woman harder of heart than the oxen in her yoke yoke]239-some peasant woman harder of heart than the oxen in her yoke , had left [it]233-his hut there to drift away to death , not reckoning for the inward ripple of the current or the toughness of the lily leaves and stems . [Old Antoine]103-antoine took it to [[his]103-antoine wife]240-his wife , and [the wife]241-the wife , [a childless and aged soul]242-a childless and aged soul , begged leave to keep it ; and [the two poor lonely , simple folks]243-the two poor lonely , simple folks grew to care for [the homeless , motherless thing]244-the homeless , motherless thing , and [they]243-the two poor lonely , simple folks and [the people about all]245-the people about all called it Bébée — only Bébée . [The church]246-the church got at [it]244-the homeless , motherless thing and added to it a saint 's name ; but for all [its]244-the homeless , motherless thing little world it remained Bébée — Bébée when it trotted no higher than the red carnation heads;—Bébée when its yellow curls touched as high as the lavender - bush;—Bébée on this proud day when the thrush 's song and the cock 's crow found [her]241-the wife sixteen years old . [[Old Antoine]103-antoine 's hut]247-old antoine 's hut stood in a little patch of [garden ground]248-garden ground with a brier hedge all round [it]247-old antoine 's hut , in that byway which lies between [Laeken]2-laeken and [Brussels]1-brussels , in [the heart of flat , green [Brabant]3-brabant]249-the heart of flat , green brabant , where [there are beautiful meadows and tall , flowering hedges]250-there are beautiful meadows and tall , flowering hedges , and [forest trees]251-forest trees , and [fern - filled ditches]252-fern - filled ditches , and [a little piece of water]253-a little piece of water , deep and cool , where the swans sail all day long , and the silvery willows dip and sway with the wind . Turn aside from [the highway]254-the highway , and there [it]255-it lies to - day , and all [the place]256-the place brims over with grass , and boughs , and blossoms , and flowering beans , and wild dog - roses ; and there are [a few cottages]257-a few cottages and [cabins]258-cabins there near [the pretty water]259-the pretty water , and farther there is [an old church]260-an old church , sacred to [St. Guido]6-st. guido ; and beyond go [the green level country]261-the green level country and [the endless wheat - fields]262-the endless wheat - fields , and [the old mills]263-the old mills with [their]263-the old mills red sails against the sun ; and beyond all these the pale blue , sea - like horizon of [the plains of [Flanders]4-flanders]264-the plains of flanders . [It]265-its was [a pretty little hut]266-a pretty little hut , pink all over like a sea - shell , in the fashion that [the Netherlanders]267-the netherlanders love ; and [its]265-its two little square lattices were dark with creeping plants and big rose - bushes , and [its]265-its roof , so low that [you]268-you could touch it , was golden and green with all the lichens and stoneworts that are known on [earth]269-earth . Here [Bébée]101-bébée grew from year to year ; and soon learned to be big enough and hardy enough to tie up bunches of stocks and pinks for the market , and then to carry a basket for [herself]101-bébée , trotting by [Antoine]103-antoine 's side along [the green roadway]270-the green roadway and into [the white , wide streets]271-the white , wide streets ; and in [the market]272-the market [the buyers]273-the buyers — most often of all when [they]273-the buyers were [young mothers]274-young mothers — would seek out the little golden head and the beautiful frank blue eyes , and buy [Bébée]101-bébée 's lilies and carnations whether [they]273-the buyers wanted them or not . So that [old Mäes]102-antoine used to cross [himself]102-antoine and say that , thanks to [Our Lady]275-our lady , trade was thrice as stirring since [the little one]276-the little one had stretched out [her]276-the little one rosy fingers with the flowers . All the same , however stirring trade might be in summer , when the long winters came and [the Montagne de la Cour]277-the montagne de la cour was a sharp slope of ice , and [the pinnacles of [St. Gudule]125-st. gudule]278-the pinnacles of st. gudule were all frosted white with snow , and the hot - house flowers alone could fill [the market]272-the market , and [the country gardens]280-the country gardens were bitter black wind - swept desolations where the chilly roots huddled themselves together underground like [homeless children]281-homeless children in a cellar,—then the money gained in the time of leaf and blossom was all needed to buy a black loaf and fagot of wood ; and many a day in [the little pink hut]282-the little pink hut [Bébée]101-bébée rolled [herself]101-bébée up in [her]101-bébée bed like [a dormouse]283-a dormouse , to forget in sleep that [she]101-bébée was supperless and as cold as a frozen robin . So that when [Antoine Mäes]102-antoine grew sick and died , more from age and weakness than any real disease , there were only a few silver crowns in the brown jug hidden in the thatch ; and [the hut]284-the hut [itself]284-the hut , with [its]284-the hut patch of ground , was all that [he]102-antoine could leave to [Bébée]101-bébée . " Live in [it]284-the hut , [little one]1934-little one , and take [nobody]1935-nobody in it to worry [you]1934-little one , and be good to the bird and the goat , and be sure to keep the flowers blowing , "[285-the old man] said [the old man]285-the old man with [his]285-the old man last breath ; and sobbing [her]101-bébée heart out by [his]285-the old man bedside , [Bébée]101-bébée vowed to do [his]285-the old man bidding . [She]101-bébée was not quite fourteen then , and when [she]101-bébée had laid [[her]101-bébée old friend]286-her old friend to rest in [the rough green graveyard about [St. Guido]6-st. guido]287-the rough green graveyard about st. guido , [she]101-bébée was very sorrowful and lonely , [poor little , bright [Bébée]101-bébée , who had never hardly known a worse woe than to run the thorns of the roses into [her]101-bébée fingers , or to cry because a thrush was found starved to death in the snow]288-poor little , bright bébée , who had never hardly known a worse woe than to run the thorns of the roses into her fingers , or to cry because a thrush was found starved to death in the snow . [Bébée]101-bébée went [home]289-home , and sat down in a corner and thought . [The hut]284-the hut was [her]101-bébée own , and [her]101-bébée own [the little green triangle just then crowded with its Mayday blossom in all the colors of the rainbow]291-the little green triangle just then crowded with its mayday blossom in all the colors of the rainbow . [She]101-bébée was to live in [it]284-the hut , and never let the flowers die , so [he]285-the old man had said ; good , rough old ugly [Antoine Mäes]102-antoine , who had been to [her]101-bébée as [father]292-father , [mother]293-mother , [country]294-country , [king , and law]295-king , and law . The sun was shining . Through [the little square of the lattice]296-the little square of the lattice [she]101-bébée could see the great tulips opening in the grass and a bough of the apple - tree swaying in the wind . A chaffinch clung to the bough , and swung to and fro singing . The door stood open , with the broad , bright day beaming through ; and [[Bébée]101-bébée 's little world]297-bébée 's little world came streaming in with it,—the world which dwelt in [the half - dozen cottages that fringed [this green lane of hers]299-this green lane of hers like beavers ' nests pushed out under the leaves on to [the water]300-the water 's edge]298-the half - dozen cottages that fringed this green lane of hers like beavers ' nests pushed out under the leaves on to the water 's edge . [They]301-them came in , [six or eight of [them]301-them]302-six or eight of them , [all women]303-all women ; [trim , clean , plain Brabant peasants]304-trim , clean , plain brabant peasants , hard - working , kindly of nature , and shrewd in [their]301-them own simple matters ; [people who labored in [the fields]306-the fields all the day long , or worked [themselves]305-people who labored in the fields all the day long , or worked themselves blind over the lace pillows in the city blind over the lace pillows in [the city]225-the city]305-people who labored in the fields all the day long , or worked themselves blind over the lace pillows in the city . " [You]101-bébée are too young to live alone , [Bébée]101-bébée , "[308-the first of them] said [the first of [them]301-them]308-the first of them . " [[My]308-the first of them old mother]1936-my old mother shall come and keep [house]1937-house for [you]101-bébée . "[308-the first of them] " Nay , better come and live with [me]309-the second , [Bébée]101-bébée , "[309-the second] said [the second]309-the second . " [I]309-the second will give [you]101-bébée bit and drop , and clothing , too , for the right to [your]101-bébée plot of ground . "[309-the second] " That is to cheat [her]1936-my old mother , "[310-the third] said [the third]310-the third . " Hark , here , [Bébée]101-bébée : [[my]310-the third sister]1938-my sister , who is [a lone woman]1939-a lone woman , as [you]101-bébée know well , shall come and bide with [you]101-bébée , and ask [you]101-bébée nothing — nothing at all — only [you]101-bébée shall just give [her]1938-my sister a crust , perhaps , and a few flowers to sell sometimes . "[310-the third] " No , no , "[311-the fourth] said [the fourth]311-the fourth ; " that will not do . [You]101-bébée let [me]311-the fourth have [the garden]1940-the garden and [the hut]284-the hut , [Bébée]101-bébée , and [[my]311-the fourth sons]1942-my sons shall till the place for [you]101-bébée ; and [I]311-the fourth will live with [you]101-bébée [myself]311-the fourth , and leave [the boys]1943-the boys [the cabin]1944-the cabin , so [you]101-bébée will have all the gain , do [you]101-bébée not see , [dear little one]1945-dear little one ? "[311-the fourth] " Pooh ! "[312-the fifth] said [the fifth]312-the fifth , stouter and better clothed than [the rest]313-the rest . " [You]101-bébée are all eager for [your]101-bébée own good , not for [hers]1946-hers . Now [I]312-the fifth — [Father Francis]105-father francis says [we]1947-we should all do as [we]1947-we would be done by — [I]312-the fifth will take [Bébée]101-bébée to live with [me]312-the fifth , all for nothing ; and [we]1947-we will root the flowers up and plant it with good cabbages and potatoes and salad plants . And [I]312-the fifth will stable [my]312-the fifth cows in [the hut]284-the hut to sweeten it after [a dead man]1949-a dead man , and [I]312-the fifth will take [my]312-the fifth chance of making money out of it , and [no one]1950-no one can speak more fair than that when [one]1951-one sees what weather is , and thinks what insects do ; and all the year round , winter and summer , [Bébée]101-bébée here will want for nothing , and have to take no care for [herself]314-she whatever . "[312-the fifth] [She]314-she who spoke , [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs , was [the best - to - do woman in [the little lane]316-the little lane]315-the best - to - do woman in the little lane , having two cows of [her]314-she own and ear - rings of solid silver , and [a green cart]317-a green cart , and a big dog that took the milk into [Brussels]1-brussels . [She]314-she was heard , therefore , with respect , and a short silence followed [her]314-she words . But it was very short ; and a hubbub of voices crossed [each other]318-each other after it as [the speakers]319-the speakers grew hotter against [one another]320-one another and more eager to convince [each other]318-each other of the disinterestedness and delicacy of [their]319-the speakers offers of aid . Through it all [Bébée]101-bébée sat quite quiet on the edge of [the little truckle - bed]322-the little truckle - bed , with [her]101-bébée eyes fixed on the apple bough and the singing chaffinch . [She]101-bébée heard [them]319-the speakers all patiently . [They]319-the speakers were [all [her]101-bébée good friends]323-all her good friends , [friends old and true]324-friends old and true . [This one]325-this one had given [her]101-bébée cherries for many a summer . [That other]326-that other had bought [her]101-bébée a little waxen Jesus at [the Kermesse]7-the kermesse . [The old woman in the blue linen skirt]327-the old woman in the blue linen skirt had taken [her]101-bébée to [her]101-bébée first communion . [She]327-the old woman in the blue linen skirt who wanted [[her]327-the old woman in the blue linen skirt sister]328-her sister to have the crust and the flowers , had brought [her]101-bébée a beautiful painted book of hours that had cost a whole franc . [Another]329-another had given [her]101-bébée the solitary wonder , travel , and foreign feast of [her]101-bébée whole life,—a day fifteen miles away at the fair at [Mechlin]8-mechlin . [The last speaker of all]330-the last speaker of all had danced [her]101-bébée on [her]101-bébée knee a hundred times in babyhood , and told [her]101-bébée legends , and let [her]101-bébée ride in [the green cart]331-the green cart behind big curly - coated Tambour . [Bébée]101-bébée did not doubt that [these trusty old friends]332-these trusty old friends meant well by [her]101-bébée , and yet a certain heavy sense fell on [her]101-bébée that in all these counsels there was not the same whole - hearted and frank goodness that had prompted the gifts to [her]101-bébée of [the waxen Jesus]333-the waxen jesus , and the Kermesse of [Mechlin]8-mechlin . [Bébée]101-bébée did not reason , because [she]101-bébée was too little a thing and too trustful ; but [she]101-bébée felt , in a vague , sorrowful fashion , that [they]332-these trusty old friends were all of [them]332-these trusty old friends trying to make some benefit out of [her]101-bébée poor little heritage , with small regard for [herself]101-bébée at the root of [their]332-these trusty old friends speculations . [Bébée]101-bébée was [a child]334-a child , wholly [a child]334-a child ; body and soul were both as fresh in [her]101-bébée as a golden crocus just born out of the snows . But [she]101-bébée was not [a little fool]336-a little fool , though [people]337-people sometimes called [her]101-bébée so because [she]101-bébée would sit in the moments of [her]101-bébée leisure with [her]101-bébée blue eyes on the far - away clouds like a thing in a dream . [She]101-bébée heard [them]332-these trusty old friends patiently till the cackle of shrill voices had exhausted itself , and [the six women]338-the six women stood on the sunny mud floor of [the hut]284-the hut eyeing [each other]318-each other with venomous glances ; for though [they]338-the six women were [good neighbors]341-good neighbors at all times , each , in this matter , was hungry for the advantages to be got out of [[old Antoine]102-antoine 's plot of ground]342-old antoine 's plot of ground . [They]338-the six women were very poor ; [they]338-the six women toiled in the scorched or frozen fields all weathers , or spent from dawn to nightfall poring over [their]338-the six women cobweb lace ; and to save [a son]343-a son or gain a cabbage was of moment to [them]338-the six women only second to the keeping of [their]338-the six women souls secure of heaven by Lenten mass and Easter psalm . [Bébée]101-bébée listened to [them]332-these trusty old friends all , and the tears dried on [her]101-bébée cheeks , and [her]101-bébée pretty rosebud lips curled close in one another . " [You]332-these trusty old friends are very good , no doubt , all of [you]332-these trusty old friends , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said at last . " But [I]101-bébée can not tell [you]332-these trusty old friends that [I]101-bébée am thankful , for [my]101-bébée heart is like a stone , and [I]101-bébée think it is not so very much for [me]101-bébée as it is for the hut that [you]332-these trusty old friends are speaking . Perhaps it is wrong in [me]101-bébée to say so ; yes , [I]101-bébée am wrong , [I]101-bébée am sure,—you are all kind , and [I]101-bébée am only [Bébée]101-bébée . But [you]332-these trusty old friends see [he]1952-he told [me]101-bébée to live [here]1953-here and take care of the flowers , and [I]101-bébée must do it , that is certain . [I]101-bébée will ask [Father Francis]105-father francis , if [you]332-these trusty old friends wish : but if [he]1952-he tells [me]101-bébée [I]101-bébée am wrong , as [you]332-these trusty old friends do . [I]101-bébée shall stay [here]1953-here all the same . "[101-bébée] And in answer to [their]344-their expostulations and condemnation , [she]345-she only said the same thing over again always , in different words , but to the same steadfast purpose . [The women]346-the women clamored about [her]345-she for an hour in reproach and rebuke ; [she]345-she was [a baby]347-a baby indeed , [she]345-she was [a little fool]336-a little fool , [she]345-she was [a naughty , obstinate child]349-a naughty , obstinate child , [she]345-she was [an ungrateful , wilful little creature , who ought to be beaten till [she]345-she was blue]350-an ungrateful , wilful little creature , who ought to be beaten till she was blue , if only there was [anybody that had the right to do it]351-anybody that had the right to do it ! " But there is [nobody that has the right]1955-nobody that has the right , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , getting angry and standing upright on the floor , with [Antoine]102-antoine 's old gray cat in [her]101-bébée round arms . " [He]102-antoine told [me]101-bébée to stay [here]1953-here , and [he]102-antoine would not have said so if it had been wrong ; and [I]101-bébée am old enough to do for [myself]101-bébée , and [I]101-bébée am not afraid , and who is there that would hurt [me]101-bébée ? Oh , yes ; go and tell [Father Francis]105-father francis , if [you]105-father francis like ! [I]101-bébée do not believe [he]102-antoine will blame [me]101-bébée , but if [he]102-antoine do , [I]101-bébée must bear it . Even if [he]102-antoine shut [the church]246-the church door on [me]101-bébée , [I]101-bébée will obey [Antoine]102-antoine , and [the flowers]1958-the flowers will know [I]101-bébée am right , and [they]1958-the flowers will let [no evil spirits]1959-no evil spirits touch [me]101-bébée , for the flowers are strong for that ; [they]1958-the flowers talk to [the angels]1960-the angels in the night . "[101-bébée] What use was it to argue with [a little idiot like this]352-a little idiot like this ? Indeed , [peasants]353-peasants never do argue ; [they]353-peasants use abuse . It is [their]353-peasants only form of logic . [They]353-peasants used it to [Bébée]101-bébée , rating [her]101-bébée soundly , as became [people who were old enough to be [[her]101-bébée grandmothers]355-her grandmothers , and who knew that [she]101-bébée had been raked out of [[their]353-peasants own pond]356-their own pond]354-people who were old enough to be her grandmothers , and who knew that she had been raked out of their own pond , and had no more real place in creation than a water rat , as [one]1951-one might say . [The women]346-the women were kindly , and had never thrown this truth against [her]101-bébée before , and in fact , to be [a foundling]359-a foundling was no sort of disgrace to [their]346-the women sight ; but anger is like wine , and makes the depths of the mind shine clear , and all the mud that is in the depths stink in the light ; and in [their]346-the women wrath at not sharing [Antoine]102-antoine 's legacy , [the good souls]360-the good souls said bitter things that in calm moments [they]346-the women would no more have uttered than [they]346-the women would have taken up a knife to slit [her]101-bébée throat . [They]353-peasants talked [themselves]353-peasants hoarse with impatience and chagrin , and went backwards over the threshold , [their]353-peasants wooden shoes and [their]353-peasants shrill voices keeping a clattering chorus . By this time it was evening ; the sun had gone off the floor , and the bird had done singing . [Bébée]101-bébée stood in the same place , hardening [her]101-bébée little heart , whilst big and bitter tears swelled into [her]101-bébée eyes , and fell on the soft fur of the sleeping cat . [She]101-bébée only very vaguely understood why it was in any sense shameful to have been raked out of the water - lilies like a drowning field mouse , as [they]346-the women had said it was . [She]101-bébée and [Antoine]102-antoine had often talked of that summer morning when [he]102-antoine had found [her]101-bébée there among the leaves , and [Bébée]101-bébée and [he]102-antoine had laughed over it gayly , and [she]101-bébée had been quite proud in [her]101-bébée innocent fashion that [she]101-bébée had had a fairy and the flowers for [[her]101-bébée mother]361-her mother and [godmothers]362-godmothers , which [Antoine]102-antoine always told [her]101-bébée was the case beyond any manner of doubt . Even [Father Francis]105-father francis , hearing the pretty harmless fiction , had never deemed it [his]105-father francis duty to disturb [her]101-bébée pleasure in it , being [a good , cheerful old man , who thought that woe and wisdom both come soon enough to bow young shoulders and to silver young curls]363-a good , cheerful old man , who thought that woe and wisdom both come soon enough to bow young shoulders and to silver young curls without [his]105-father francis interference . [Bébée]101-bébée had always thought it quite a fine thing to have been born of water - lilies , with the sun for [[her]101-bébée father]364-her father , and when [people in [Brussels]1-brussels]365-people in brussels had asked [her]101-bébée of [her]101-bébée parentage , seeing [her]101-bébée stand in [the market]272-the market with a certain look on [her]101-bébée that was not like [other children]367-other children , had always gravely answered in the purest good faith , — " [[My]365-people in brussels mother]1961-my mother was a flower . "[365-people in brussels] " [You]365-people in brussels are a flower , at any rate , "[365-people in brussels] [they]365-people in brussels would say in return ; and [Bébée]101-bébée had been always quite content . But now [she]101-bébée was doubtful ; [she]101-bébée was rather perplexed than sorrowful . [These good friends of [hers]101-bébée]368-these good friends of hers seemed to see some new sin about [her]101-bébée . Perhaps , after all , thought [Bébée]101-bébée , it might have been better to have had [a human mother who would have taken care of [her]101-bébée now that [old Antoine]102-antoine was dead , instead of those beautiful , gleaming , cold water - lilies which went to sleep on their green velvet beds , and did not certainly care when the thorns ran into [her]101-bébée fingers , or the pebbles got in [her]101-bébée wooden shoes]369-a human mother who would have taken care of her now that old antoine was dead , instead of those beautiful , gleaming , cold water - lilies which went to sleep on their green velvet beds , and did not certainly care when the thorns ran into her fingers , or the pebbles got in her wooden shoes . In some vague way , disgrace and envy — the twin Discords of [the world]370-the world — touched [her]101-bébée innocent cheek with [their]365-people in brussels hot breath , and as the evening fell , [Bébée]101-bébée felt very lonely and a little wistful . [She]101-bébée had been always used to run out in the pleasant twilight - time among the flowers and water them , [Antoine]102-antoine filling the can from the well ; and [the neighbors]371-the neighbors would come and lean against the little low wall , knitting and gossiping ; and the big dogs , released from harness , would poke [their]372-their heads through the wicket for a crust ; and [the children]373-the children would dance and play [Colin Maillard]107-colin maillard on the green by the water ; and [she]101-bébée , when the flowers were no longer thirsted , would join [them]373-the children , and romp and dance and sing the gayest of [them]373-the children all . But now the buckets hung at the bottom of the well , and the flowers hungered in vain , and [the neighbors]371-the neighbors held aloof , and [she]101-bébée shut to the hut door and listened to the rain which began to fall , and cried [herself]101-bébée to sleep all alone in [[her]101-bébée tiny kingdom]375-her tiny kingdom . When the dawn came the sun rose red and warm ; the grass and boughs sparkled ; a lark sang ; [Bébée]101-bébée awoke sad in heart , indeed , for [[her]101-bébée lost old friend]376-her lost old friend , but brighter and braver . " [Each of [them]373-the children]1962-each of them wants to get something out of [me]377-the child , "[377-the child] thought [the child]377-the child . " Well , [I]377-the child will live alone , then , and do [my]377-the child duty , just as [he]376-her lost old friend said . The flowers will never let any real harm come , though [they]373-the children do look so indifferent and smiling sometimes , and though not one of [them]373-the children hung [their]373-the children heads when [his]376-her lost old friend coffin was carried through [them]373-the children yesterday . "[377-the child] That want of sympathy in the flower troubled [her]101-bébée . [The old man]285-the old man had loved [them]379-they so well ; and [they]379-they had all looked as glad as ever , and had laughed saucily in the sun , and not even a rosebud turned the paler as the poor still stiffened limbs went by in the wooden shell . " [I]101-bébée suppose [God]108-god cares ; but [I]101-bébée wish [they]379-they did . "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , to whom [the garden]1940-the garden was more intelligible than [Providence]109-providence . " Why do [you]381-the pinks not care ? "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée asked the pinks , shaking the raindrops off their curled rosy petals . [The pinks]381-the pinks leaned lazily against [their]381-the pinks sticks , and seemed to say , " Why should [we]381-the pinks care for anything , unless a slug be eating [us?—that]1963-us?—that is real woe , if [you]381-the pinks like . "[381-the pinks] [Bébée]101-bébée , without [her]101-bébée sabots on , wandered thoughtfully among the sweet wet sunlightened labyrinths of blossom , [her]101-bébée pretty bare feet treading the narrow grassy paths with pleasure in their coolness . " [He]1964-he was so good to [you]381-the pinks ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said reproachfully to the great gaudy gillyflowers and the painted sweet - peas . " [He]1964-he never let [you]381-the pinks know heat or cold , [he]1964-he never let the worm gnaw or the snail harm [you]381-the pinks ; [he]1964-he would get up in the dark to see after [your]381-the pinks wants ; and when the ice froze over [you]381-the pinks , [he]1964-he was there to loosen [your]381-the pinks chains . Why do [you]381-the pinks not care , [anyone of [you]381-the pinks]1965-anyone of you ? "[101-bébée] " How silly [you]381-the pinks are ! "[101-bébée] said the flowers . " [You]381-the pinks must be a butterfly or [a poet]1966-a poet , [Bébée]101-bébée , to be as foolish as that . [Some one]1967-some one will do all [he]1964-he did . [We]383-we are of market value , [you]381-the pinks know . Care , indeed ! when the sun is so warm , and there is not an earwig in the place to trouble [us]383-we . "[101-bébée] The flowers were not always so selfish as this ; and perhaps the sorrow in [Bébée]101-bébée 's heart made [their]382-their callousness seem harder than it really was . When [we]383-we suffer very much [ourselves]383-we , anything that smiles in the sun seems cruel — [a child]334-a child , a bird , a dragon - fly — nay , even a fluttering ribbon , or a spear - grass that waves in the wind . There was a little shrine at the corner of [the garden]1940-the garden , set into the wall ; a niche with a bit of glass and a picture of [the Virgin]386-the virgin , so battered that [no one]1950-no one could trace any feature of [it]388-it . It had been there for centuries , and was held in great veneration ; and [old Antoine]102-antoine had always cut the choicest buds of [his]102-antoine roses and set them in a delf pot in front of it , every other morning all the summer long . [Bébée]101-bébée , whose religion was the sweetest , vaguest mingling of Pagan and Christian myths , and whose faith in fairies and in saints was exactly equal in strength and in ignorance,—Bébée filled the delf pot anew carefully , then knelt down on the turf in that little green corner , and prayed in devout hopeful childish good faith to [the awful unknown Powers who were to [her]101-bébée only as [gentle guides and kindly playmates]390-gentle guides and kindly playmates]389-the awful unknown powers who were to her only as gentle guides and kindly playmates . Was [she]101-bébée too familiar with [the Holy Mother]391-the holy mother ? [She]101-bébée was almost fearful that [she]101-bébée was ; but then [the Holy Mother]391-the holy mother loved flowers so well , [Bébée]101-bébée would not feel aloof from [her]391-the holy mother , nor be afraid . " When one cuts the best blossoms for [her]391-the holy mother , and tries to be good , and never tells a lie , "[101-bébée] thought [Bébée]101-bébée , " [I]101-bébée am quite sure , as [she]391-the holy mother loves the lilies , that [she]391-the holy mother will never altogether forget [me]101-bébée . "[101-bébée] So [she]101-bébée said to [the Mother of [Christ]110-christ]393-the mother of christ fearlessly , and nothing doubting ; and then rose for [her]101-bébée daily work of cutting the flowers for [the market in [Brussels]1-brussels]394-the market in brussels . By the time [her]101-bébée baskets were full , [her]101-bébée fowls fed , [her]101-bébée goat foddered , [her]101-bébée starling 's cage cleaned , [her]101-bébée hut door locked , and [her]101-bébée wooden shoes clattering on the sunny road into [the city]225-the city , [Bébée]101-bébée was almost content again , though ever and again , as [she]101-bébée trod the familiar ways , the tears dimmed [her]101-bébée eyes as [she]101-bébée remembered that [old Antoine]102-antoine would never again hobble over the stones beside [her]101-bébée . " [You]101-bébée are [a little wilful one]1968-a little wilful one , and too young to live alone , "[105-father francis] said [Father Francis]105-father francis , meeting [her]101-bébée in [the lane]396-the lane . But [he]105-father francis did not scold [her]101-bébée seriously , and [she]101-bébée kept to [her]101-bébée resolve ; and [the women , who were good at heart]397-the women , who were good at heart , took [her]101-bébée back into favor again ; and so [Bébée]101-bébée had [her]101-bébée own way , and [the fairies]398-the fairies , or [the saints]399-the saints , or [both together]400-both together , took care of [her]101-bébée ; and so it came to pass that all alone [she]101-bébée heard the cock crow whilst it was dark , and woke to the grand and amazing truth that this warm , fragrant , dusky June morning found [her]101-bébée full sixteen years old . The two years had not been all playtime any more than they had been all summer . When [one]1951-one has not [father]292-father , or [mother]293-mother , or [brother]404-brother , and [[all one]405-all one 's friends]406-all one 's friends have barely bread enough for [themselves]406-all one 's friends , life can not be very easy , nor its crusts very many at any time . [Bébée]101-bébée had a cherub 's mouth , and [a dreamer]407-a dreamer 's eyes , and [a poet]1966-a poet 's thoughts sometimes in [her]101-bébée own untaught and unconscious fashion . But all the same [she]101-bébée was [a little hard - working Brabant peasant girl]409-a little hard - working brabant peasant girl ; up whilst the birds twittered in the dark ; to bed when the red sun sank beyond the far blue line of [the plains]410-the plains ; [she]101-bébée hoed , and dug , and watered , and planted [her]101-bébée little plot ; [she]101-bébée kept [[her]101-bébée cabin]411-her cabin as clean as a fresh - blossomed primrose ; [she]101-bébée milked [her]101-bébée goat and swept [her]101-bébée floor ; [she]101-bébée sat , all the warm days , in [the town]412-the town , selling [her]101-bébée flowers , and in the winter time , when [[her]101-bébée garden]413-her garden yielded [her]101-bébée nothing , [she]101-bébée strained [her]101-bébée sight over lace - making in [the city]225-the city to get the small bit of food that stood between [her]101-bébée and that hunger which to the poor means death . A hard life ; very hard when hail and snow made [the streets of [Brussels]1-brussels]415-the streets of brussels like slopes of ice ; a little hard even in the gay summer time when [she]101-bébée sat under the awning fronting [the Maison du Roi]416-the maison du roi ; but all the time [the child]377-the child throve on it , and was happy , and dreamed of many graceful and gracious things whilst [she]101-bébée was weeding among [her]101-bébée lilies , or tracing the threads to and fro on [her]101-bébée lace pillow . Now — when [she]101-bébée woke to the full sense of [her]101-bébée wonderful sixteen years — [Bébée]101-bébée , standing barefoot on the mud floor , was as pretty a sight as was to be seen betwixt [Scheldt]39-the scheldt and [Rhine]10-rhine . The sun had only left a soft warmth like an apricot 's on [her]101-bébée white skin . [Her]101-bébée limbs , though strong as a mountain pony 's , were slender and well shaped . [Her]101-bébée hair curled in shiny crumpled masses , and tumbled about [her]101-bébée shoulders . [Her]101-bébée pretty round plump little breast was white as the lilies in the grass without , and in this blooming time of [her]101-bébée little life , [Bébée]101-bébée , in [her]101-bébée way , was beautiful as a peach - bloom is beautiful , and [her]101-bébée innocent , courageous , happy eyes had dreams in them underneath [their]418-their laughter , dreams that went farther than [the green woods of [Laeken]2-laeken]419-the green woods of laeken , farther even than the white clouds of summer . [She]101-bébée could not move among [them]418-their idly as [poets]420-poets and [girls]421-girls love to do ; [she]101-bébée had to be active amidst [them]418-their , else drought and rain , and worm and snail , and blight and frost , would have made havoc of [their]418-their fairest hopes . The loveliest love is that which dreams high above all storms , unsoiled by all burdens ; but perhaps the strongest love is that which , whilst it adores , drags its feet through mire , and burns its brow in heat , for [the thing beloved]422-the thing beloved . So [Bébée]101-bébée dreamed in [[her]101-bébée garden]413-her garden ; but all the time for sake of it hoed and dug , and hurt [her]101-bébée hands , and tired [her]101-bébée limbs , and bowed [her]101-bébée shoulders under the great metal pails from the well . This wondrous morning , with the bright burden of [her]101-bébée sixteen years upon [her]101-bébée , [she]101-bébée dressed [herself]101-bébée quickly and fed [her]101-bébée fowls , and , happy as a bird , went to sit on [her]101-bébée little wooden stool in the doorway . There had been fresh rain in the night : [the garden]1940-the garden was radiant ; the smell of the wet earth was sweeter than all perfumes that are burned in [palaces]425-palaces . The dripping rosebuds nodded against [her]101-bébée hair as [she]101-bébée went out ; the starling called to [her]101-bébée , " Bébée , Bébée — bonjour , bonjour . "[426-it] These were all the words [it]426-it knew . [It]426-it said the same words a thousand times a week . But to [Bébée]101-bébée it seemed that [the starling]427-the starling most certainly knew that [she]427-the starling was sixteen years old that day . Breaking [her]101-bébée bread into the milk , [she]101-bébée sat in the dawn and thought , without knowing that [she]101-bébée thought it , " How good it is to live when [one]1951-one is young ! "[101-bébée] [Old people]428-old people say the same thing often , but [they]428-old people sigh when [they]428-old people say it . [Bébée]101-bébée smiled . [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs opened [her]106-mère krebs door in [the next cottage]429-the next cottage , and nodded over the wall . " What a fine thing to be sixteen!—a merry year , [Bébée]101-bébée . "[106-mère krebs] [Marthe]111-marthe , [[the carpenter]430-the carpenter 's wife]431-the carpenter 's wife , came out from [her]111-marthe gate , broom in hand . " [The Holy Saints]1970-the holy saints keep [you]101-bébée , [Bébée]101-bébée ; why , [you]101-bébée are quite [a woman]217-a woman now ! "[111-marthe] [The little children of [Varnhart]112-varnhart]432-the little children of varnhart , [the charcoal - burner]433-the charcoal - burner , who were as poor as [any mouse in [the old churches]435-the old churches]434-any mouse in the old churches , rushed out of [[their]432-the little children of varnhart little home]436-their little home up [the lane]396-the lane , bringing with [them]432-the little children of varnhart a cake stuck full of sugar and seeds , and tied round with a blue ribbon , that [[their]432-the little children of varnhart mother]438-their mother had made that very week , all in [her]438-their mother honor . " Only see , [Bébée]101-bébée ! Such a grand cake ! "[432-the little children of varnhart] [they]432-the little children of varnhart shouted , dancing down [the lane]396-the lane . " [Jules]113-jules picked the plums , and [Jeanne]114-jeanne washed the almonds , and [Christine]115-christine took the ribbon off [her]115-christine own communion cap , all for [you]101-bébée — all for [you]101-bébée ; but [you]101-bébée will let [us]1972-us come and eat it too ? "[432-the little children of varnhart] [Old Gran'mère Bishot]116-old gran'mère bishot , who was [the oldest woman about [Laeken]2-laeken]440-the oldest woman about laeken , hobbled through the grass on [her]116-old gran'mère bishot crutches and nodded [her]116-old gran'mère bishot white shaking head , and smiled at [Bébée]101-bébée . " [I]101-bébée have nothing to give [you]101-bébée , [little one]1934-little one , except [my]101-bébée blessing , if [you]101-bébée care for that . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée ran out , breaking from [the children]373-the children , and knelt down in the wet grass , and bent [her]101-bébée pretty sunny head to the benediction . [Trine]118-trine , [[the miller]442-the miller 's wife]443-the miller 's wife , [the richest woman of [them]373-the children all]444-the richest woman of them all , called to [the child]377-the child from the steps of [the mill]446-the mill , — ' " A merry year , and the blessing of Heaven , Bébée ! Come up , and here is [my]101-bébée first dish of cherries for [you]101-bébée ; not tasted one [myself]101-bébée ; [they]373-the children will make [you]101-bébée a feast with [Varnhart]112-varnhart 's cake , though [she]112-varnhart should have known better , so poor as [she]112-varnhart is . Charity begins at [home]289-home , and [these children]1975-these children 's stomachs are empty . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée ran up and then down again gleefully , with [her]101-bébée lapful of big black cherries ; [Tambour]119-tambour , the old white dog , who had used to drag [her]101-bébée about in [[his]119-tambour milk cart]447-his milk cart , leaping on [her]101-bébée in sympathy and congratulation . " What a supper [we]1976-we will have ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée cried to [the charcoal - burner 's children , who were turning somersaults in the dock leaves]448-the charcoal - burner 's children , who were turning somersaults in the dock leaves , while the swans stared and hissed . When [one]1951-one is sixteen , cherries and a cake have a flavor of Paradise still , especially when they are tasted twice , or thrice at most , in all the year . [An old man]450-an old man called to [her]101-bébée as [she]101-bébée went by [his]450-an old man door . [All these little cabins]451-all these little cabins lie close together , with only [their]451-all these little cabins apple - trees , or [their]451-all these little cabins tall beans , or [their]451-all these little cabins hedges of thorn between them ; [you]452-you may ride by and never notice them if [you]452-you do not look for them under the leaves closely , as [you]452-you would for [thrushes ' nests]453-thrushes ' nests . [He]450-an old man , too , was very old ; [a lifelong neighbor and gossip of [Antoine]102-antoine 's]454-a lifelong neighbor and gossip of antoine 's ; [he]450-an old man had been a day laborer in [these same fields]455-these same fields all [his]450-an old man years , and had never travelled farther than where the red mill - sails turned among the colza and the corn . " Come in , [[my]450-an old man pretty one]1977-my pretty one , for a second , "[450-an old man] [he]450-an old man whispered , with an air of mystery that made [Bébée]101-bébée 's heart quicken with expectancy . " Come in ; [I]101-bébée have something for [you]101-bébée . [They]1978-they were [[my]101-bébée dead daughter's]1979-my dead daughter's — [you]452-you have heard [me]101-bébée talk of [her]1979-my dead daughter's — [Lisette]120-lisette , who died forty year or more ago , [they]1978-they say ; for [me]101-bébée [I]101-bébée think it was yesterday . [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs — [she]106-mère krebs is [a hard woman]1980-a hard woman — heard [me]101-bébée talking of [[my]101-bébée girl]1981-my girl . [She]106-mère krebs burst out laughing , ' Lord 's sake , [fool]1982-fool , why , [[your]1982-fool girl]1983-your girl would be sixty now an [she]1979-my dead daughter's had lived . ' Well , so it may be ; [you]452-you see , [the new mill]1984-the new mill was put up the week [she]1979-my dead daughter's died , and [you]452-you call [the new mill]1984-the new mill old ; but , [[my]101-bébée girl]1981-my girl , [she]1979-my dead daughter's is young to [me]101-bébée . Always young . Come here , [Bébée]101-bébée . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée went after [him]456-him a little awed , into the dusky interior , that smelt of stored apples and of dried herbs that hung from the roof . There was a walnut - wood press , such as [the peasants of [France]11-france and [the low countries]458-the low countries]457-the peasants of france and the low countries keep [their]457-the peasants of france and the low countries homespun linen in and [their]457-the peasants of france and the low countries old lace that serves for the nuptials and baptisms of [half a score of generations]459-half a score of generations . [The old man]285-the old man unlocked it with a trembling hand , and there came from it an odor of dead lavender and of withered rose leaves . On the shelves there were [a girl]461-a girl 's set of clothes , and [a girl]461-a girl 's sabots , and [a girl]461-a girl 's communion veil and wreath . " They are all hers , "[285-the old man] [he]285-the old man whispered,—"all [hers]1979-my dead daughter's . And sometimes in the evening time [I]285-the old man see [her]1979-my dead daughter's coming along [the lane]396-the lane for [them]1988-them — do [you]1989-you not know ? There is nothing changed ; nothing changed ; the grass , and the trees , and [the huts]1990-the huts , and [the pond]1991-the pond are all here ; why should [she]1979-my dead daughter's only be gone away ? "[285-the old man] " [Antoine]102-antoine is gone . "[285-the old man] " Yes . But [he]102-antoine was old ; [[my]285-the old man girl]1981-my girl is young . "[285-the old man] [He]285-the old man stood a moment , with the press door open , a perplexed trouble in [his]285-the old man dim eyes ; the divine faith of love and the mule - like stupidity of ignorance made [him]285-the old man cling to this one thought without power of judgment in it . " [They]1988-them say [she]1979-my dead daughter's would be sixty , "[285-the old man] [he]285-the old man said , with a little dreary smile . " But that is absurd , [you]1989-you know . Why , [she]1979-my dead daughter's had cheeks like [yours]1989-you , and [she]1979-my dead daughter's would run — no lapwing could fly faster over corn . These are [her]1979-my dead daughter's things , [you]1989-you see ; yes — all of them . That is the sprig of sweetbrier [she]1979-my dead daughter's wore in [her]1979-my dead daughter's belt the day before [the wagon]1993-the wagon knocked [her]1979-my dead daughter's down and killed [her]1979-my dead daughter's . [I]285-the old man have never touched the things . But look here , [Bébée]101-bébée , [you]101-bébée are [a good child and true]1994-a good child and true , and like [her]1979-my dead daughter's just a little . [I]285-the old man mean to give [you]101-bébée [her]1979-my dead daughter's silver clasps . They were [her]1979-my dead daughter's great - great - great - grandmother 's before [her]1979-my dead daughter's . [God]108-god knows how old [they]1995-they are not . And [a girl]461-a girl should have some little wealth of that sort ; and for [Antoine]102-antoine 's sake — "[285-the old man] [The old man]285-the old man stayed behind , closing the press door upon the lavender - scented clothes , and sitting down in the dull shadow of [the hut]284-the hut to think of [[his]285-the old man daughter]466-his daughter , dead forty summers and more . Bébée went out with the brave broad silver clasps about [her]466-his daughter waist , and the tears wet on [her]466-his daughter cheeks for a grief not [her]466-his daughter own . To be killed just when [one]1951-one was young , and was loved liked that , and all [the world]370-the world was in its May - day flower ! The silver felt cold to [her]466-his daughter touch — as cold as though it were [the dead girl]469-the dead girl 's hands that held [her]466-his daughter . The garlands that [the children]373-the children strung of daisies and hung about [her]466-his daughter had never chilled [her]466-his daughter so . But [little Jeanne]114-jeanne , [the youngest of [the charcoal - burner 's little tribe]472-the charcoal - burner 's little tribe]471-the youngest of the charcoal - burner 's little tribe , running to meet [her]466-his daughter , screamed with glee , and danced in the gay morning . " Oh , [Bébée]101-bébée ! how [you]101-bébée glitter ! Did [the Virgin]386-the virgin send [you]101-bébée that off [her]386-the virgin own altar ? Let [me]101-bébée see — let [me]101-bébée touch ! Is it made of the stars or of the sun ? "[101-bébée] And [Bébée]101-bébée danced with [the child]377-the child , and the silver gleamed and sparkled , and [all the people]474-all the people came running out to see , and [the milk carts]475-the milk carts were half an hour later for [town]476-town , and the hens cackled loud unfed , and [the men]477-the men even stopped on [their]477-the men way to [the fields]306-the fields and paused , with [their]477-the men scythes on [their]477-the men shoulders , to stare at the splendid gift . " There is not such another set of clasps in [Brabant]3-brabant ; old work [you]101-bébée could make a fortune of in [the curiosity shops in [the Montagne]12-the montagne]1998-the curiosity shops in the montagne , "[118-trine] said [Trine Krebs]118-trine , going up the steps of [[her]118-trine mill house]479-her mill house . " But , all the same , [you]101-bébée know , [Bébée]101-bébée , things off a dead body bring mischance sometimes . "[118-trine] But [Bébée]101-bébée danced with [the child]377-the child , and did not hear . Whose fête day had ever begun like this one of [hers]101-bébée ? [She]101-bébée was [a little poet at heart]481-a little poet at heart , and should not have cared for such vanities ; but when [one]1951-one is only sixteen , and has only a little rough woollen frock , and sits in [the market place]483-the market place or [the lace - room]484-the lace - room , with [other girls]485-other girls around , how should one be altogether indifferent to a broad , embossed , beautiful shield of silver that sparkled with each step [one]1951-one took ? A quarter of an hour idle thus was all , however , that [Bébée]101-bébée or [[her]101-bébée friends]487-her friends could spare at five o'clock on a summer morning , when [the city]225-the city was waiting for [its]225-the city eggs , its honey , its flowers , its cream , and its butter , and [Tambour]119-tambour was shaking [his]119-tambour leather harness in impatience to be off with [his]119-tambour milk - cans . So [Bébée]101-bébée , all holiday though it was , and heroine though [she]101-bébée felt [herself]101-bébée , ran [indoors]489-indoors , put up [her]101-bébée cakes and cherries , cut [her]101-bébée two basketfuls out of [the garden]1940-the garden , locked [[her]101-bébée hut]491-her hut , and went on [her]101-bébée quick and happy little feet along [the grassy paths toward [the city]225-the city]492-the grassy paths toward the city . The sorting and tying up of the flowers [she]101-bébée always left until [she]101-bébée was sitting under the awning in front of [the Broodhuis]494-the broodhuis ; the same awning , tawny as an autumn pear and weather - blown as an old sail , which had served to shelter [Antoine Mäes]102-antoine from heat and rain through all the years of [his]102-antoine life . " Go to [the Madeleine]1999-the madeleine ; [you]101-bébée will make money [there]2000-there , with [your]101-bébée pretty blue eyes , [Bébée]101-bébée , "[337-people] [people]337-people had said to [her]101-bébée of late ; but [Bébée]101-bébée had shaken [her]101-bébée head . Where [she]101-bébée had sat in [her]101-bébée babyhood at [Antoine]102-antoine 's feet , [she]101-bébée would sit so long as [she]101-bébée sold flowers in [Brussels,—here]13-brussels,—here , underneath the shadow of [the Gothic towers that saw [Egmont]121-egmont die]496-the gothic towers that saw egmont die . [Old Antoine]103-antoine had never gone into the grand market that is fashioned after [the Madeleine of [Paris]15-paris]14-the madeleine of paris , and where in [the cool , wet , sweet - smelling halls]497-the cool , wet , sweet - smelling halls , all the flowers of [Brabant]3-brabant are spread in bouquets fit for the bridal of [Una]16-una , and large as the shield of the Red - Cross Knight . [Antoine]103-antoine could not compete with all those treasures of [greenhouse]498-greenhouse and [stove]499-stove . [He]103-antoine had always had [[his]103-antoine little stall]500-his little stall among those which spread [their]501-their tawny awnings and their merry hardy blossoms under the shadow of [the Hôtel de Ville]17-the hôtel de ville , in the midst of the buyings and sellings , the games and the quarrels , the auctions and the Cheap Johns , the mountebank and the marriage parties , that daily and hourly throng [the Grande Place]502-the grande place . Here [Bébée]101-bébée , from three years old , had been used to sit beside [him]103-antoine . By nature [she]101-bébée was as gay as [a lark]503-a lark . [The people]504-the people always heard [her]101-bébée singing as [they]504-the people passed [the garden]1940-the garden . [The children]373-the children never found [their]373-the children games so merry as when [she]101-bébée danced [their]373-the children rounds with [them]373-the children ; and though [she]101-bébée dreamed so much out there in the air among the carnations and the roses , or in [the long , low workroom in [the town]412-the town]507-the long , low workroom in the town , high against the crocketed pinnacles of [the cathedral]509-the cathedral , yet [her]101-bébée dreams , if vaguely wistful , were all bright of hue and sunny in [their]373-the children fantasies . Still , [Bébée]101-bébée had one sad unsatisfied desire : [she]101-bébée wanted to know so much , and [she]101-bébée knew nothing . [She]101-bébée did not care for [the grand gay people]510-the grand gay people . When [the band]511-the band played , and [the park]512-the park filled , and the bright little cafés were thronged with [pleasure seekers]513-pleasure seekers , and [the crowds]514-the crowds flocked hither and thither to [the woods]515-the woods , to [the theatres]516-the theatres , to [the galleries]517-the galleries , to [the guinguettes]122-the guinguettes , [Bébée]101-bébée , going gravely along with [her]101-bébée emptied baskets homeward , envied none of these . When at [Noël]18-noël [the little children]518-the little children hugged [their]518-the little children loads of puppets and sugar - plums ; when at [the Fête Dieu]519-the fête dieu [the whole people]520-the whole people flocked out be - ribboned and vari - colored like any bed of spring anemones ; when in the merry midsummer [the chars - a - bancs]521-the chars - a - bancs trundled away into [the forest]522-the forest with laughing loads of [students]523-students and [maidens]524-maidens ; when in the rough winters [the carriages]525-the carriages left furred and jewelled women at the doors of [the operas]526-the operas or the palaces,—Bébée , going and coming through [the city]225-the city to [[her]101-bébée flower stall or lace work]528-her flower stall or lace work , looked at [them]529-them all , and never thought of envy or desire . [She]101-bébée had [[her]101-bébée little hut]530-her little hut : [she]101-bébée could get [her]101-bébée bread ; [she]101-bébée lived with the flowers ; [the neighbors]371-the neighbors were good to [her]101-bébée , and now and then , on a saint 's day , [she]101-bébée too got [her]101-bébée day in [the woods]515-the woods ; it never occurred to [her]101-bébée that [her]101-bébée lot could be better . But sometimes sitting , looking at the dark old beauty of [the Broodhuis]126-the broodhuis , or at [the wondrous carven fronts of [other Spanish houses]534-other spanish houses]533-the wondrous carven fronts of other spanish houses , or at the painted stories of the cathedral windows , or at the quaint colors of the shipping on [the quay]535-the quay , or at the long dark aisles of trees that went away through [the forest]522-the forest , where [her]101-bébée steps had never wandered,—sometimes [Bébée]101-bébée would get pondering on all this unknown world that lay before and behind and around [her]101-bébée , and a sense of [her]101-bébée own utter ignorance would steal on [her]101-bébée ; and [she]101-bébée would say to [herself]101-bébée , " If only [I]101-bébée knew a little — just a very little ! "[101-bébée] But it is not easy to know even a very little when [you]537-your have to work for [your]537-your bread from sunrise to nightfall , and when [none of [[your]537-your friends]539-your friends]538-none of your friends know how to read or write , and even [[your]537-your old priest]540-your old priest is [one of [a family of [peasants]353-peasants]542-a family of peasants]541-one of a family of peasants , and can just teach [you]537-your the alphabet , and that is all . For [Father Francis]105-father francis could do no more than this ; and all [his]105-father francis spare time was taken up in digging [his]105-father francis cabbage plot and seeing to [his]105-father francis beehives ; and the only books that [Bébée]101-bébée ever beheld were a few tattered lives of saints that lay moth - eaten on a shelf of [[his]105-father francis cottage]544-his cottage . But [Brussels]1-brussels has stones that are sermons , or rather that are quaint , touching , illuminated legends of the Middle Ages , which [those who run]545-those who run may read . [Brussels]1-brussels is [a gay little city that lies as bright within [its]1-brussels [girdle of woodland]547-girdle of woodland as any butterfly that rests upon moss . [The city]225-the city has [its]225-the city ways and wiles of [Paris]15-paris]546-a gay little city that lies as bright within its girdle of woodland as any butterfly that rests upon moss . the city has its ways and wiles of paris . [It]225-the city decks [itself]225-the city with white and gold . [It]225-the city has music under [its]225-the city trees and [soldiers]549-soldiers in [[its]225-the city streets]550-its streets , and [troops]551-troops marching and countermarching along [[its]225-the city sunny avenues]552-its sunny avenues . [It]225-the city has blue and pink , and yellow and green , on [its]225-the city awnings and on [its]225-the city house fronts . [It]225-the city has a merry open - air life on [its]225-the city pavements at little marble tables before little gay - colored cafés . [It]225-the city has gilded balconies , and tossing flags , and comic operas , and [leisurely pleasure seekers]553-leisurely pleasure seekers , and tries always to believe and make [the world]370-the world believe that it is [Paris]15-paris in very truth . But this is only [the [Brussels]1-brussels of [the noblesse]556-the noblesse and [the foreigners]557-the foreigners]555-the brussels of the noblesse and the foreigners . There is [a Brussels that is better than this]558-a brussels that is better than this — [a Brussels]559-a brussels that belongs to the old burgher life , to [the artists]560-the artists and [the craftsmen]561-the craftsmen , to [the master - masons of [the Moyen - âge]563-the moyen - âge]562-the master - masons of the moyen - âge , to the same spirit and soul that once filled [the free men of [Ghent]20-ghent]564-the free men of ghent and [the citizens of [Bruges]21-bruges and the besieged of [Leyden]22-leyden , and the blood of [Egmont]121-egmont and of [Horn]24-horn]565-the citizens of bruges and the besieged of leyden , and the blood of egmont and of horn . Down there by [the water]300-the water - side , where the old quaint walls lean over [the yellow sluggish stream]567-the yellow sluggish stream , and the green barrels of [the [Antwerp]25-antwerp barges]568-the antwerp barges swing against the dusky piles of [the crumbling bridges]569-the crumbling bridges . In [the gray square desolate courts of [the old palaces]571-the old palaces]570-the gray square desolate courts of the old palaces , where in [cobwebbed galleries and silent chambers the Flemish tapestries]572-cobwebbed galleries and silent chambers the flemish tapestries drop to pieces . In [the great populous square]573-the great populous square , where , above [the clamorous and rushing crowds]574-the clamorous and rushing crowds , the majestic front of [the Maison du Roi]416-the maison du roi frowns against the sun , and the spires and pinnacles of [[the burgomaster]576-the burgomaster 's gathering - halls]577-the burgomaster 's gathering - halls tower into the sky in all the fantastic luxuriance of Gothic fancy . Under the vast shadowy wings of angels in the stillness of [the cathedral]509-the cathedral , across [whose sunny aisles]579-whose sunny aisles [some little child]580-some little child goes slowly all alone , laden with lilies for the Feast of [the Assumption]581-the assumption , till [their]580-some little child white glory hides its curly head . In all strange quaint old - world niches withdrawn from [men in silent grass - grown corners]582-men in silent grass - grown corners , where a twelfth - century corbel holds a pot of roses , or a Gothic arch yawns beneath [a wool warehouse]583-a wool warehouse , or a waterspout with a grinning faun 's head laughs in the grim humor of [the Moyen - âge]563-the moyen - âge above the bent head of [a young lace - worker]585-a young lace - worker . In all these , [Brussels]1-brussels , though more worldly than [[her]1-brussels sisters of [Ghent]20-ghent and [Bruges]21-bruges]586-her sisters of ghent and bruges , and far more worldly yet than [[her]1-brussels Teuton cousins of [Freiburg]123-freiburg and [Nürnberg]124-nürnberg]587-her teuton cousins of freiburg and nürnberg , is still in [her]1-brussels own way like as a monkish story mixed up with the Romaunt of the Rose ; or rather like some gay French vaudeville , all fashion and jest , illustrated in old Missal manner with helm and hauberk , cope and cowl , [praying knights]588-praying knights and [fighting priests]589-fighting priests , winged griffins and [nimbused saints]590-nimbused saints , flame - breathing dragons and [enamoured princes]591-enamoured princes , all mingled together in the illuminated colors and the heroical grotesque romance of the Middle Ages . And it was [this side of [the city]225-the city]592-this side of the city that [Bébée]101-bébée knew ; and [she]101-bébée loved [it]592-this side of the city well , and would not leave it for [the market of [the Madeleine]1999-the madeleine]594-the market of the madeleine . [She]101-bébée had [no one]1950-no one to tell [her]101-bébée anything , and all [Antoine]103-antoine had ever been able to say to [her]101-bébée concerning [the Broodhuis]126-the broodhuis was that it had been there in [[his]103-antoine father]597-his father 's time ; and regarding [St. Gudule]125-st. gudule , that [[his]125-st. gudule mother]598-his mother had burned many a candle before [its]126-the broodhuis altars for [a dead brother who had been drowned off [the dunes]600-the dunes]599-a dead brother who had been drowned off the dunes . But [the child]377-the child 's mind , unled , but not misled , had pondered on these things , and [her]101-bébée heart had grown to love them ; and perhaps [no student of Spanish architecture]602-no student of spanish architecture , [no antiquary of [Moyen - âge relics]604-moyen - âge relics]603-no antiquary of moyen - âge relics , loved [St. Gudule]125-st. gudule and [the Broodhuis]126-the broodhuis as [little ignorant Bébée]101-bébée did . There had been a time when [great dark , fierce men]605-great dark , fierce men had builded these things , and made [the place]256-the place beautiful . So much [she]101-bébée knew ; and [the little wistful , untaught brain]607-the little wistful , untaught brain tried to project itself into those unknown times , and failed , and yet found pleasure in the effort . And [Bébée]101-bébée would say to [herself]101-bébée as [she]101-bébée walked [the streets]608-the streets , " Perhaps [some one]1967-some one will come some day who will tell [me]101-bébée all those things . "[101-bébée] Meanwhile , there were the flowers , and [she]101-bébée was quite content . Besides , [she]101-bébée knew [all the people]474-all the people : [the old cobbler]610-the old cobbler , who sat next [her]101-bébée , and chattered all day long like [a magpie]611-a magpie ; [the tinker , who had come up many a summer night to drink a - glass with [Antoine]103-antoine]612-the tinker , who had come up many a summer night to drink a - glass with antoine ; [the Cheap [John]127-john , who cheated [everybody else]613-everybody else , but who had always given [her]101-bébée a toy or a trinket at [every Fête Dieu]614-every fête dieu all the summers [she]101-bébée had known]127-john ; [the little old woman , sour as a crab , who sold rosaries and pictures of saints , and little waxen Christs upon a tray]615-the little old woman , sour as a crab , who sold rosaries and pictures of saints , and little waxen christs upon a tray ; the big dogs who pulled the carts in , and lay panting all day under the rush - bottomed chairs on which [the egg - wives]616-the egg - wives and [the fruit sellers]617-the fruit sellers sat , and knitted , and chaffered ; nay , even [the gorgeous huissier]618-the gorgeous huissier and [the frowning gendarme]619-the frowning gendarme , who marshalled [the folks]620-the folks into order as [they]620-the folks went up for [municipal registries]621-municipal registries , or for [town]476-town misdemeanors,—she knew [them]623-them all ; had known [them]623-them all ever since [she]101-bébée had first trotted in like a little dog at [Antoine]103-antoine 's heels . So [Bébée]101-bébée stayed [there]2000-there . [It]2000-there is , perhaps , [the most beautiful square in [all Northern Europe]626-all northern europe]625-the most beautiful square in all northern europe , with [its]2000-there black timbers , and gilded carvings , and blazoned windows , and majestic scutcheons , and fantastic pinnacles . That [Bébée]101-bébée did not know , but [she]101-bébée loved it , and [she]101-bébée sat resolutely in front of [the Broodhuis]126-the broodhuis , selling [her]101-bébée flowers , smiling , chatting , helping [the old woman]627-the old woman , counting [her]101-bébée little gains , eating [her]101-bébée bit of bread at noonday like [any other market girl]628-any other market girl , but at times glancing up to [the stately towers]629-the stately towers and the blue sky , with a look on [her]101-bébée face that made [the old tinker and cobbler]630-the old tinker and cobbler whisper together , " What does [she]101-bébée see [there?—the dead people]2002-there?—the dead people or [the angels]1960-the angels ? "[101-bébée] The truth was that even [Bébée]101-bébée [herself]101-bébée did not know very surely what [she]101-bébée saw — something that was still nearer to [her]101-bébée than even [this kindly crowd that loved [her]101-bébée]631-this kindly crowd that loved her . That was all [she]101-bébée could have said had [anybody]632-anybody asked [her]101-bébée . But [none]633-none did . [No one]1950-no one wanted to hear what [the dead]635-the dead said ; and for [the angels]1960-the angels , [the tinker]637-the tinker and [the cobbler]638-the cobbler were of opinion that one had only too much of [them]1960-the angels sculptured about everywhere , and shining on all the casements — in reverence be it spoken , of course . " [I]639-one of the hen wives remembered it was [your]101-bébée name - day , [child]2004-child Here are half a dozen eggs , "[639-one of the hen wives] said [one of [the hen wives]640-the hen wives]639-one of the hen wives ; and [the little cross woman with the pedler]641-the little cross woman with the pedler 's tray added a waxen St. [Agnes]128-agnes , colored red and yellow to the very life no doubt ; and the old Cheap [John]127-john had saved [her]101-bébée a cage for the starling ; and [the tinker]637-the tinker had a cream cheese for [her]101-bébée in a vine - leaf , and [the sweetmeat seller]643-the sweetmeat seller brought [her]101-bébée a beautiful gilded horn of sugarplums , and [the cobbler]638-the cobbler had made [her]101-bébée actually a pair of shoes — red shoes , beautiful shoes to go to mass in and be a wonder in to all [the neighborhood]645-the neighborhood . And [they]1960-the angels thronged round [her]101-bébée , and adored the silver waist buckles ; and when [Bébée]101-bébée got fairly to [her]101-bébée stall , and traffic began , [she]101-bébée thought once more that [nobody]1935-nobody 's feast day had ever dawned like [hers]101-bébée . When the chimes began to ring all over [the city]225-the city , [she]101-bébée could hardly believe that [the carillon]648-the carillon was not saying its " Laus Deo "[101-bébée] with some special meaning in its bells of [her]101-bébée . The morning went by as usual ; the noise of the throngs about [her]101-bébée like a driving of angry winds , but no more hurting [her]101-bébée than [the angels on the roof of [St. Gudule]125-st. gudule]649-the angels on the roof of st. gudule are hurt by the storm when it breaks . Hard words , fierce passions , low thoughts , evil deeds , passed by [the child]377-the child without resting on [her]101-bébée ; [her]101-bébée heart was in [her]101-bébée flowers , and was like one of them with the dew of daybreak on it . There were [many strangers in [the city]225-the city]651-many strangers in the city , and such are always sure to loiter in [the Spanish square]653-the spanish square ; and [she]101-bébée sold fast and well [her]101-bébée lilacs and [her]101-bébée roses , and [her]101-bébée knots of thyme and sweetbrier . [She]101-bébée was always a little sorry to see [them]654-them go , [[her]101-bébée kindly pretty playmates that , nine times out of ten no doubt , only drooped and died in the hands that purchased [them]654-them , as [human souls]656-human souls soil and shrivel in the grasp of the passions that woo [them]654-them]655-her kindly pretty playmates that , nine times out of ten no doubt , only drooped and died in the hands that purchased them , as human souls soil and shrivel in the grasp of the passions that woo them . The day was a busy one , and brought in good profit . [Bébée]101-bébée had no less than fifty sous in [her]101-bébée leather pouch when it was over,—a sum of magnitude in [the green lane]657-the green lane by [Laeken]2-laeken . A few of [her]101-bébée moss - roses were still unsold , that was all , when [the Ave Maria]27-the ave maria began ringing over [the town]412-the town and [the people]504-the people dispersed to [[their]504-the people homes]660-their homes or [their]504-the people pleasuring . It was a warm gray evening : [the streets]608-the streets were full ; there were blossoms in all the balconies , and gay colors in all the dresses . [The old tinker]662-the old tinker put [his]662-the old tinker tools together , and whispered to [her]101-bébée , — " [Bébée]101-bébée , as it is [your]101-bébée feast day , come and stroll in [[St. Hubert]129-st. hubert 's gallery]2005-st. hubert 's gallery , and [I]662-the old tinker will buy [you]101-bébée a little gilt heart , or a sugar - apple stick , or a ribbon , and [we]2006-we can see the puppet show afterwards , eh ? "[662-the old tinker] But [the children]373-the children were waiting at [home]289-home : [she]101-bébée would not spend the evening in [the city]225-the city ; [she]101-bébée only thought [she]101-bébée would just kneel a moment in [the cathedral]509-the cathedral and say a little prayer or two for a minute — [the saints]399-the saints were so good in giving [her]101-bébée so many [friends]668-friends . There is something very touching in [the Flemish peasant]669-the flemish peasant 's relation with [[his]669-the flemish peasant Deity]670-his deity . It is all very vague to [him]669-the flemish peasant : a jumble of veneration and familiarity , of sanctity and profanity , without any thought of being familiar , or any idea of being profane . There is a homely poetry , an innocent affectionateness in it , characteristic of [the people]504-the people . [He]669-the flemish peasant talks to [his]669-the flemish peasant good angel [Michael]130-michael , and to [[his]669-the flemish peasant friend]672-his friend that [dear little Jesus]673-dear little jesus , much as [he]669-the flemish peasant would talk to [the shoemaker]674-the shoemaker over the way , or [the cooper 's child in the doorway]675-the cooper 's child in the doorway . It is a very unreasonable , foolish , clumsy sort of religion , this theology in wooden shoes ; it is half grotesque , half pathetic ; [the grandmothers]676-the grandmothers pass it on to [the grandchildren]677-the grandchildren as [they]677-the grandchildren pass the bowl of potatoes round the stove in the long winter nights ; it is as silly as possible , but it comforts [them]677-the grandchildren as [they]677-the grandchildren carry fagots over [the frozen canals]678-the frozen canals or wear [their]677-the grandchildren eyes blind over the squares of lace ; and it has in it the supreme pathos of any perfect confidence , of any utterly childlike and undoubting trust . This had been taught to [Bébée]101-bébée , and [she]101-bébée went to sleep every night in the firm belief that [the sixteen little angels of the Flemish prayer]679-the sixteen little angels of the flemish prayer kept watch and ward over [her]101-bébée bed . For the rest , being poetical , as [these north folks]680-these north folks are not , and having in [her]101-bébée — wherever it came from , [poor little soul]681-poor little soul — a warmth of fancy and a spirituality of vision not at all northern , [she]101-bébée had mixed up [her]101-bébée religion with the fairies of [Antoine]103-antoine 's stories , and the demons in which [the Flemish folks]682-the flemish folks are [profound believers]683-profound believers , and the flowers into which [she]101-bébée put all manner of sentient life , until [her]101-bébée religion was a fantastic medley , so entangled that [poor [Father Francis]105-father francis]684-poor father francis had given up in despair any attempt to arrange it more correctly . Indeed , being of [the peasantry]685-the peasantry [himself]105-father francis , [he]105-father francis was not so very full sure in [his]105-father francis own mind that demons were not bodily presences , quite as real and often much more tangible than saints . Anyway , [he]105-father francis let [her]101-bébée alone ; and [she]101-bébée believed in the goodness of [God]108-god as [she]101-bébée believed in the shining of the sun . [People]337-people looked after [her]101-bébée as [she]101-bébée went through the twisting , [picture - like streets]687-picture - like streets , where sunlight fell still between the peaked high roofs , and lamps were here and there lit in [the bric - à - brac shops]688-the bric - à - brac shops and [the fruit stalls]689-the fruit stalls . [Her]101-bébée little muslin cap blew back like the wings of a white butterfly . [Her]101-bébée sunny hair caught the last sun - rays . [Her]101-bébée feet were fair in the brown wooden shoes . Under the short woollen skirts the grace of [her]101-bébée pretty limbs moved freely . [Her]101-bébée broad silver clasps shone like a shield , and [she]101-bébée was utterly unconscious that [any one]690-any one looked ; [she]101-bébée was simply and gravely intent on reaching [St. Gudule]125-st. gudule to say [her]101-bébée one prayer and not keep [the children]373-the children waiting . [Some one]1967-some one leaning idly over [a balcony in [the street]694-the street that is named after [Mary of Burgundy]131-mary]693-a balcony in the street that is named after mary of burgundy saw [her]101-bébée going thus . [He]1967-some one left [the balcony]695-the balcony and went down [his]1967-some one stairs and followed [her]101-bébée . The sun - dazzle on the silver had first caught [his]1967-some one sight ; and then [he]1967-some one had looked downward at the pretty feet . These are the chances women call [Fate]132-fate . [Bébée]101-bébée entered [the cathedral]509-the cathedral . [It]509-the cathedral was quite empty . Far away at the west end there was [an old custodian asleep on a bench]697-an old custodian asleep on a bench , and [a woman]217-a woman kneeling . That was all . [Bébée]101-bébée made [her]101-bébée salutations to the high altar , and stole on into [the chapel of the Saint Sacrament]699-the chapel of the saint sacrament ; it was the one that [she]101-bébée loved best . [She]101-bébée said [her]101-bébée prayer and thanked [the saints]399-the saints for all [their]399-the saints gifts and goodness , [her]101-bébée clasped hand against [her]101-bébée silver shield , [her]101-bébée basket on the pavement by [her]101-bébée , abovehead the sunset rays streaming purple and crimson and golden through the painted windows that are the wonder of [the world]370-the world . When [her]101-bébée prayer was done [she]101-bébée still kneeled there ; [her]101-bébée head thrown back to watch the light , [her]101-bébée hands clasped still , and on [her]101-bébée upturned face the look that made [the people]504-the people say , " What does [she]101-bébée see?—the angels or the dead ? "[504-the people] [She]101-bébée forgot everything . [She]101-bébée forgot the cherries at [home]289-home , and [the children]373-the children even .
