[She]101-bébée was looking upward at the stories of the painted panes ; [she]101-bébée was listening to the message of the dying sun - rays ; [she]101-bébée was feeling vaguely , wistfully , unutterably the tender beauty of [the sacred place]705-the sacred place and the awful wonder of [the world]370-the world in which [she]101-bébée with [her]101-bébée sixteen years was all alone , like a little blue corn - flower among the wheat that goes for grist and the barley that makes [men]707-men drunk . For [she]101-bébée was alone , though [she]101-bébée had so many [friends]668-friends . Quite alone sometimes ; for [God]108-god had been cruel to [her]101-bébée , and had made [her]101-bébée a lark without song . When the sun faded and the beautiful casements lost all glow and meaning , [Bébée]101-bébée rose with a startled look — had [she]101-bébée been dreaming?—was it night?—would [the children]373-the children be sorry , and go supperless to bed ? " Have [you]101-bébée a rosebud left to sell to [me]710-a man ? "[710-a man] [a man]710-a man 's voice said not far off ; it was low and sweet , as became [the Sacrament Chapel]28-the sacrament chapel . [Bébée]101-bébée looked up ; [she]101-bébée did not quite know what [she]101-bébée saw : only dark eyes smiling into [hers]101-bébée . By the instinct of habit [she]101-bébée sought in [her]101-bébée basket and found three moss - roses . [She]101-bébée held them out to [him]710-a man . " [I]101-bébée do not sell flowers here , but [I]101-bébée will give them to [you]710-a man , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said , in [her]101-bébée pretty grave childish fashion . " [I]711-the stranger often want flowers , "[711-the stranger] said [the stranger]711-the stranger , as [he]710-a man took the buds . " Where do [you]710-a man sell yours?—in [the market]272-the market ? "[711-the stranger] " In [the Grande Place]502-the grande place . "[101-bébée] " Will [you]710-a man tell [me]101-bébée [your]710-a man name , [pretty one]2009-pretty one ? "[101-bébée] " [I]337-people am [Bébée]101-bébée . "[337-people] There were [people]337-people coming into [the church]246-the church . The bells were booming abovehead for vespers . There was a shuffle of chairs and a stir of feet . [Boys in white]714-boys in white went to and fro , lighting the candles . Great clouds of shadow drifted up into the roof and hid [the angels]1960-the angels . [She]101-bébée nodded [her]101-bébée little head to [him]710-a man . " Good night ; [I]101-bébée can not stay . [I]101-bébée have a cake at [home]289-home to - night , and [the children]373-the children are waiting . "[101-bébée] " Ah ! that is important , no doubt , indeed . Will [you]710-a man buy some more cakes for [the children]373-the children from [me]710-a man ? "[710-a man] [He]710-a man slid a gold piece in [her]101-bébée hand . [She]101-bébée looked at it in amaze . In [the green lanes]716-the green lanes by [Laeken]2-laeken [no one]1950-no one ever saw gold . Then [she]101-bébée gave it [him]710-a man back . " [I]101-bébée will not take money in [church]2013-church , nor anywhere , except what the flowers are worth . Good night . "[101-bébée] [He]710-a man followed [her]101-bébée , and held back the heavy oak door for [her]101-bébée , and went out into the air with [her]101-bébée . It was dark already , but in [the square]718-the square there was still the cool bright primrose - colored evening light . [Bébée]101-bébée 's wooden shoes went pattering down the sloping and uneven stones . [Her]101-bébée little gray figure ran quickly through the deep shade cast from [the towers]719-the towers and walls . [Her]101-bébée dreams had drifted away . [She]101-bébée was thinking of [the children]373-the children and the cake . " [You]710-a man are in such a hurry because of the cake ? "[710-a man] said [[her]101-bébée new customer]721-her new customer , as [he]710-a man followed [her]101-bébée . [Bébée]101-bébée looked back at [him]710-a man with a smile in [her]101-bébée blue eyes . " Yes , [they]373-the children will be waiting , [you]710-a man know , and there are cherries too . "[101-bébée] " It is a grand day with [you]710-a man , then ? "[101-bébée] " It is [my]101-bébée fête day : [I]101-bébée am sixteen . "[101-bébée] [She]101-bébée was proud of this . [She]101-bébée told it to the very dogs in [the street]694-the street . " Ah , [you]710-a man feel old , [I]101-bébée dare say ? "[101-bébée] " Oh , quite old ! [They]373-the children can not call [me]101-bébée [a child]334-a child any more . "[101-bébée] " Of course not , it would be ridiculous . Are those presents in [your]710-a man basket ? "[101-bébée] " Yes , every one of them . "[101-bébée] [She]101-bébée paused a moment to lift the dead vine - leaves , and show [him]710-a man the beautiful shining red shoes . " Look ! [old Gringoire]133-bac gave [me]101-bébée these . [I]101-bébée shall wear them at mass next Sunday . [I]101-bébée never had a pair of shoes in [my]101-bébée life . "[101-bébée] " But how will [you]710-a man wear shoes without stockings ? "[101-bébée] It was a snake cast into [[her]101-bébée Eden]723-her eden . [She]101-bébée had never thought of it . " Perhaps [I]101-bébée can save money and buy some , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée answered after a sad little pause . " But that [I]101-bébée could not do till next year . They would cost several francs , [I]101-bébée suppose . "[101-bébée] " Unless [a good fairy]2015-a good fairy gives them to [you]710-a man ? "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée smiled ; [fairies]724-fairies were real things to [her]101-bébée — relations indeed . [She]101-bébée did not imagine that [he]710-a man spoke in jest . " Sometimes [I]101-bébée pray very much and things come , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said softly . " When [the Gloire de [Dijon]29-dijon]2016-the gloire de dijon was cut back too soon one summer , and never blossomed , and [we]2017-we all thought it was dead , [I]101-bébée prayed all day long for it , and never thought of anything else ; and by autumn it was all in new leaf , and now its flowers are finer than ever . "[101-bébée] " But [you]710-a man watered it whilst [you]710-a man prayed , [I]101-bébée suppose ? "[101-bébée] The sarcasm escaped [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée was wondering to [herself]101-bébée whether it would be vain and wicked to pray for a pair of stockings : [she]101-bébée thought [she]101-bébée would go and ask [Father Francis]105-father francis . By this time [they]725-they were in [the Rue Royale]30-the rue royale , and half - way down [it]30-the rue royale . The lamps were lighted . [A regiment]726-a regiment was marching up [it]30-the rue royale with [a band playing]727-a band playing . The windows were open , and [people]337-people were laughing and singing in some of [them]729-them . The light caught the white and gilded fronts of [the houses]730-the houses . [The pleasure - seeking crowds]731-the pleasure - seeking crowds loitered along in the warmth of the evening . [Bébée]101-bébée , suddenly roused from [her]101-bébée thoughts by the loud challenge of the military music , looked round on [the stranger]711-the stranger , and motioned [him]711-the stranger back . " [Sir,—I]2018-sir,—i do not know [you,—why]2019-you,—why should [you]711-the stranger come with [me]101-bébée ? Do not do it , please . [You]711-the stranger make [me]101-bébée talk , and that makes [me]101-bébée late . "[101-bébée] And [she]101-bébée pushed [her]101-bébée basket farther on [her]101-bébée arm , and nodded to [him]711-the stranger and ran off — as fleetly as a hare through fern — among [the press of [the people]504-the people]733-the press of the people . " To - morrow , [little one]1934-little one , "[711-the stranger] [he]711-the stranger answered [her]101-bébée with a careless smile , and let [her]101-bébée go unpursued . Above , from the open casement of [a café]735-a café , [some young men]736-some young men and [some painted women]737-some painted women leaned out , and threw sweetmeats at [him]711-the stranger , as in carnival time . " [A new model,—that pretty peasant]2021-a new model,—that pretty peasant ? "[738-they] [they]738-they asked [him]711-the stranger . [He]711-the stranger laughed in answer , and went up the steps to join [them]738-they ; [he]711-the stranger dropped the moss - roses as [he]711-the stranger went , and trod on them , and did not wait . [Bébée]101-bébée ran [home]289-home as fast as [her]101-bébée feet would take [her]101-bébée . [The children]373-the children were all gathered about [her]101-bébée gate in the dusky dewy evening ; [they]373-the children met [her]101-bébée with shouts of welcome and reproach intermingled ; [they]373-the children had been watching for [her]101-bébée since first the sun had grown low and red , and now the moon was risen . But [they]373-the children forgave [her]101-bébée when [they]373-the children saw the splendor of [her]101-bébée presents , and [she]101-bébée showered out among [them]373-the children [Père Melchior]134-père melchior 's horn of comfits . [They]373-the children dashed into [the hut]284-the hut ; [they]373-the children dragged the one little table out among the flowers ; the cherries and cake were spread on it ; and [[the miller]442-the miller 's wife]443-the miller 's wife had given a big jug of milk , and [Father Francis]105-father francis [himself]105-father francis had sent some honeycomb . The early roses were full of scent in the dew ; the great gillyflowers breathed\out fragrance in the dusk ; [the goat]744-the goat came and nibbled the sweetbrier unrebuked ; [the children]373-the children repeated the Flemish bread - grace , with clasped hands and reverent eyes , " Oh , [dear little Jesus]673-dear little jesus , come and sup with [us]373-the children , and bring [[your]673-dear little jesus beautiful Mother]2023-your beautiful mother , too ; [we]373-the children will not forget [you]673-dear little jesus are [God]108-god . "[373-the children] Then , that said , [they]373-the children ate , and drank , and laughed , and picked cherries from each other 's mouths like little blackbirds ; the big white dog gnawed a crust at [their]373-the children feet ; [old Krebs who had a fiddle , and could play it , came out and trilled [them]373-the children rude and ready Flemish tunes , such as [Teniers]135-mieris or [Mieris]135-mieris might have jumped to before]135-mieris [an alehouse at [the Kermesse]7-the kermesse]746-an alehouse at the kermesse ; [Bébée]101-bébée and [the children]373-the children joined hands , and danced round together in the broad white moonlight , on the grass by the water - side ; [the idlers]748-the idlers came and sat about , [the women]346-the women netting or spinning , and [the men]477-the men smoking a pipe before bedtime ; the rough hearty Flemish bubbled like a brook in gossip , or rung like a horn over a jest ; [Bébée]101-bébée and [the children]373-the children , tired of [their]373-the children play , grew quiet , and chanted together the " Ave Maria Stella Virginis "[373-the children] ; a nightingale among the willows sang to the sleeping swans . All was happy , quiet , homely ; lovely also in its simple way . [They]373-the children went early to [their]373-the children beds , as [people]337-people must do who rise at dawn . [Bébée]101-bébée leaned out a moment from [her]101-bébée own little casement ere [she]101-bébée too went to rest . Through an open lattice there sounded the murmur of [some little child]580-some little child 's prayer ; the wind sighed among the willows ; [the nightingales]754-the nightingales sang on in the dark — all was still . Hard work awaited [her]101-bébée on the morrow , and on all the other days of the year . [She]101-bébée was only [a little peasant]755-a little peasant — [she]101-bébée must sweep , and spin , and dig , and delve , to get daily [her]101-bébée bit of black bread,—but that night [she]101-bébée was as happy as [a little princess]756-a little princess in a fairy tale ; happy in [[her]101-bébée playmates]757-her playmates , in [her]101-bébée flowers , in [her]101-bébée sixteen years , in [her]101-bébée red shoes , in [her]101-bébée silver buckles , because [she]101-bébée was half [a woman]217-a woman ; happy in the dewy leaves , in the singing birds , in the hush of the night , in the sense of rest , in the fragrance of flowers , in the drifting changes of moon and cloud ; happy because [she]101-bébée was half [a woman]217-a woman , because [she]101-bébée was half [a poet]1966-a poet , because [she]101-bébée was wholly [a poet]1966-a poet . " Oh , [dear swans]2024-dear swans , how good it is to be sixteen!—how good it is to live at all!—do [you]2024-dear swans not tell the willows so ? "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée to the gleam of silver under the dark leaves by the water 's side , which showed [her]101-bébée where [[her]101-bébée friends]487-her friends were sleeping , with [their]487-her friends snowy wings closed over [their]487-her friends stately heads , and the veiled gold and ruby of [their]487-her friends eyes . [The swans]763-the swans did not awake to answer . Only [the nightingale]764-the nightingale answered from the willows , with [Desdemona]136-desdemona 's song . But [Bébée]101-bébée had never heard of [Desdemona]136-desdemona , and [the willows]765-the willows had no sigh for [her]101-bébée . " Good night ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said , softly , to all the green dewy sleeping world , and then [she]101-bébée lay down and slept [herself.—The nightingale]766-herself.—the nightingale sang on , and the willows trembled . " If [I]101-bébée could save a centime a day , [I]101-bébée could buy a pair of stockings this time next year , "[101-bébée] thought [Bébée]101-bébée , locking [her]101-bébée shoes with [her]101-bébée other treasures in [her]101-bébée drawer the next morning , and taking [her]101-bébée broom and pail to wash down [[her]101-bébée little palace]767-her little palace . But a centime a day is a great deal in [Brabant]3-brabant , when one has not always enough for bare bread , and when , in the long chill winter , [one]1951-one must weave thread lace all through the short daylight for next to nothing at all ; for there are so many women in [Brabant]3-brabant , and [every one of [them]770-them]769-every one of them , young or old , can make lace , and if [one]1951-one do not like the pitiful wage , one may leave it and go and die , for what [the master lacemakers]772-the master lacemakers care or know ; there will always be enough , many more than enough , to twist the thread round the bobbins , and weave the bridal veils , and the trains for the courts . " And besides , if [I]101-bébée can save a centime , [the Varnhart children]2025-the varnhart children ought to have it , "[101-bébée] thought [Bébée]101-bébée , as [she]101-bébée swept the dust together . It was so selfish of [her]101-bébée to be dreaming about a pair of stockings , when those little things often went for days on a stew of nettles . So [she]101-bébée looked at [her]101-bébée own pretty feet,—pretty and slender , and arched , rosy , and fair , and uncramped by the pressure of leather,—and resigned [her]101-bébée day - dream with a brave heart , as [she]101-bébée put up [her]101-bébée broom and went out to weed , and hoe , and trim , and prune [the garden]1940-the garden that had been for once neglected the night before . " [One]1951-one could not move half so easily in stockings , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée thought with true philosophy as [she]101-bébée worked among the black , fresh , sweet - smelling mould , and kissed a rose now and then as [she]101-bébée passed one . When [she]101-bébée got into [the city]225-the city that day , [her]101-bébée rush - bottomed chair , which was always left upside down in case rain should fall in the night , was set ready for [her]101-bébée , and on its seat was a gay , gilded box , such as [rich people]775-rich people give away full of bonbons . [Bébée]101-bébée stood and looked from the box to [the Broodhuis]494-the broodhuis , from [the Broodhuis]494-the broodhuis to the box ; [she]101-bébée glanced around , but [no one]1950-no one had come there so early as [she]101-bébée , except [the tinker , who was busy quarrelling with [[his]779-the tinker , who was busy quarrelling with his wife and letting his smelting fire burn a hole in his breeches wife]240-his wife and letting [his]779-the tinker , who was busy quarrelling with his wife and letting his smelting fire burn a hole in his breeches smelting fire burn a hole in [his]779-the tinker , who was busy quarrelling with his wife and letting his smelting fire burn a hole in his breeches breeches]779-the tinker , who was busy quarrelling with his wife and letting his smelting fire burn a hole in his breeches . " The box was certainly for [her]101-bébée , since it was set upon [her]101-bébée chair?"—Bébée[779-the tinker , who was busy quarrelling with his wife and letting his smelting fire burn a hole in his breeches] pondered a moment ; then little by little opened the lid . Within , on a nest of rose - satin , were two pair of silk stockings!—real silk!—with the prettiest clocks worked up their sides in color ! [Bébée]101-bébée gave a little scream , and stood still , the blood hot in [her]101-bébée cheeks ; [no one]1950-no one heard [her]101-bébée , [[the tinker]637-the tinker 's wife , who alone was near , having just wished [Heaven]137-heaven to send a judgment on [[her]783-the tinker 's wife , who alone was near , having just wished heaven to send a judgment on her husband husband]784-her husband]783-the tinker 's wife , who alone was near , having just wished heaven to send a judgment on her husband , was busy putting out [his]784-her husband smoking smallclothes . It is a way that [women]785-women and [wives]786-wives have , and [they]787-they never see the bathos of it . [The place]256-the place filled gradually . [The customary crowds]789-the customary crowds gathered . The business of the day began underneath the multitudinous tones of the chiming bells . [Bébée]101-bébée 's business began too ; [she]101-bébée put the box behind [her]101-bébée with a beating heart , and tied up [her]101-bébée flowers . It was [the fairies]398-the fairies , of course ! but [they]398-the fairies had never set a rush - bottomed chair on [its]791-its legs before , and this action of theirs frightened [her]101-bébée . It was rather an empty morning . [She]101-bébée sold little , and there was the more time to think . About an hour after noon a voice addressed [her]101-bébée , — " Have [you]101-bébée more moss - roses for [me]101-bébée ? "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée looked up with a smile , and found some . It was [[her]101-bébée companion of [the cathedral]509-the cathedral]792-her companion of the cathedral . [She]101-bébée had thought much of the red shoes and the silver clasps , but [she]101-bébée had thought nothing at all of [him]792-her companion of the cathedral . " [You]101-bébée are not too proud to be paid to - day ? "[792-her companion of the cathedral] [he]792-her companion of the cathedral said , giving [her]101-bébée a silver franc ; [he]792-her companion of the cathedral would not alarm [her]101-bébée with any more gold ; [she]101-bébée thanked [him]792-her companion of the cathedral , and slipped it in [her]101-bébée little leathern pouch , and went on sorting some clove - pinks . " [You]101-bébée do not seem to remember [me]792-her companion of the cathedral ? "[792-her companion of the cathedral] [he]792-her companion of the cathedral said , with a little sadness . " Oh , [I]101-bébée remember [you]792-her companion of the cathedral , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , lifting [her]101-bébée frank eyes . " But [you]792-her companion of the cathedral know [I]101-bébée speak to [so many people]2027-so many people , and [they]2027-so many people are all nothing to [me]101-bébée . "[101-bébée] " Who is anything to [you]792-her companion of the cathedral ? "[792-her companion of the cathedral] It was softly and insidiously spoken , but it awoke no echo . " [[Varnhart]112-varnhart 's children]2028-varnhart 's children , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée answered [him]792-her companion of the cathedral , instantly . " And old Annémie by [the wharfside]2029-the wharfside — and [Tambour]119-tambour — and [[Antoine]103-antoine 's grave]2030-antoine 's grave — and the starling — and , of course , above all , the flowers . "[101-bébée] " And the fairies , [I]101-bébée suppose?—though [they]2028-varnhart 's children do nothing for [you]792-her companion of the cathedral . "[101-bébée] [She]101-bébée looked at [him]792-her companion of the cathedral eagerly , — " [They]2028-varnhart 's children have done something to - day . [I]101-bébée have found a box , and some stockings — such beautiful stockings ! Silk ones ! Is it not very odd ? "[101-bébée] " It is more odd [they]2028-varnhart 's children should have forgotten [you]792-her companion of the cathedral so long . May [I]101-bébée see [them]2028-varnhart 's children ? "[101-bébée] " [I]101-bébée can not show them to [you]792-her companion of the cathedral now . [Those ladies]2031-those ladies are going to buy . But [you]792-her companion of the cathedral can see [them]2028-varnhart 's children later — if [you]792-her companion of the cathedral wait . "[101-bébée] " [I]101-bébée will wait and paint [the Broodhuis]126-the broodhuis . "[101-bébée] " [So many people]2027-so many people do that ; [you]792-her companion of the cathedral are [a painter]2033-a painter then ? "[101-bébée] " Yes — in a way . "[792-her companion of the cathedral] [He]792-her companion of the cathedral sat down on an edge of the stall , and spread [his]792-her companion of the cathedral things there , and sketched , whilst the traffic went on around [them]794-them . [He]792-her companion of the cathedral was very many years older than [she]795-she ; handsome , with a dark , and changeful , and listless face ; [he]792-her companion of the cathedral wore brown velvet , and had a red ribbon at [his]792-her companion of the cathedral throat ; [he]792-her companion of the cathedral looked a little as [Egmont]121-egmont might have done when wooing [Claire]138-claire . [Bébée]101-bébée , as [she]795-she sold the flowers and took the change fifty times in the hour , glanced at [him]792-her companion of the cathedral now and then , and watched the movements of [his]792-her companion of the cathedral hands , [she]795-she could not have told why . Always among [men]707-men and [women]785-women , always in the crowds of [the streets]608-the streets , [people]337-people were nothing to [her]795-she ; [she]795-she went through [them]337-people as through a field of standing corn,—only in [the field]800-the field [she]795-she would have tarried for poppies , and in [the town]412-the town [she]795-she tarried for [no one]1950-no one . [She]795-she dealt with [men]707-men as with [women]785-women , simply , truthfully , frankly , with the innocent fearlessness of [a child]334-a child . When [they]707-men told [her]795-she [she]795-she was pretty , [she]795-she smiled ; it was just as [they]707-men said that [her]795-she flowers were sweet . But [this man]806-this man 's hands moved so swiftly ; and as [she]795-she saw [her]795-she Broodhuis growing into color and form beneath them , [she]795-she could not choose but look now and then , and twice [she]795-she gave [her]795-she change wrong . [He]806-this man spoke to [her]795-she rarely , and sketched on and on in rapid bold strokes the quaint graces and massive richness of [the Maison du Roi]416-the maison du roi . There is [no crowd]808-no crowd so busy in [Brabant]3-brabant that it will not find leisure to stare . [The Fleming]139-the fleming or [the Walloon]33-the walloon has nothing of [the Frenchman]140-the frenchman 's courtesy ; [he]806-this man is rough and rude ; [he]806-this man remains [a peasant]809-a peasant even when [town]476-town bred , and the surly insolence of [the " Gueux "]2034-the " gueux "[2034-the " gueux "] is in [him]806-this man still . [He]806-this man is kindly to [[his]806-this man fellows]811-his fellows , though not to [beasts]812-beasts ; [he]806-this man is shrewd , patient , thrifty , industrious , and good in very many ways , but civil never . [A good score of [them]814-them]813-a good score of them left off [their]813-a good score of them occupations and clustered round [the painter]815-the painter , staring , chattering , pushing , pointing , as though a brush had never been seen in all [the land of [Rubens]151-rubens]816-the land of rubens . [Bébée]101-bébée , ashamed of [[her]101-bébée people]817-her people , got up from [her]101-bébée chair and rebuked [them]817-her people . " Oh , [men of [Brussels]1-brussels]2035-men of brussels ; fie then for shame ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée called to [them]817-her people as clearly as a robin sings . " Did never [you]817-her people see a drawing before ? and are there not [saints]2036-saints and [martyrs enough]2037-martyrs enough to look at in [the galleries]517-the galleries ? and have [you]817-her people never some better thing to do than to gape wide - mouthed at [a stranger]2039-a stranger ? What laziness — ah ! Just worthy of [a people who sleep and smoke]2040-a people who sleep and smoke while [their]2040-a people who sleep and smoke dogs work for [them]2040-a people who sleep and smoke ! Go away , all of [you]817-her people ; look , there comes [the gendarme]2041-the gendarme — it will be the worse for [you]817-her people . [Sir]2042-sir , sit under [[my]101-bébée stall]2043-my stall ; [they]504-the people will not dare trouble [you]817-her people then . "[101-bébée] [He]818-him moved under the awning , thanking [her]101-bébée with a smile ; and [the people]504-the people , laughing , shuffled unwillingly aside and let [him]818-him paint on in peace . It was only [little Bébée]101-bébée , but [they]504-the people had spoilt [the child]377-the child from [her]377-the child infancy , and were used to obey [her]377-the child . [The painter]815-the painter took a long time . [He]815-the painter set about it with the bold ease of one used to all the intricacies of form and color , and [he]815-the painter had the skill of [a master]822-a master . But [he]815-the painter spent more than half the time looking idly at the humors of [the populace]823-the populace or watching how the treasures of [[Bébée]101-bébée 's garden]824-bébée 's garden went away one by one in the hands of [strangers]825-strangers . Meanwhile , ever and again , sitting on the edge of [[her]101-bébée stall]826-her stall , with [his]818-him colors and brushes tossed out on the board , [he]818-him talked to [her]101-bébée , and , with the soft imperceptible skill of long practice in those arts , [he]818-him drew out the details of [her]101-bébée little simple life . There were not always [people]337-people to buy , and whilst [she]101-bébée rested and sheltered the flowers from the sun , [she]101-bébée answered [him]818-him willingly , and in one of [her]101-bébée longer rests showed [him]818-him the wonderful stockings . " Do [you]818-him think it could be the fairies ? "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée asked [him]818-him a little doubtfully . It was easy to make [her]101-bébée believe any fantastical nonsense ; but [her]101-bébée fairies were ethereal divinities . [She]101-bébée could scarcely believe that [they]828-they had laid that box on [her]101-bébée chair . " Impossible to doubt it ! "[818-him] [he]818-him replied , unhesitatingly . " Given a belief in fairies at all , why should there be any limit to what [they]398-the fairies can do ? It is the same with [the saints]399-the saints , is it not ? "[818-him] " Yes , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , thoughtfully . [The saints]399-the saints were mixed up in [her]101-bébée imagination with [the fairies]398-the fairies in an intricacy that would have defied the best reasonings of [Father Francis]105-father francis . " Well , then , [you]101-bébée will wear the stockings , will [you]101-bébée not ? Only , believe [me]101-bébée , [your]101-bébée feet are far prettier without them . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée laughed happily , and took another peep in the cosy rose - satin nest . But [her]101-bébée little face had a certain perplexity . Suddenly [she]101-bébée turned on [him]818-him . " Did not [you]818-him put them there ? "[101-bébée] " [I?—never]818-him ! "[101-bébée] " Are [you]818-him quite sure ? "[101-bébée] " Quite ; but why ask ? "[101-bébée] " Because , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , shutting the box resolutely and pushing it a little away,—"because [I]101-bébée would not take it if [you]101-bébée did . [You]101-bébée are [a stranger]2039-a stranger , and a present is a debt , so [Antoine]103-antoine always said . "[101-bébée] " Why take a present then from [the Varnhart children]2025-the varnhart children , or [[your]101-bébée old friend]2047-your old friend who gave [you]101-bébée the clasps ? "[101-bébée] " Ah , that is very different . When [people]337-people are very , very poor , equally poor , [the one with the other]2049-the one with the other , little presents that [they]337-people save for and make with such a difficulty are just things that are a pleasure ; sacrifices ; like [your]101-bébée sitting up with [a sick person]2050-a sick person at night , and then [she]2050-a sick person sits up with [you]101-bébée another year when [you]101-bébée want it . Do [you]101-bébée not know ? "[101-bébée] " [I]101-bébée know [you]831-he talk very prettily . But why should [you]831-he not take [any one else]2051-any one else 's present , though [he]2051-any one else may not be poor ? "[101-bébée] " Because [I]101-bébée could not return it . "[101-bébée] " Could [you]831-he not ? "[101-bébée] The smile in [his]831-he eyes dazzled [her]832-she a little ; it was so strange , and yet had so much light in it ; but [she]832-she did not understand [him]831-he one whit . " No ; how could [I]832-she ? "[832-she] [she]832-she said earnestly . " If [I]832-she were to save for two years , [I]832-she could not get francs enough to buy anything worth giving back ; and [I]832-she should be so unhappy , thinking of the debt of it always . Do tell [me]832-she if [you]831-he put those stockings there ? "[832-she] " No "[831-he] ; [he]831-he looked at [her]832-she , and the trivial lie faltered and died away ; the eyes , clear as crystal , questioned [him]831-he so innocently . " Well , if [I]831-he did ? "[831-he] [he]831-he said , frankly ; " [you]832-she wished for [them]2052-them ; what harm was there ? Will [you]831-he be so cruel as to refuse them from [me]831-he ? "[831-he] The tears sprang into [Bébée]101-bébée 's eyes . [She]832-she was sorry to lose the beautiful box , but more sorry [he]831-he had lied to [her]832-she . " It was very kind and good , "[832-she] [she]832-she said , regretfully . " But [I]832-she can not think why [you]831-he should have done it , as [you]831-he had never known [me]832-she at all . And , indeed , [I]832-she could not take them , because [Antoine]103-antoine would not let [me]832-she if [he]103-antoine were alive ; and if [I]832-she gave [you]831-he a flower every day all the year round [I]832-she should not pay [you]831-he the worth of them , it would be quite impossible ; and why should [you]831-he tell [me]832-she falsehoods about such a thing ? A falsehood is never a thing for [a man]710-a man . "[832-she] [She]832-she shut the box and pushed it towards [him]831-he , and turned to the selling of [her]832-she bouquets . [Her]832-she voice shook a little as [she]832-she tied up a bunch of mignonette and told the price of it . Those beautiful stockings ! why had [she]832-she ever seen them , and why had [he]831-he told [her]832-she a lie ? It made [her]832-she heart heavy . For the first time in [her]832-she brief life [the Broodhuis]126-the broodhuis seemed to frown between [her]832-she and the sun . Undisturbed , [he]831-he painted on and did not look at [her]832-she . The day was nearly done . [The people]504-the people began to scatter . The shadows grew very long . [He]831-he painted , not glancing once elsewhere than at [[his]831-he study]834-his study . [Bébée]101-bébée 's baskets were quite empty . [She]832-she rose , and lingered , and regarded [him]831-he wistfully : [he]831-he was angered ; perhaps [she]832-she had been rude ? [Her]832-she little heart failed [her]832-she . If [he]831-he would only look up ! But [he]831-he did not look up ; [he]831-he kept [his]831-he handsome dark face studiously over the canvas of [the Broodhuis]126-the broodhuis . [She]832-she would have seen a smile in [his]831-he eyes if [he]831-he had lifted them ; but [he]831-he never raised [his]831-he lids . [Bébée]101-bébée hesitated : take the stockings [she]832-she would not ; but perhaps [she]832-she had refused them too roughly . [She]832-she wished so that [he]831-he would look up and save [her]832-she speaking first ; but [he]831-he knew what [he]831-he was about too warily and well to help [her]832-she thus . [She]832-she waited awhile , then took one little red moss - rosebud that [she]832-she had saved all day in a corner of [her]832-she basket , and held it out to [him]831-he frankly , shyly , as a peace offering . " Was [I]831-he rude ? [I]831-he did not mean to be . But [I]831-he can not take the stockings ; and why did [you]831-he tell [me]831-he that falsehood ? "[831-he] [He]831-he took the rosebud and rose too , and smiled ; but [he]831-he did not meet [her]832-she eyes . " Let [us]2054-us forget the whole matter ; it is not worth a sou . If [you]832-she do not take the box , leave it ; it is of no use to [me]831-he . "[831-he] " [I]832-she can not take it . "[832-she] [She]832-she knew [she]832-she was doing right . How was it that [he]831-he could make [her]832-she feel as though [she]832-she were acting wrongly ? " Leave it then , [I]831-he say . [You]832-she are not [the first woman , [[my]831-he dear]2056-my dear , who has quarrelled with a wish fulfilled]2055-the first woman , my dear , who has quarrelled with a wish fulfilled . It is a way [your]832-she sex has of rewarding gods and men.—Here , [[you]832-she old witch]2057-you old witch , here is a treasure - trove for [you]832-she . [You]832-she can sell it for ten francs in [the town]412-the town anywhere . "[831-he] As [he]831-he spoke [he]831-he tossed the casket and the stockings in it to [an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with [a baker]836-a baker 's cart drawn by a dog]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog ; and , not staying to heed [her]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog astonishment , gathered [his]831-he colors and easel together . The tears swam in [Bébée]101-bébée 's eyes as [she]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog saw the box whirled through the air . [She]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog had done right ; [she]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog was sure [she]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog had done right . [He]831-he was [a stranger]2039-a stranger , and [she]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog could never have repaid [him]831-he ; but [he]831-he made [her]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog feel [herself]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog wayward and ungrateful , and it was hard to see the beautiful fairy gift borne away forever by [the chuckling , hobbling , greedy old baker 's woman]838-the chuckling , hobbling , greedy old baker 's woman . If [he]831-he had only taken it [himself]831-he , [she]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog would have been glad then to have been brave and to have done [her]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog duty . But it was not in [his]831-he design that [she]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog should be glad . [He]831-he saw [her]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog tears , but [he]831-he seemed not to see them . " Good night , [Bébée]101-bébée , "[831-he] [he]831-he said carelessly , as [he]831-he sauntered aside from [her]835-an old decrepit woman , who was passing by with a baker 's cart drawn by a dog . " Good night , [[my]831-he dear]2056-my dear . To - morrow [I]831-he will finish [my]831-he painting ; but [I]831-he will not offend [you]831-he by any more gifts . "[831-he] [Bébée]101-bébée lifted [her]101-bébée drooped head , and looked [him]831-he in the eyes eagerly , with a certain sturdy resolve and timid wistfulness intermingled in [her]101-bébée look . " [Sir]2042-sir , see , [you]831-he speak to [me]101-bébée quite wrongly , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said with a quick accent , that had pride as well as pain in it . " Say it was kind to bring [me]101-bébée what [I]101-bébée wished for ; yes , it was kind [I]101-bébée know ; but [you]831-he never saw [me]101-bébée till last night , and [I]101-bébée can not tell even [your]831-he name ; and it is very wrong to lie to [any one]690-any one , even to [a little thing like [me]101-bébée]2062-a little thing like me ; and [I]101-bébée am only [Bébée]101-bébée , and can not give [you]831-he anything back , because [I]101-bébée have only just enough to feed [myself]101-bébée and the starling , and not always that in winter . [I]101-bébée thank [you]831-he very much for what [you]831-he wished to do ; but if [I]101-bébée had taken those things , [I]101-bébée think [you]831-he would have thought [me]101-bébée very mean and full of greed ; and [Antoine]103-antoine always said , ' Do not take what [you]831-he can not pay — not ever what [you]831-he can not pay — that is the way to walk with pure feet . ' Perhaps [I]101-bébée spoke ill , because [they]2063-they spoil [me]101-bébée , and [they]2063-they say [I]101-bébée am too swift to say [my]101-bébée mind . But [I]101-bébée am not thankless — not thankless , indeed — it is only [I]101-bébée could not take what [I]101-bébée can not pay . That is all . [You]2039-a stranger are angry still — not now — no ? "[101-bébée] There was , anxiety in the pleading . What did it matter to [her]839-her what [a stranger]2039-a stranger thought ? And yet [Bébée]101-bébée 's heart was heavy as [he]2039-a stranger laughed a little coldly , and bade [her]839-her good day , and left [her]839-her alone to go out of [the city]225-the city homewards . A sense of having done wrong weighed on [her]839-her ; of having been rude and ungrateful . [She]839-her had no heart for [the children]373-the children that evening . [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs was sitting out before [her]839-her door shelling peas , and called to [her]839-her to come in and have a drop of coffee . [Krebs]106-mère krebs had come in from [Vilvöorde fair]35-vilvöorde fair , and brought a stock of rare good berries with [him]2039-a stranger . But [Bébée]101-bébée thanked [her]839-her , and went on to [[her]839-her own garden]843-her own garden to work . [She]839-her had always liked to sit out on [the quaint wooden steps of [the mill]446-the mill]844-the quaint wooden steps of the mill and under the red shadow of the sails , watching the swallows flutter to and fro in the sunset , and hearing the droll frogs croak in the rushes , while [the old people]846-the old people told [her]839-her tales of the time of how in [their]846-the old people babyhood [they]846-the old people had run out , fearful yet fascinated , to see the beautiful Scots Grays flash by in the murky night , and the endless line of guns and caissons crawl black as a snake through the summer dust and the trampled corn , going out past [the woods]515-the woods to [Waterloo]36-waterloo . But to - night [she]839-her had no fancy for it : [she]839-her wanted to be alone with the flowers . Though , to be sure , they had been very heartless when [Antoine]103-antoine 's coffin had gone past [them]846-the old people , still they had sympathy ; the daisies smiled at [her]839-her with [their]846-the old people golden eyes , and the roses dropped tears on [her]839-her hand , just as [her]839-her mood might be ; the flowers were [closer friends]848-closer friends , after all , than [any human souls]849-any human souls ; and besides , [she]839-her could say so much to [them]846-the old people ! Flowers belong to [fairyland]850-fairyland ; the flowers and the birds and the butterflies are all that [the world]370-the world has kept of its Golden Age ; the only perfectly beautiful things on [earth]269-earth , joyous , innocent , half divine , useless , say [they]853-they who are wiser than [God]108-god . [Bébée]101-bébée went [home]289-home and worked among [her]101-bébée flowers . A little laborious figure , with [her]101-bébée petticoats twisted high , and [her]101-bébée feet wet with the night dews , and [her]101-bébée back bowed to the hoeing and clipping and raking among the blossoming plants . " How late [you]101-bébée are working to - night , [Bébée]101-bébée ! "[855-one or two] [one or two]855-one or two called out , as [they]855-one or two passed the gate . [She]101-bébée looked up and smiled ; but went on working while the white moon rose . [She]101-bébée did not know what ailed [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée went to bed without supper , leaving [her]101-bébée bit of bread and bowl of goat 's milk to make a meal for the fowls in the morning . " [Little ugly , shameful , naked feet]2064-little ugly , shameful , naked feet ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said to [them]855-one or two , sitting on the edge of [her]101-bébée mattress , and looking at [them]855-one or two in the moonlight . They were very pretty feet , and would not have been half so pretty in silk hose and satin shoon ; but [she]101-bébée did not know that : [he]856-he had told [her]101-bébée [she]101-bébée wanted those vanities . [She]101-bébée sat still a long while , [her]101-bébée rosy feet swaying to and fro like two roses that grow on one stalk and hang down in the wind . [The little lattice]857-the little lattice was open ; [the sweet and dusky garden]858-the sweet and dusky garden was beyond ; there was a hand 's breadth of sky , in which a single star was shining ; the leaves of the vine hid all the rest . But for once [she]101-bébée saw none of it . [She]101-bébée only saw [the black Broodhuis]859-the black broodhuis ; the red and gold sunset overhead ; the gray stones , with the fallen rose leaves and crushed fruits ; and in the shadows two dark , reproachful eyes , that looked at [hers]101-bébée . Had [she]101-bébée been ungrateful ? [The little tender , honest heart of [her]101-bébée]860-the little tender , honest heart of her was troubled and oppressed . For once , that night [she]101-bébée slept ill . All the next day [she]101-bébée sat under the yellow awning , but [she]101-bébée sat alone . It was market day ; there were many [strangers]825-strangers . [Flowers]141-flowers were in demand . The copper pieces were ringing against one another all the hours through in [her]101-bébée leathern bag . [The cobbler]638-the cobbler was in such good humor that [he]638-the cobbler forgot to quarrel with [[his]638-the cobbler wife]240-his wife . The fruit was in such plenty that [they]864-they gave [her]101-bébée a leaf - full of white and red currants for [her]101-bébée noonday dinner . And [the people]504-the people split [their]504-the people sides at the Cheap [John]127-john 's jokes ; [he]127-john was so droll . [No one]1950-no one saw the leaks in [his]127-john kettles or the hole in [his]127-john bellows , or the leg that was lacking to [his]127-john milking stool . [Everybody]867-everybody was gay and merry that day . But [Bébée]101-bébée 's eyes looked wistfully over [the throng]868-the throng , and did not find what [they]868-the throng sought . Somehow the day seemed dull , and [the square]718-the square empty . The stones and the timbers around seemed more than ever full of a thousand stories that [they]864-they would not tell [her]101-bébée because [she]101-bébée knew nothing , and was only [Bébée]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée had never known a dull hour before . [She]101-bébée , [a little bright , industrious , gay thing , whose hands were always full of work]870-a little bright , industrious , gay thing , whose hands were always full of work , and whose head was always full of fancies , even in the grimmest winter time , when [she]101-bébée wove the lace in [the gray , chilly workroom]871-the gray , chilly workroom , with the frost on the casements , and the mice running out in [their]864-they hunger over the bare brick floor . [That bare room]872-that bare room was a sad enough place sometimes , when [the old women]873-the old women would bewail how [they]873-the old women starved on the pittance [they]873-the old women gained , and [the young women]874-the young women sighed for [their]874-the young women aching heads and [their]874-the young women failing eyesight , and [the children]373-the children dropped great tears on the bobbins , because [they]373-the children had come out without a crust to break [their]373-the children fast . [She]101-bébée had been sad there often for [others]876-others , but [she]101-bébée had never been dull — not with this unfamiliar , desolate , dreary dulness , that seemed to take all the mirth out of the busy life around [her]101-bébée , and all the color out of the blue sky above . Why , [she]101-bébée had no idea [herself]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée wondered if [she]101-bébée were going to be ill ; [she]101-bébée had never been ill in [her]101-bébée life , being strong as a little bird that has never known cage or captivity . When the day was done , [Bébée]101-bébée gave a quick sigh as [she]101-bébée looked across [the square]718-the square . [She]101-bébée had so wanted to tell [him]878-him that [she]101-bébée was not ungrateful ; and [she]101-bébée had a little moss - rose ready , with a sprig of sweetbrier , and a tiny spray of maidenhair fern that grew under the willows , which [she]101-bébée had kept covered up with a leaf of sycamore all the day long . [No one]1950-no one would have it now . [The child]377-the child went out of [the place]256-the place sadly as the carillon rang . There was only the moss - rose in [her]101-bébée basket , and the red and white currants that had been given [her]101-bébée for [her]101-bébée dinner . [She]101-bébée went along [the twisting , many - colored , quaintly fashioned streets]882-the twisting , many - colored , quaintly fashioned streets , till [she]101-bébée came to [the water - side]883-the water - side . It is very ancient there still , there are all manner of [old buildings]884-old buildings , black and brown and gray , peaked roofs , gabled windows , arched doors , crumbling bridges , twisted galleries leaning to touch the dark surface of [the canal]885-the canal , dusky wharves crowded with barrels , and bales , and cattle , and timber , and all the various freightage that [the good ships]886-the good ships come and go with all the year round , to and from [the ZuyderZee]37-the zuyderzee , and [the Baltic water]887-the baltic water , and [the wild Northumbrian shores]888-the wild northumbrian shores , and the iron - bound [Scottish headlands]889-scottish headlands , and [the pretty gray Norman seaports]890-the pretty gray norman seaports , and [the white sandy dunes of [Holland]38-holland]891-the white sandy dunes of holland , with [the toy towns]892-the toy towns and [the straight poplar - trees]893-the straight poplar - trees . [Bébée]101-bébée was fond of watching [the brigs and [barges]895-barges , that looked so big to [her]101-bébée]894-the brigs and barges , that looked so big to her , with [their]894-the brigs and barges , that looked so big to her national flags flying , and [their]894-the brigs and barges , that looked so big to her tall masts standing thick as grass , and [their]894-the brigs and barges , that looked so big to her tawny sails flapping in the wind , and about [them]894-the brigs and barges , that looked so big to her the sweet , strong smell of that strange , unknown thing , [the sea]896-the sea . Sometimes [the sailors]897-the sailors would talk with [her]101-bébée ; sometimes [some old salt]898-some old salt , sitting astride of a cask , would tell [her]101-bébée [a mariner]899-a mariner 's tale of [far - away lands]900-far - away lands and [mysteries of [the deep]902-the deep]901-mysteries of the deep ; sometimes [some curly - headed cabin - boy]903-some curly - headed cabin - boy would give [her]101-bébée a shell or a plume of seaweed , and try and make [her]101-bébée understand what [the wonderful wild water]904-the wonderful wild water was like , which was not quiet and sluggish and dusky as [this canal]905-this canal was , but was forever changing and moving , and curling and leaping , and making itself now blue as [her]101-bébée eyes , now black as that thunder - cloud , now white as the snow that the winter wind tossed , now pearl hued and opaline as the convolvulus that blew in [[her]101-bébée own garden]843-her own garden . And [Bébée]101-bébée would listen , with the shell in [her]101-bébée lap , and try to understand , and gaze at [the ships]907-the ships and then at the sky beyond [them]907-the ships , and try to figure to [herself]101-bébée those strange countries to which [these ships]908-these ships were always going , and saw in fancy all [the blossoming [orchard province of green]910-orchard province of green [France]11-france]909-the blossoming orchard province of green france , and all [the fir - clothed hills and rushing rivers of [the snow - locked Swedish shore]912-the snow - locked swedish shore]911-the fir - clothed hills and rushing rivers of the snow - locked swedish shore , and saw too , doubtless , [many lands that had [no place at all except in dreamland]914-no place at all except in dreamland , and were more beautiful even than the beauty of [the earth]915-the earth]913-many lands that had no place at all except in dreamland , and were more beautiful even than the beauty of the earth , as [[poets]420-poets ' countries]917-poets ' countries are , to [their]917-poets ' countries own sorrow , oftentimes . But this dull day [Bébée]101-bébée did not go down upon [the wharf]918-the wharf ; [she]101-bébée did not want [the sailors]897-the sailors ' tales ; [she]101-bébée saw the masts and the bits of bunting that streamed from them , and they made [her]101-bébée restless , which [they]897-the sailors had never done before . Instead [she]101-bébée went in at a dark old door and climbed up a steep staircase that went up and up , as though [she]101-bébée were mounting [[St. Gudule]125-st. gudule 's belfry towers]920-st. gudule 's belfry towers ; and at the top of [it]921-it entered [a little chamber in the roof , where one square unglazed hole that served for light looked out upon [the canal]885-the canal , with all [its]885-the canal crowded craft]922-a little chamber in the roof , where one square unglazed hole that served for light looked out upon the canal , with all its crowded craft , from [the dainty schooner yacht]924-the dainty schooner yacht , fresh as gilding and holystone could make [her]101-bébée , that was running for pleasure to [the Scheldt]39-the scheldt , to [the rude , clumsy coal barge]925-the rude , clumsy coal barge , black as night , that bore the rough diamonds of [Belgium]40-belgium to [the snow - buried roofs of [Christiania]41-christiania and [Stromstad]42-stromstad]926-the snow - buried roofs of christiania and stromstad . In [the little dark attic]927-the little dark attic there was [a very old woman in a red petticoat and a high cap , who sat against the window , and pricked out lace patterns with a pin on thick paper]928-a very old woman in a red petticoat and a high cap , who sat against the window , and pricked out lace patterns with a pin on thick paper . [She]928-a very old woman in a red petticoat and a high cap , who sat against the window , and pricked out lace patterns with a pin on thick paper was eighty - five years old , and could hardly keep body and soul together . " Oh , [mother Annémie]2065-mother annémie , look here !
