Will [you]142-annémie never change [your]142-annémie mind , and live with [me]101-bébée , [Annémie]142-annémie ? [I]101-bébée am sure [you]142-annémie would be happy , and [the starling]427-the starling says [your]142-annémie name quite plain , and [he]427-the starling is such a funny bird to talk to ; [you]142-annémie never would tire of [him]427-the starling . Will [you]142-annémie never come ? It is so bright there , and green and sweet smelling ; and to think [you]142-annémie never even have seen it!—and the swans and all,—it is a shame . "[101-bébée] " No , [dear]2076-dear , "[142-annémie] said [old Annémie]142-annémie , eating [her]142-annémie last bunch of currants . " [You]2076-dear have said so so often , and [you]142-annémie are good and mean it , that [I]101-bébée know . But [I]101-bébée could not leave [the water]300-the water . It would kill [me]101-bébée . Out of this window [you]142-annémie know [I]101-bébée saw [my]101-bébée [Jeannot]144-jeannot 's brig go away — away — away — till the masts were lost in the mists . Going with iron to [Norway]43-norway ; the ' Fleur d'Epine ' of [this town]2084-this town , [a good ship]2085-a good ship , and a sure , and [[her]2085-a good ship mate]2086-her mate ; and as proud as might be , and with a little blest [Mary]131-mary in lead round [his]144-jeannot throat . [She]131-mary was to be back in [port]2087-port in eight months , bringing timber . Eight months — that brought Easter time . But [she]131-mary never came . Never , never , never , [you]142-annémie know . [I]101-bébée sat here watching [them]2088-them come and go , and [[my]101-bébée child]2089-my child sickened and died , and the summer passed , and the autumn , and all the while [I]101-bébée looked — looked — looked ; for the brigs are all much alike ; and only [her]131-mary [I]101-bébée always saw as soon as [she]131-mary hove in sight ( because [he]144-jeannot tied a hank of flax to [her]131-mary mizzen - mast ) ; and when [he]144-jeannot was [home]289-home safe and sound [I]101-bébée spun the hank into hose for [him]144-jeannot ; that was a fancy of [his]144-jeannot , and for eleven voyages , one on another , [he]144-jeannot had never missed to tie the flax nor [I]101-bébée to spin the hose . But the hank of flax [I]101-bébée never saw this time ; nor [the brave brig]2091-the brave brig ; nor [[my]101-bébée good man with [his]144-jeannot sunny blue eyes]2092-my good man with his sunny blue eyes . Only one day in winter , when the great blocks of ice were smashing hither and thither , [a coaster]2093-a coaster came in and brought tidings of how off in [the Danish waters]2094-the danish waters [they]2095-they had come on [a water - logged brig]2096-a water - logged brig , and had boarded [her]2096-a water - logged brig , and had found [her]2096-a water - logged brig empty , and [her]2096-a water - logged brig hull riven in two , and [[her]2096-a water - logged brig crew]2097-her crew all drowned and dead beyond any manner of doubt . And on [her]2096-a water - logged brig stern there was [her]2096-a water - logged brig name painted white , the ' Fleur d'Epine , ' of [Brussels]1-brussels , as plain as name could be ; and that was all [we]2098-we ever knew : what evil had struck [her]2096-a water - logged brig , or how [they]2095-they had perished , [nobody]1935-nobody ever told . Only [the coaster]2100-the coaster brought that bit of beam away , with the ' Fleur d'Epine ' writ clear upon it . But [you]2101-you see [I]101-bébée never know [[my]101-bébée man]2102-my man is dead . Any day — who can say?—any one of [those ships]2103-those ships may bring [him]2102-my man aboard of [her]2096-a water - logged brig , and [he]2102-my man may leap out on [the wharf there]2104-the wharf there , and come running up the stairs as [he]2102-my man used to do , and cry , in [his]2102-my man merry voice , ' Annémie , Annémie , here is more flax to spin , here is more hose to weave ! ' For that was always [his]2102-my man homeward word ; no matter whether [he]2102-my man had had fair weather or foul , [he]2102-my man always knotted the flax to [his]2102-my man masthead . So [you]2101-you see , [dear]2076-dear , [I]101-bébée could not leave [here]1953-here . For what if [he]2102-my man came and found [me]101-bébée away ? [He]2102-my man would say it was an odd fashion of mourning for [him]2102-my man . And [I]101-bébée could not do without the window , [you]2101-you know . [I]101-bébée can watch all the brigs come in ; and [I]101-bébée can smell the shipping smell that [I]101-bébée have loved all the days of [my]101-bébée life ; and [I]101-bébée can see [the lads]2107-the lads heaving , and climbing , and furling , and mending [their]2107-the lads bits of canvas , and hauling [their]2107-the lads flags up and down . And then who can [say?—the sea]2108-say?—the sea never took [him]2102-my man , [I]101-bébée think — [I]101-bébée think [I]101-bébée shall hear [his]2102-my man voice before [I]101-bébée die . For [they]2109-they do say that [God]108-god is good . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée , sweeping very noiselessly , listened , and [her]101-bébée eyes grew wistful and wondering . [She]101-bébée had heard the story a thousand times ; always in different words , but always the same little tale , and [she]101-bébée knew how old [Annémie]142-annémie was deaf to all the bells that tolled the time , and blind to all the whiteness of [her]142-annémie hair and all the wrinkles of [her]142-annémie face , and only thought of [[her]142-annémie sea - slain lover]934-her sea - slain lover as [he]934-her sea - slain lover had been in the days of [her]142-annémie youth . But this afternoon the familiar history had a new patheticalness for [her]142-annémie , and as [the old soul]935-the old soul put aside with [her]142-annémie palsied hand the square of canvas that screened the casement , and looked out , with [her]142-annémie old dim sad eyes strained in the longing that [God]108-god never answered , [Bébée]101-bébée felt a strange chill at [her]101-bébée own heart , and wondered to [herself]101-bébée , — " What can it be to care for [another creature like that]2110-another creature like that ? It must be so terrible , and yet it must be beautiful too . Does [every one]2111-every one suffer like that ? "[101-bébée] [She]101-bébée did not speak at all as [she]101-bébée finished sweeping the bricks , and went down - stairs for a metal cruche full of water , and set over a little charcoal on the stove [the old woman]627-the old woman 's brass soup kettle with [her]627-the old woman supper of stewing cabbage . [Annémie]142-annémie did not hear or notice ; [she]101-bébée was still looking out of the hole in the wall on to the masts , and the sails , and the water . It was twilight . From [the barges]937-the barges and [brigs]938-brigs there came the smell of [the sea]896-the sea . [The sailors]897-the sailors were shouting to [each other]318-each other . [The craft]942-the craft were crowded close , and lost in the growing darkness . On the other side of [the canal]885-the canal [the belfries]944-the belfries were ringing for vespers . " Eleven voyages one and another , and [he]2112-he never forgot to tie the flax to the mast , "[142-annémie] [Annémie]142-annémie murmured , with [her]142-annémie old wrinkled face leaning out into the gray air . " It used to fly there,—one could see it coming up half a mile off,—just a pale yellow flake on the wind , like a tress of [my]101-bébée hair , [he]2112-he would say . No , no , [I]101-bébée could not go away ; [he]2112-he may come to - night , to - morrow , any time ; [he]2112-he is not drowned , not [[my]101-bébée man]2102-my man ; [he]2112-he was all [I]101-bébée had , and [God]108-god is good , [they]337-people say . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée listened and looked ; then kissed [the old shaking hand]945-the old shaking hand and took up the lace patterns and went softly out of [the room]2075-the room without speaking . When [old Annémie]142-annémie watched at the window it was useless to seek for any word or sign of [her]142-annémie : [people]337-people said that [she]142-annémie had never been quite right in [her]142-annémie brain since that fatal winter noon sixty years before , when the coaster had brought into port the broken beam of [the good brig]948-the good brig " Fleur d'Epine . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée did not know about that , nor heed whether [her]101-bébée wits were right or not . [She]101-bébée had known the old creature in [the lace - room]484-the lace - room where [Annémie]142-annémie pricked out designs , and [she]101-bébée had conceived a great regard and sorrow for [her]142-annémie ; and when [Annémie]142-annémie had become too ailing and aged to go [herself]142-annémie any longer to [[the lace - maker]950-the lace - maker 's place]951-the lace - maker 's place , [Bébée]101-bébée had begged leave for [her]142-annémie to have the patterns at [home]289-home , and had carried them to and fro for [her]142-annémie for the last three or four years , doing many other little useful services for [the lone old soul]953-the lone old soul as well,—services which [Annémie]142-annémie hardly perceived , [she]142-annémie had grown so used to them , and [her]142-annémie feeble intelligence was so sunk in the one absorbing idea that [she]142-annémie must watch all the days through and all the years through for the coming of [the dead man]954-the dead man and [the lost brig]955-the lost brig . [Bébée]101-bébée put the lace patterns in [her]101-bébée basket , and trotted [home]289-home , [her]101-bébée sabots clattering on the stones . " What it must be to care for [any one like that]2114-any one like that ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée thought , and by some vague association of thought that [she]101-bébée could not have pursued , [she]101-bébée lifted the leaves and looked at [the moss - rosebud]957-the moss - rosebud . It was quite dead . As [she]101-bébée got clear of [the city]225-the city and out on [[her]101-bébée country road]959-her country road , a shadow Fell across [her]101-bébée in the evening light . " Have [you]101-bébée had a good day , [little one]1934-little one ? "[101-bébée] asked a voice that made [her]101-bébée stop with a curious vague expectancy and pleasure . " It is [you]960-her friend ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said , with a little cry , as [she]101-bébée saw [[her]101-bébée friend]960-her friend of the silk stockings leaning on a gate midway in [the green and solitary road that leads to [Laeken]2-laeken]961-the green and solitary road that leads to laeken . " Yes , it is [I]960-her friend , "[960-her friend] [he]960-her friend answered , as [he]960-her friend joined [her]101-bébée . " Have [you]960-her friend forgiven [me]960-her friend , [Bébée]101-bébée ? "[960-her friend] [She]101-bébée looked at [him]960-her friend with frank , appealing eyes , like those of [a child in fault]962-a child in fault . " Oh , [I]101-bébée did not sleep all night ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said , simply . " [I]960-her friend thought [I]960-her friend had been rude and ungrateful , and [I]960-her friend could not be sure [I]960-her friend had done right , though to have done otherwise would certainly have been wrong . "[960-her friend] [He]960-her friend laughed . " Well , that is a clearer deduction than is to be drawn from most moral uncertainties . Do not think twice about the matter , [[my]960-her friend dear]2056-my dear . [I]960-her friend have not , [I]960-her friend assure [you]2056-my dear . "[960-her friend] " No ! "[101-bébée] [She]101-bébée was a little disappointed . It seemed such an immense thing to [her]101-bébée ; and [she]101-bébée had lain awake all the night , turning it about in [her]101-bébée little brain , and appealing vainly for help in it to [the sixteen sleep - angels]963-the sixteen sleep - angels . " No , indeed . And where are [you]2056-my dear going so fast , as if those wooden shoes of [yours]2056-my dear were sandals of [Mercury]146-mercury ? "[960-her friend] " [Mercury]146-mercury — is that [a shoemaker]2117-a shoemaker ? "[960-her friend] " No , [[my]101-bébée dear]2056-my dear . [He]146-mercury did a terrible bit of cobbling once , when [he]146-mercury made [Woman]147-woman . But [he]146-mercury did not shoe [her]147-woman feet with swiftness that [I]101-bébée know of ; [she]147-woman only runs away to be run after , and if [you]2056-my dear do not pursue [her]147-woman , [she]147-woman comes back — always . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée did not understand at all . " [I]101-bébée thought [God]108-god made [women]785-women , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said , a little awe - stricken . " [You]2056-my dear call it [God]108-god . [People]337-people three thousand years ago called it [Mercury]146-mercury or [Hermes]148-hermes . Both mean the same thing,—mere words to designate an unknown quality . Where are [you]964-you going ? Does [[your]964-you home]2121-your home lie here ? "[101-bébée] " Yes , onward , quite far onward , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , wondering that [he]964-you had forgotten all [she]101-bébée had told [him]964-you the day before about [[her]101-bébée hut]491-her hut , [[her]101-bébée garden]413-her garden , and [[her]101-bébée neighbors]967-her neighbors . " [You]964-you did not come and finish [your]964-you picture to - day : why was that ? [I]101-bébée had a rosebud for [you]964-you , but it is dead now . "[101-bébée] " [I]101-bébée went to [Anvers]44-anvers . [You]964-you looked for [me]101-bébée a little , then ? "[101-bébée] " Oh , all day long . For [I]101-bébée was so afraid [I]101-bébée had been ungrateful . "[101-bébée] " That is very pretty of [you]964-you . [Women]785-women are never grateful , [[my]101-bébée dear]2056-my dear , except when [they]785-women are very ill - treated . [[Mercury]146-mercury , whom [we]2125-we were talking of]2124-mercury , whom we were talking of , gave [them]785-women , among other gifts , a dog 's heart . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée felt bewildered ; [she]101-bébée did not reason about it , but the idle , shallow , cynical tone pained [her]101-bébée by its levity and its unlikeness to the sweet , still , gray summer evening . " Why are [you]101-bébée in such a hurry ? "[968-he] [he]968-he pursued . " The night is cool , and it is only seven o'clock . [I]968-he will walk part of the way with [you]101-bébée . "[968-he] " [I]101-bébée am in a hurry because [I]101-bébée have [Annémie]142-annémie 's patterns to do , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , glad that [he]968-he spoke of a thing that [she]101-bébée knew how to answer . " [You]968-he see , [Annémie]142-annémie 's hand shakes and [her]142-annémie eyes are dim , and [she]142-annémie pricks the pattern all awry and never perceives it ; it would break [her]142-annémie heart if [one]1951-one showed [her]142-annémie so , but [the Baës]2127-the baës would not take them as they are ; they are of no use at all . So [I]969-i prick them out [myself]969-i on fresh paper , and [the Baës]2127-the baës thinks it is all [her]142-annémie doing , and pays [her]142-annémie the same money , and [she]142-annémie is quite content . And as [I]969-i carry the patterns to and fro for [her]142-annémie , because [she]142-annémie can not walk , it is easy to cheat [her]142-annémie like that ; and it is no harm to cheat so , [you]2127-the baës know . "[969-i] [He]969-i was silent . " [You]2127-the baës are [a good little girl]2129-a good little girl , [Bébée]101-bébée , [I]969-i can see . "[969-i] [he]969-i said at last , with a graver sound in [his]969-i voice . " And who is this Annémie for whom [you]2127-the baës do so much ? [an old woman]2130-an old woman , [I]969-i suppose . "[969-i] " Oh , yes , quite old ; incredibly old . [[Her]2130-an old woman man]2131-her man was drowned at [sea]2132-sea sixty years ago , and [she]2130-an old woman watches for [his]2131-her man brig still , night and morning . "[969-i] " The dog 's heart . No doubt [he]2131-her man beat [her]2130-an old woman , and had [a wife]2133-a wife in fifty other ports . "[969-i] " Oh , no ! "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , with a little cry , as though the word against [the dead man]954-the dead man hurt [her]101-bébée . " [She]2130-an old woman has told [me]954-the dead man so much of [him]2131-her man . [He]2131-her man was as good as good could be , and loved [her]2130-an old woman so , and between the voyages [they]2134-they were so happy . Surely that must have been sixty years now , and [she]2130-an old woman is so sorry still , and still will not believe that [he]2131-her man was drowned . "[954-the dead man] [He]954-the dead man looked down on [her]101-bébée with a smile that had a certain pity in it . " Well , yes ; there are [women like that]2135-women like that , [I]954-the dead man believe . But be very sure , [[my]954-the dead man dear]2056-my dear , [he]2131-her man beat [her]2130-an old woman . Of the two , one always holds the whip and uses it , the other crouches . "[954-the dead man] " [I]101-bébée do not understand , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée . " No ; but [you]954-the dead man will . "[101-bébée] " [I]954-the dead man will?—when ? "[954-the dead man] [He]954-the dead man smiled again . " Oh — to - morrow , perhaps , or next year — or when [Fate]132-fate fancies . "[954-the dead man] " Or rather , when [I]954-the dead man choose , "[954-the dead man] [he]954-the dead man thought to [himself]954-the dead man , and let [his]954-the dead man eyes rest with a certain pleasure on the little feet , that went beside [him]954-the dead man in the grass , and the pretty fair bosom that showed ever and again , as the frills of [her]101-bébée linen bodice were blown back by the wind and [her]101-bébée own quick motion . [Bébée]101-bébée looked also up at [him]954-the dead man ; [he]954-the dead man was very handsome , and looked so to [her]101-bébée , after the broad , blunt , characterless faces of [the Walloon peasantry around [her]101-bébée]971-the walloon peasantry around her . [He]954-the dead man walked with an easy grace , [he]954-the dead man was clad in picture - like velvets , [he]954-the dead man had a beautiful poetic head , and eyes like deep brown waters , and a face like one of [Jordaens]149-jordaens ' or Rembrandt 's cavaliers in [the galleries where [she]101-bébée used to steal in of a Sunday]972-the galleries where she used to steal in of a sunday , and look up at the paintings , and dream of what [that world]973-that world could be in which [those people]974-those people had lived . " [You]954-the dead man are of [the people of [Rubes]150-rubes ' country]2137-the people of rubes ' country , are [you]954-the dead man not ? "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée asked [him]954-the dead man . " Of [what country]2138-what country , [[my]101-bébée dear]2056-my dear ? "[101-bébée] " Of [the people that live in the gold frames]2140-the people that live in the gold frames , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , quite seriously . " In [the galleries]517-the galleries , [you]954-the dead man know . [I]101-bébée know [a charwoman that scrubs [the floors of [the Arenberg Palace]2144-the arenberg palace]2143-the floors of the arenberg palace]2142-a charwoman that scrubs the floors of the arenberg palace , and [she]2142-a charwoman that scrubs the floors of the arenberg palace lets [me]101-bébée in sometimes to look ; and [you]954-the dead man are just like [those great gentlemen in the gold frames]2145-those great gentlemen in the gold frames , only [you]954-the dead man have not a hawk and a sword , and [they]2145-those great gentlemen in the gold frames always have . [I]101-bébée used to wonder where [they]2145-those great gentlemen in the gold frames came from , for [they]2145-those great gentlemen in the gold frames are not like any of [us]2146-us one bit , and [the charwoman]2147-the charwoman — [she]2147-the charwoman is [Lisa Dredel]120-lisette , and lives in [the street of the Pot d'Etain]2148-the street of the pot d'etain — always said . ' Dear heart , [they]2145-those great gentlemen in the gold frames all belong to [Rubes]150-rubes [' land]2149-' land : [we]2146-us never see [their]2145-those great gentlemen in the gold frames like nowadays . ' But [you]976-i must come out of [[Rubes]150-rubes ' land]2150-rubes ' land ; at least , [I]101-bébée think so , do [you]976-i not ? "[101-bébée] [He]975-he caught [her]976-i meaning ; [he]975-he knew that [Rubes]150-rubes was the homely abbreviation of [Rubens]151-rubens that [all the Netherlanders]977-all the netherlanders used , and [he]975-he guessed the idea that was reality to this little lonely fanciful mind . " Perhaps [I]975-he do , "[975-he] [he]975-he answered [her]976-i with a smile , for it was not worth [his]975-he while to disabuse [her]976-i thoughts of any imagination that glorified [him]975-he to [her]976-i . " Do [you]976-i not want to see [[Rubes]150-rubes ' world]2151-rubes ' world , [little one]1934-little one ? To see the gold and the grandeur , and the glitter of it all?—never to toil or get tired?—always to move in a pageant?—always to live like the hawks in the paintings [you]976-i talk of , with silver bells hung round [you]976-i , and a hood all sewn with pearls ? "[976-i] " No , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , simply . " [I]101-bébée should like to see it , just to see it , as [one]1951-one looks through a grating into [[the king]2154-the king 's grape - houses here]2155-the king 's grape - houses here . But [I]101-bébée should not like to live in [it]2151-rubes ' world . [I]101-bébée love [[my]101-bébée hut]2077-my hut , and the starling , and the chickens , and what would [the garden]1940-the garden do without [me]101-bébée ? and [the children]373-the children , and [the old Annémie]2159-the old annémie ? [I]101-bébée could not anyhow , anywhere , be any happier than [I]101-bébée am . There is only one thing [I]101-bébée wish . "[101-bébée] " And what is that ? "[976-i] " To know something ; not to be so ignorant . Just look — [I]976-i can read a Little , it is true : [my]976-i Hours , and the letters , and when [Krebs]106-mère krebs brings in a newspaper [I]976-i can read a little of it , not much . [I]976-i know French well , because [Antoine]103-antoine was French [himself]103-antoine , and never did talk [Flemish]152-flemish to [me]976-i ; and [they]2160-they being [Netherlanders]2161-netherlanders , can not , of course , read the newspapers at all , and so think it very wonderful indeed in [me]976-i . But what [I]976-i want is to know things , to know all about what was before ever [I]976-i was living . [St. Gudule]125-st. gudule now — [they]2160-they say [it]125-st. gudule was built hundreds of years before ; and [Rubes]150-rubes again — [they]2160-they say [he]150-rubes was [a painter king in [Antwerpen]46-antwerpen]2162-a painter king in antwerpen before [the oldest , oldest woman like [Annémie]142-annémie]2163-the oldest , oldest woman like annémie ever began to count time . [I]976-i am sure books tell [you]2164-you all those things , because [I]976-i see [the students]2165-the students coming and going with [them]2160-they ; and when [I]976-i saw once the millions of books in [the Rue du Musée]2166-the rue du musée , [I]976-i asked [the keeper]2167-the keeper what use they were for , and [he]2167-the keeper said , ' To make [men]707-men wise , [[my]976-i dear]2056-my dear . ' But [Gringoire Bac]133-bac , [the cobbler]638-the cobbler , who was with [me,—it]142-annémie was a fête day,—Bac , [he]133-bac said , ' Do not [you]2164-you believe that , [Bébée]101-bébée ; [they]2160-they only muddle [folks]2171-folks ' brains ; for one book tells [them]2171-folks one thing , and another book another , and so on , till [they]2171-folks are dazed with all the contrary lying ; and if [you]2164-you see [a bookish man]2172-a bookish man , be sure [you]2164-you see [a very poor creature who could not hoe a patch , or kill a pig , or stitch an upper - leather]2173-a very poor creature who could not hoe a patch , or kill a pig , or stitch an upper - leather , were it ever so . ' But [I]976-i do not believe that [Bac]133-bac said right . Did [he]133-bac ? "[976-i] " [I]101-bébée am not sure . On the whole , [I]101-bébée think it is the truest remark on literature [I]101-bébée have ever heard , and one that shows great judgment in [Bac]133-bac . Well ? "[101-bébée] " Well , sometimes , [you]2164-you know , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , not understanding [his]978-his answer , but pursuing [her]101-bébée thoughts confidentially,—"sometimes [I]979-i talk like this to [the neighbors]371-the neighbors , and [they]371-the neighbors laugh at [me]979-i . Because [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs says that when one knows how to spin and sweep and make bread and say [one]1951-one 's prayers and milk a goat or a cow , it is all [a woman]217-a woman wants to know [this side of heaven]2177-this side of heaven . But for [me]979-i , [I]979-i can not help it , when [I]979-i look at those windows in [the cathedral]509-the cathedral , or at those beautiful twisted little spires that are all over [[our]2179-our Hôtel de [Ville]47-ville]2180-our hôtel de ville , [I]979-i want to know who [the men]477-the men were that made them,—what [they]477-the men did and thought,—how [they]477-the men looked and spoke,—how [they]477-the men learned to shape stone into leaves and grasses like that,—how [they]477-the men could imagine all those angel faces on the glass . When [I]979-i go alone in the quite early morning or at night when it is still — sometimes in winter [I]979-i have to stay till it is dark over the lace — [I]979-i hear [their]477-the men feet come after [me]979-i , and [they]477-the men whisper to [me]979-i close , ' Look what beautiful things [we]2179-our have done , [Bébée]101-bébée , and [you]101-bébée all forget [us]2179-our quite . [We]2179-our did what never will die , but [our]2179-our names are as dead as the stones . ' And then [I]979-i am so sorry for [them]477-the men and ashamed . And [I]979-i want to know more . Can [you]980-you tell [me]979-i ? "[979-i] [He]979-i looked at [her]980-you earnestly ; [her]980-you eyes were shining , [her]980-you cheeks were warm , [her]980-you little mouth was tremulous with eagerness . " Did [any one]690-any one ever speak to [you]980-you in that way ? "[979-i] [he]979-i asked [her]980-you . " No , "[980-you] [she]980-you answered [him]979-i . " It comes into [my]981-i head of itself . Sometimes [I]981-i think [the cathedral angels]2183-the cathedral angels put it there . For [the angels]1960-the angels must be tired , [you]980-you know ; always pointing to [God]108-god and always seeing [men]707-men turn away , [I]981-i used to tell [Antoine]103-antoine sometimes . But [he]103-antoine used to shake [his]103-antoine head and say that it was no use thinking ; most likely [St. Gudule]125-st. gudule and [St. Michael]130-michael had set [the church]246-the church down in the night all ready made , why not ? [God]108-god made the trees , and they were more wonderful , [he]103-antoine thought , for [his]103-antoine part . And so perhaps they are , but that is no answer . And [I]981-i do want to know . [I]981-i want some one who will tell [me]981-i ; and if [you]980-you come out of [Rubes]150-rubes [' country]2187-' country as [I]981-i think , no doubt [you]980-you know everything , or remember it ? "[981-i] [He]981-i smiled . " The free pass to [Rubes]150-rubes [' country]2187-' country lies in books , [pretty one]2009-pretty one . Shall [I]981-i give [you]980-you some?—nay , lend [them]2190-them , [I]981-i mean , since giving [you]980-you are too wilful to hear of without offence . [You]980-you can read , [you]980-you said ? "[981-i] [Bébée]101-bébée 's eyes glowed as [they]982-i lifted [themselves]982-i to [his]981-i . " [I]982-i can read — not very fast , but that would come with doing it more and more , [I]982-i think , just as spinning does ; one knots the thread and breaks it a million times before [one]1951-one learns to spin as fine as cobwebs . [I]982-i have read the stories of [St. Anne]153-st. anne , and of [St. Catherine]154-st. catherine , and of [St. Luven]155-st. luven fifty times , but they are all the books that [Father Francis]105-father francis has ; and [no one else]2192-no one else has any among [us]2193-us . "[982-i] " Very well . [You]980-you shall have books of [mine]982-i . Easy ones first , and then those that are more serious . But what time will [you]980-you have ? [You]980-you do so much ; [you]980-you are like a little golden bee . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée laughed happily . " Oh ! give [me]101-bébée the books and [I]101-bébée will find the time . It is light so early now . That gives one so many hours . In winter one has [so few]2194-so few [one]1951-one must lie in bed , because to buy a candle [you]980-you know [one]1951-one can not afford except , of course , a taper now and then , as [one]1951-one 's duty is , for [[our]2193-us Lady]275-our lady or for the dead . And will [you]101-bébée really , really , lend [me]101-bébée books ? "[101-bébée] " Really , [I]982-i will . Yes . [I]982-i will bring [you]980-you one to [the Grande Place]502-the grande place to - morrow , or meet [you]980-you on [[your]980-you road]2200-your road there with it . Do [you]980-you know what poetry is , [Bébée]101-bébée ? "[982-i] " No . "[101-bébée] " But [your]980-you flowers talk to [you]980-you ? "[101-bébée] " Ah ! always . But then [no one else]2192-no one else hears them ever but [me]982-i ; and so [no one else]2192-no one else ever believes . "[982-i] " Well , [poets]420-poets are [folks who hear the flowers]2204-folks who hear the flowers talk as [you]980-you do , and the trees , and [the seas]2205-the seas , and the beasts , and even the stones ; but [no one else]2192-no one else ever hears these things , and so , when [the poets]2207-the poets write them out , the rest of [the world]370-the world say , ' That is very fine , no doubt , but only good for [dreamers]2209-dreamers ; it will bake no bread . ' [I]101-bébée will give [you]980-you some poetry ; for [I]101-bébée think [you]980-you care more about dreams than about bread . "[101-bébée] " [I]101-bébée do not know , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée ; and [she]101-bébée did not know , for [her]101-bébée dreams , like [her]101-bébée youth , and [her]101-bébée innocence , and [her]101-bébée simplicity , and [her]101-bébée strength , were all unconscious of [themselves]983-themselves , as such things must be to be pure and true at all . [Bébée]101-bébée had grown up straight , and clean , and fragrant , and joyous as one of [her]101-bébée own carnations ; but [she]101-bébée knew [herself]101-bébée no more than the carnation knows its color and its root , " No . [you]101-bébée do not know , "[984-he] said [he]984-he , with a sort of pity ; and thought within [himself]984-he , was it worth while to let [her]101-bébée know ? If [she]101-bébée did not know , these vague aspirations and imaginations would drop off from [her]101-bébée with the years of [her]101-bébée early youth , as the lime - flowers drop downwards with the summer heats . [She]101-bébée would forget them . They would linger a little in [her]101-bébée head , and , perhaps , always wake at some sunset hour or some angelus chime , but not to trouble [her]101-bébée . Only to make [her]101-bébée cradle song a little sadder and softer than [most women]985-most women 's was . Unfed , they would sink away and bear no blossom . [She]101-bébée would grow into [a simple , hardy , hardworking , God - fearing Flemish woman like [the rest]313-the rest]986-a simple , hardy , hardworking , god - fearing flemish woman like the rest . [She]101-bébée would marry , no doubt , some time , and rear [[her]101-bébée children]988-her children honestly and well ; and sit in [the market stall]989-the market stall every day , and spin and sew , and dig and wash , and sweep , and brave bad weather , and be content with poor food to the end of [her]101-bébée harmless and laborious days — poor little [Bébée]101-bébée ! [He]984-he saw [her]101-bébée so clearly as [she]101-bébée would be — if [he]984-he let [her]101-bébée alone . A little taller , a little broader , a little browner , less sweet of voice , less soft of skin , less flower - like in face ; having learned to think only as [[her]101-bébée neighbors]967-her neighbors thought , of price of wood and cost of bread ; laboring cheerily but hardly from daybreak to nightfall to fill hungry mouths : forgetting all things except the little curly - heads clustered round [her]101-bébée soup - pot , and the year - old lips sucking at [her]101-bébée breasts . A blameless life , an eventless life , a life as clear as the dewdrop , and as colorless ; a life opening , passing , ending in [the little green wooded lane]991-the little green wooded lane , by [the bit of water]992-the bit of water where the swans made their nests under [the willows]765-the willows ; a life like the life of millions , a little purer , a little brighter , a little more tender , perhaps , than those lives usually are , but otherwise as like them as one ear of barley is like another as it rises from the soil , and blows in the wind , and turns brown in the strong summer sun , and then goes down to the sod again under the sickle . [He]984-he saw [her]101-bébée just as [she]101-bébée would be — if [he]984-he let [her]101-bébée alone . But should [he]984-he leave [her]101-bébée alone ? [He]984-he cared nothing ; only [her]101-bébée eyes had such a pretty , frank , innocent look like a bird 's in them , and [she]101-bébée had been so brave and bold with [him]984-he about those silken stockings ; and this little ignorant , dreamful mind of [hers]101-bébée was so like a blush rosebud , which looks so close - shut , and so sweet - smelling , and so tempting fold within fold , that [a child]334-a child will pull it open , forgetful that [he]334-a child will spoil it forever from being a full - grown rose , and that [he]334-a child will let the dust , and the sun , and the bee into [its]334-a child tender bosom — and [men]707-men are [true children]996-true children , and [women]785-women are [their]707-men rosebuds . Thinking only of keeping well with [this strange and beautiful wayfarer from [that unknown paradise of [Rubes]150-rubes ' country]999-that unknown paradise of rubes ' country]998-this strange and beautiful wayfarer from that unknown paradise of rubes ' country , [Bébée]101-bébée lifted up the vine - leaves of [her]101-bébée basket . " [I]101-bébée took a flower for [you]1000-he to - day , but it is dead . Look ; to - morrow , if [you]1000-he will be [there]2000-there , [you]1000-he shall have the best in all [the garden]1940-the garden . "[101-bébée] " [You]101-bébée wish to see [me]1000-he again then ? "[1000-he] [he]1000-he asked [her]101-bébée . [Bébée]101-bébée looked at [him]1000-he with troubled eyes , but with a sweet frank faith that had no hesitation in it . " Yes ! [you]1000-he are not like anything [I]101-bébée ever knew , and if [you]1000-he will only help [me]101-bébée to learn a little . Sometimes [I]101-bébée think [I]101-bébée am not stupid , only ignorant ; but [I]101-bébée can not be sure unless [I]101-bébée try . "[101-bébée] [He]1000-he smiled ; [he]1000-he was listlessly amused ; the day before [he]1000-he had tempted [the child]377-the child merely because [she]377-the child was pretty , and to tempt [her]377-the child in that way seemed the natural course of things , but now there was something in [her]377-the child that touched [him]1000-he differently ; the end would be the same , but [he]1000-he would change the means . The sun had set . There was a low , dull red glow still on the far edge of [the plains]410-the plains — that was all . In [the distant cottages little lights]1003-the distant cottages little lights were twinkling . [The path]1004-the path grew dark . " [I]1000-he will go away and let [her]377-the child alone , "[1000-he] [he]1000-he thought . " [Poor little soul]681-poor little soul ! it would give itself lavishly , it would never be bought . [I]1000-he will let [it]681-poor little soul alone ; the mind will go to sleep and the body will keep healthy , and strong , and pure , as [people]337-people call it . It would be a pity to play with both a day , and then throw them away as [the boy]2214-the boy threw the pear - blossom . [She]377-the child is a little clod of earth that has field flowers growing in it . [I]1000-he will let [her]377-the child alone , the flowers under the plough in due course will die , and [she]377-the child will be content among the other clods,—if [I]1000-he let [her]377-the child alone . "[1000-he] At that moment there went across [the dark fields]1005-the dark fields , against the dusky red sky , [a young man with a pile of brushwood on [his]1006-a young man with a pile of brushwood on his back , and a hatchet in his hand back , and a hatchet in [his]1006-a young man with a pile of brushwood on his back , and a hatchet in his hand hand]1006-a young man with a pile of brushwood on his back , and a hatchet in his hand . " [You]1007-her are late , [Bébée]101-bébée , "[1000-he] [he]1000-he called to [her]1007-her in Flemish , and scowled at [the stranger by [her]1007-her side]1008-the stranger by her side . " [A good - looking lad]2215-a good - looking lad ; who is it ? "[1000-he] said [[her]1007-her companion]1009-her companion . " That is [Jeannot]144-jeannot , [the son of [old Sophie]156-old sophie]2216-the son of old sophie , "[1007-her] [she]1007-her answered [him]1000-he . " [He]144-jeannot is so good — oh , so good , [you]1000-he can not think ; [he]144-jeannot keeps [[his]144-jeannot mother]598-his mother and [three little sisters]2218-three little sisters , and works so very , very hard in [the forest]522-the forest , and yet [he]144-jeannot often finds time to dig [[my]1007-her garden]2220-my garden for [me]1007-her , and [he]144-jeannot chops all [my]1007-her wood in winter . "[1007-her] [They]1010-they had come to where [the road]1011-the road goes up by [[the king]2154-the king 's summer palace]1013-the king 's summer palace . [They]1010-they were under great hanging beeches and limes . There was a high gray wall , and over it the blossoming fruit boughs hung . In [a ditch full of long grass [little kids]1015-little kids bleated by [[their]1015-little kids mothers]1016-their mothers]1014-a ditch full of long grass little kids bleated by their mothers . Away on the left went [the green fields of colza]1017-the green fields of colza , and beetroot , and trefoil , with big forest trees here and there in [their]1010-they midst , and , against the blue low line of the far horizon , red mill - sails , and gray church spires ; dreamy plaintive bells far away somewhere were ringing [the sad Flemish carillon]1018-the sad flemish carillon . [He]2154-the king paused and looked at [her]1019-her . " [I]2154-the king must bid [you]1019-her good night , [Bébée]101-bébée ; [you]1019-her are near [[your]1019-her home]2121-your home now . "[2154-the king] [She]1019-her paused too and looked at [him]2154-the king . " But [I]1019-her shall see [you]2154-the king to - morrow ? "[1019-her] There was the wistful , eager , anxious unconsciousness of appeal as when the night before [she]1019-her had asked [him]2154-the king if [he]2154-the king were angry . [He]2154-the king hesitated a moment . If [he]2154-the king said no , and went away out of [the city]225-the city wherever [his]2154-the king listless and changeful whim called [him]2154-the king , [he]2154-the king knew how it would be with [her]1019-her ; [he]2154-the king knew what [her]1019-her life would be as surely as [he]2154-the king knew the peach would come out of the peach - flower rosy on the wall there : life in [the little hut]1021-the little hut ; among [the neighbors]371-the neighbors ; sleepy and safe and soulless;—if [he]2154-the king let [her]1019-her alone . If [he]2154-the king stayed and saw [her]1019-her on the morrow [he]2154-the king knew , too , the end as surely as [he]2154-the king knew that the branch of white pear - blossom , which in carelessness [he]2154-the king had knocked down with a stone on the grass yonder , would fade in the night and would never bring forth its sweet , simple fruit in the sunshine . To leave the peach - flower to come to maturity and be plucked by [a peasant]809-a peasant , or to pull down the pear - blossom and rifle the buds ? Carelessly and languidly [he]2154-the king balanced the question with [himself]2154-the king , whilst [Bébée]101-bébée , forgetful of the lace patterns and the flight of the hours , stood looking at [him]2154-the king with anxious and pleading eyes , thinking only — was [he]2154-the king angry again , or would [he]2154-the king really bring [her]1019-her the books and make [her]1019-her wise , and let [her]1019-her know the stories of the past ? " Shall [I]1019-her see [you]2154-the king to - morrow ? "[1019-her] [she]1019-her said wistfully . Should she?—if [he]2154-the king left the peach - blossom safe on the wall , [Jeannot]144-jeannot [the woodcutter]1024-the woodcutter would come by and by and gather the fruit . If [he]2154-the king left the clod of earth in [its]1025-its pasture with all its daisies untouched , [this black - browed young peasant]1026-this black - browed young peasant would cut it round with [his]1026-this black - browed young peasant hatchet and carry it to [his]1026-this black - browed young peasant wicker cage , that [the homely brown lark of [his]1026-this black - browed young peasant love]1027-the homely brown lark of his love might sing to it some stupid wood note under [a cottage eave]1028-a cottage eave . The sight of [the strong young forester]1029-the strong young forester going over [the darkened fields]1030-the darkened fields against the dull red skies was as a feather that suffices to sway to one side a balance that hangs on a hair . [He]2154-the king had been inclined to leave [her]1019-her alone when [he]2154-the king saw in [his]2154-the king fancy the clean , simple , mindless , honest life that [her]1019-her fanciful girlhood would settle down into as time should go on . But when in the figure of [the woodman]1031-the woodman there was painted visibly on the dusky sky that end for [her]1019-her which [he]2154-the king had foreseen , [he]2154-the king was not indifferent to it ; [he]2154-the king resented it ; [he]2154-the king was stirred to a vague desire to render it impossible . If [Jeannot]144-jeannot had not gone by across [the fields]306-the fields [he]2154-the king would have left [her]1019-her and let [her]1019-her alone from that night thenceforwards ; as it was , — " Good night , [Bébée]101-bébée , "[2154-the king] [he]2154-the king said to [her]1019-her . " Tomorrow [I]2154-the king will finish [the Broodhuis]494-the broodhuis and bring [you]1019-her [your]1019-her first book . Do not dream too much , or [you]1019-her will prick [your]1019-her lace patterns all awry . Good night , [pretty one]2009-pretty one . "[2154-the king] Then [he]2154-the king turned and went back through [the green dim lanes to [the city]225-the city]1033-the green dim lanes to the city . [Bébée]101-bébée stood a moment looking after [him]2154-the king , with a happy smile ; then [she]101-bébée picked up the fallen pear - blossom , and ran [home]289-home as fast as [her]101-bébée feet would take [her]101-bébée . That night [she]101-bébée worked very late watering [her]101-bébée flowers , and trimming them , and then ironing out a little clean white cap for the morrow ; and then sitting down under the open lattice to prick out all old Annémie 's designs by the strong light of the full moon that flooded [[her]101-bébée hut]491-her hut with its radiance . But [she]101-bébée sang all the time [she]101-bébée worked , and the gay , pretty , wordless songs floated across [the water]300-the water and across [the fields]306-the fields , and woke [some old people in [their]1039-some old people in their beds beds]1039-some old people in their beds as [they]1039-some old people in their beds lay with [their]1039-some old people in their beds windows open , and [they]1039-some old people in their beds turned and crossed [themselves]1039-some old people in their beds , and said , " Dear heart!—this is the eve of the Ascension , and [the angels]1960-the angels are so near [we]2225-we hear [them]1960-the angels . "[1039-some old people in their beds] But it was [no angel]1040-no angel ; only the thing that is nearer heaven than anything else,—a little human heart that is happy and innocent . [Bébée]101-bébée had only one sorrow that night . The pear - blossoms were all dead ; and no care could call them back even for an hour 's blooming . " [He]144-jeannot did not think when [he]144-jeannot struck them down , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said to [herself]101-bébée , regretfully . " Can [I]144-jeannot do any work for [you]101-bébée , [Bébée]101-bébée ? "[144-jeannot] said [black Jeannot]144-jeannot in the daybreak , pushing [her]101-bébée gate open timidly with one hand . " There is none to do , [Jeannot]144-jeannot . [They]1041-they want so little in this time of the year — the flowers , "[101-bébée] said [she]101-bébée , lifting [her]101-bébée head from the sweet - peas [she]101-bébée was tying up to [their]1041-they sticks . [The woodman]1031-the woodman did not answer ; [he]1031-the woodman leaned over the half - open wicket , and swayed it backwards and forwards under [his]1031-the woodman bare arm . [He]1031-the woodman was [a good , harmless , gentle fellow , swarthy as charcoal and simple as a child]1043-a good , harmless , gentle fellow , swarthy as charcoal and simple as a child , and quite ignorant , having spent all [his]1031-the woodman days in [the great Soignies forests]1044-the great soignies forests making fagots when [he]1031-the woodman was [a little lad]1045-a little lad , and hewing down trees or burning charcoal as [he]1031-the woodman grew to manhood . " Who was that seigneur with [you]101-bébée last night , [Bébée]101-bébée ? "[1031-the woodman] [he]1031-the woodman asked , after a long silence , watching [her]101-bébée as [she]101-bébée moved . [Bébée]101-bébée 's eyes grew very soft , but [they]1046-i looked up frankly . " [I]1046-i am not sure — [I]1046-i think [he]1031-the woodman is [a painter]2033-a painter — [a great painter prince]2227-a great painter prince , [I]1046-i mean — as [Rubes]150-rubes was in [Antwerpen]46-antwerpen ; [he]1031-the woodman wanted roses the night before last in [the cathedral]509-the cathedral . "[1046-i] " But [he]1031-the woodman was walking with [you]101-bébée ? "[101-bébée] " [He]1031-the woodman was in [the lane]396-the lane as [I]101-bébée came [home]289-home last night — yes . "[101-bébée] " What does [he]1031-the woodman give [you]101-bébée for [your]101-bébée roses ? "[1046-i] " Oh ! [he]1031-the woodman pays [me]101-bébée well . How is [[your]101-bébée mother]2231-your mother this day , [Jeannot]144-jeannot ? "[101-bébée] " [You]101-bébée do not like to talk of [him]1031-the woodman ? "[101-bébée] " Why should [you]101-bébée want to talk of [him]1031-the woodman ? [He]1031-the woodman is nothing to [you]101-bébée . "[101-bébée] " Did [you]101-bébée really see [him]1031-the woodman only two days ago , [Bébée]101-bébée ? "[101-bébée] " Oh , [Jeannot]144-jeannot ! did [I]1047-the forester ever tell [a falsehood]2232-a falsehood ? [You]101-bébée would not say that to [one of [[your]101-bébée little sisters]2234-your little sisters]2233-one of your little sisters . "[1047-the forester] [The forester]1047-the forester swayed the gate to and fro drearily under [his]1047-the forester folded arms . [Bébée]101-bébée , not regarding [him]1047-the forester , cut [her]101-bébée flowers , and filled [her]101-bébée baskets , and did [her]101-bébée other work , and set a ladder against [the hut]284-the hut and climbed on [its]284-the hut low roof to seek for eggs , the hens having green tastes sometimes for the rushes and lichens of its thatch . [She]101-bébée found two eggs , which [she]101-bébée promised [herself]101-bébée to take to [Annémie]142-annémie , and looking round as [she]101-bébée sat on the edge of the roof , with one foot on the highest rung of the ladder , saw that [Jeannot]144-jeannot was still at the gate . " [You]144-jeannot will be late in [the forest]522-the forest , [Jeannot]144-jeannot , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée cried to [him]144-jeannot . " It is such a long , long way in and out . Why do [you]144-jeannot look so sulky ? and [you]144-jeannot are kicking the wicket to pieces . "[101-bébée] " [I]144-jeannot do not like [you]101-bébée to talk with [strangers]825-strangers , "[144-jeannot] said [Jeannot]144-jeannot , sullenly and sadly . [Bébée]101-bébée laughed as [she]101-bébée sat on the edge of the thatch , and looked at the shining gray skies of the early day , and [the dew - wet garden]1049-the dew - wet garden , and [the green fields beyond]1050-the green fields beyond , with happy eyes that made the familiar scene transfigured to [her]101-bébée . " Oh , [Jeannot]144-jeannot , what nonsense ! As if [I]101-bébée do not talk to [a million strangers]2237-a million strangers every summer ! as if [I]101-bébée could ever sell a flower if [I]101-bébée did not ! [You]144-jeannot are cross this morning ; that is what it is . "[101-bébée] " Do [you]101-bébée know [the man]2238-the man 's name ? "[144-jeannot] said [Jeannot]144-jeannot , suddenly . [Bébée]101-bébée felt [her]101-bébée cheeks grow warm as with some noonday heat of sunshine . [She]101-bébée thought it was with anger against blundering [Jeannot]144-jeannot 's curiosity . " No ! and what would [his]2238-the man name be to [us]1052-us , if [I]101-bébée did know it ? [I]101-bébée can not ask [people]337-people 's names because [they]337-people buy [my]101-bébée roses . "[101-bébée] " As if it were only roses ! "[101-bébée] There was the length of [the garden]1940-the garden between [them]1052-us , and [Bébée]101-bébée did not hear as [she]101-bébée sat on the edge of [her]101-bébée roof with that light dreamful enjoyment of air and sky and coolness , and all the beauty of the dawning day , which the sweet vague sense of a personal happiness will bring with it to the dullest and the coldest . " [You]144-jeannot are cross , [Jeannot]144-jeannot , that is what it is , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said , after a while . " [You]144-jeannot should not be cross ; [you]144-jeannot are too big and strong and good . Go in and get [my]101-bébée bowl of bread and milk for [me]101-bébée , and hand it to [me]101-bébée up here . It is so pleasant . It is as nice as being perched on an apple - tree . "[101-bébée] [Jeannot]144-jeannot went in obediently and handed up [her]101-bébée breakfast to [her]101-bébée , looking at [her]101-bébée with shy , worshipping eyes . But [his]144-jeannot face was overcast , and [he]144-jeannot sighed heavily as [he]144-jeannot took up [his]144-jeannot hatchet and turned away ; for [he]144-jeannot was the sole support of [[his]144-jeannot mother]598-his mother and [sisters]1054-sisters , and if [he]144-jeannot did not do [his]144-jeannot work in [Soignies]48-soignies [they]1055-they would starve at [home]289-home . " [You]101-bébée will be seeing [that stranger]2240-that stranger again ? "[144-jeannot] [he]144-jeannot asked [her]101-bébée . " Yes ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée answered with a glad triumph in [her]101-bébée eyes ; not thinking at all of [him]144-jeannot as [she]101-bébée spoke . " [You]144-jeannot ought to go , [Jeannot]144-jeannot , now ; [you]144-jeannot are so late . [I]101-bébée will come and see [[your]144-jeannot mother]2231-your mother to - morrow . And do not be cross , [[you]144-jeannot dear big [Jeannot]144-jeannot]2242-you dear big jeannot . Days are too short to snip them up into little bits by bad temper ; it is only [a stupid sheep - shearer]2243-a stupid sheep - shearer that spoils the fleece by snapping at it sharp and hard ; that is what [Father Francis]105-father francis says . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée , having delivered [her]101-bébée little piece of wisdom , broke [her]101-bébée bread into [her]101-bébée milk and ate it , lifting [her]101-bébée face to the fresh wind and tossing crumbs to the wheeling swallows , and watching the rose - bushes nod and toss below in the breeze , and thinking vaguely how happy a thing it was to live . [Jeannot]144-jeannot looked up at [her]101-bébée , then went on [his]144-jeannot slow sad way through the wet lavender - shrubs and the opening buds of the lilies . " [You]101-bébée will only think of [that stranger]2240-that stranger , [Bébée]101-bébée , never of any of [us]2245-us — never again , "[144-jeannot] [he]144-jeannot said ; and wearily opened the little gate and went through it , and down the daybreak stillness of [the lane]396-the lane . It was a foolish thing to say ; but when were [lovers]1058-lovers ever wise ? [Bébée]101-bébée did not heed ; [she]101-bébée did not understand [herself]101-bébée or [him]144-jeannot ; [she]101-bébée only knew that [she]101-bébée was happy ; when [one]1951-one knows that , [one]1951-one does not want to seek much further . [She]101-bébée sat on the thatch and took [her]101-bébée bread and milk in the gray clear air , with the swallows circling above [her]101-bébée head , and [one or two of [them]1062-they]1061-one or two of them even resting a second on the edge of the bowl to peck at the food from the big wooden spoon ; [they]1062-they had known [her]101-bébée all the sixteen summers of [her]101-bébée life , and were [[her]101-bébée playfellows]1063-her playfellows , only [they]1062-they would never tell [her]101-bébée anything of what [they]1062-they saw in winter over [the seas]2205-the seas . That was [her]101-bébée only quarrel with [them]1062-they . [Swallows]1065-swallows do not tell [their]1065-swallows secrets [They]1065-swallows have the weird of Procne on [them]1065-swallows all . The sun came and touched the lichens of the roof into gold . [Bébée]101-bébée smiled at it gayly as it rose above the tops of the trees , and shone on [all the little villages scattered over [the plains]410-the plains]1066-all the little villages scattered over the plains . " Ah , [dear Sun]2246-dear sun ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée cried to it . " [I]101-bébée am going to be wise . [I]101-bébée am going into [great Rubes ' country]2247-great rubes ' country . [I]101-bébée am going to hear of the Past and [the Future]49-the future . [I]101-bébée am going to listen to what [the Poets]2207-the poets say . [The swallows]2249-the swallows never would tell [me]101-bébée anything ; but now [I]101-bébée shall know as much as [they]2249-the swallows know . Are [you]2246-dear sun not glad for [me]101-bébée , [O Sun]157-the sun ? "[101-bébée] [The Sun]157-the sun came over the trees , and heard and said nothing . If [he]157-the sun had answered at all [he]157-the sun must have said , — " The only time when [a human soul]2250-a human soul is either wise or happy is in that one single moment when the hour of [my]157-the sun own shining or of the moon 's beaming seems to [that single soul]2251-that single soul to be past and present and future , to be at once the creation and the end of all things . [Faust]158-faust knew that ; so will [you]2246-dear sun . "[157-the sun] But [the Sun]157-the sun shone on and held [his]157-the sun peace . [He]157-the sun sees all things ripen and fall . [He]157-the sun can wait . [He]157-the sun knows the end . It is always the same . [He]157-the sun brings the fruit out of the peach - flower , and rounds it and touches it into ruddiest rose and softest gold : but the sun knows well that the peach must drop — whether into the basket to be eaten by [kings]1068-kings , or on to the turf to be eaten by ants . What matter which very much after all ? [The Sun]1069-the sun is not [a cynic]1070-a cynic ; [he]1069-the sun is only wise because [he]1069-the sun is Life and [he]1069-the sun is Death , [the creator]1071-the creator and [the corrupter of all things]1072-the corrupter of all things . But [Bébée , who only saw in the sun the sign of daily work , the brightness of the face of the world]1073-bébée , who only saw in the sun the sign of daily work , the brightness of the face of the world , [the friend of the flowers]1074-the friend of the flowers , [the harvest - man of the poor]1075-the harvest - man of the poor , [the playmate of the birds and butterflies]1076-the playmate of the birds and butterflies , the kindly light that the waking birds and the ringing carillon welcomed,—Bébée , who was not at all afraid of [him]157-the sun , smiled at [his]157-the sun rays and saw in them only fairest promise of a cloudless midsummer day as [she]1073-bébée , who only saw in the sun the sign of daily work , the brightness of the face of the world gave [her]1073-bébée , who only saw in the sun the sign of daily work , the brightness of the face of the world last crumb to the swallows , dropped down off the thatch , and busied [herself]1073-bébée , who only saw in the sun the sign of daily work , the brightness of the face of the world in making bread that [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs would bake for [her]1073-bébée , who only saw in the sun the sign of daily work , the brightness of the face of the world , until it was time to cut [her]1073-bébée , who only saw in the sun the sign of daily work , the brightness of the face of the world flowers and go down into [the town]412-the town . "[627-the old woman] [Bébée]101-bébée went away thoughtfully out of [the old crazy water - washed house by [the quay]535-the quay]1093-the old crazy water - washed house by the quay ; life seemed growing very strange and intricate and knotted about [her]101-bébée , like the threads of lace that [a bad fairy]1095-a bad fairy has entangled in the night . [[Her]627-the old woman stranger from [Rubes]150-rubes [' land]2149-' land]1096-her stranger from rubes ' land was [a great man in [a certain world]1099-a certain world]1098-a great man in a certain world . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world had become great when young , which is perhaps a misfortune . It indisposes [men]707-men to be great at [their]707-men maturity . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world was famous at twenty , by a picture hectic in color , perfect in drawing , that made [Paris]15-paris at [his]1098-a great man in a certain world feet . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world became more famous by verses , by plays , by political follies , and by social successes . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world was faithful , however , to [his]1098-a great man in a certain world first love in art . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world was [a great painter]1101-a great painter , and year by year proved afresh the cunning of [his]1098-a great man in a certain world hand . [Purists]1102-purists said [his]1098-a great man in a certain world pictures had no soul in them . It was not wonderful if [they]1102-purists had none . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world always painted soulless vice ; indeed , [he]1098-a great man in a certain world saw very little else . One year [he]1098-a great man in a certain world had some political trouble . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world wrote a witty pamphlet that hurt where it was perilous to aim . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world laughed and crossed the border , riding into [the green Ardennes]50-the green ardennes one sunny evening . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world had a name of some power and sufficient wealth ; [he]1098-a great man in a certain world did not feel long exile . Meanwhile [he]1098-a great man in a certain world told [himself]1098-a great man in a certain world [he]1098-a great man in a certain world would go and look at [[Scheffer]160-scheffer 's Gretchen]51-scheffer 's gretchen . [The King of [Thule]52-thule]1103-the king of thule is better ; but [people]337-people talk most of the [Gretchen]161-gretchen . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world had never seen either . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world went in leisurely , travelling up [the bright Meuse River]53-the bright meuse river , and across [the monotony of the plains]1105-the monotony of the plains , then green with wheat a foot high , and musical with the many bells of the Easter kermesses in [the quaint old - world villages]1106-the quaint old - world villages . There was something so novel , so sleepy , so harmless , so mediaeval , in the Flemish life , that it soothed [him]1098-a great man in a certain world . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world had been swimming all [his]1098-a great man in a certain world life in [salt sea - fed rapids]1107-salt sea - fed rapids ; [this sluggish , dull , canal water , mirroring between [its]1108-this sluggish , dull , canal water , mirroring between its rushes rushes]1108-this sluggish , dull , canal water , mirroring between its rushes a life that had scarcely changed for centuries , had a charm for [him]1098-a great man in a certain world . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world stayed awhile in [Antwerpen]46-antwerpen . [The town]412-the town is ugly and beautiful ; [it]412-the town is like [a dull quaint grés de Flandre jug]1110-a dull quaint grés de flandre jug , that has precious stones set inside [its]412-the town rim . [It]412-the town is [a burgher ledger of bales and barrels , of sale and barter , of loss and gain]1111-a burgher ledger of bales and barrels , of sale and barter , of loss and gain ; but in the heart of it there are illuminated leaves of missal vellum , all gold and color , and monkish story and heroic ballad , that could only have been executed in the days when Art was a religion . [He]1098-a great man in a certain world gazed [himself]1098-a great man in a certain world into an homage of [Rubens]151-rubens , whom before [he]1098-a great man in a certain world had slighted , never having known ( for , unless [you]1112-you have seen [Antwerp]25-antwerp , it is as absurd to say that [you]1112-you have seen [Rubens]151-rubens , as it is to think that [you]1112-you have seen [Murillo]162-murillo out of [Seville]54-seville , or [Raffaelle]163-raffaelle out of [Rome]55-rome ) ; and [he]1098-a great man in a certain world studied [the Gretchen]161-gretchen carefully , delicately , sympathetically , for [he]1098-a great man in a certain world loved [Scheffer]160-scheffer ; but though [he]1098-a great man in a certain world tried , [he]1098-a great man in a certain world failed to care for [her]161-gretchen . " [She]161-gretchen is only [a peasant]809-a peasant ; [she]161-gretchen is not a poem , "[1098-a great man in a certain world] [he]1098-a great man in a certain world said to [himself]1098-a great man in a certain world ; " [I]1098-a great man in a certain world will paint [a Gretchen]2264-a gretchen for the Salon of next year . "[1098-a great man in a certain world] But it was hard for [him]1098-a great man in a certain world to portray a [Gretchen]161-gretchen . All [his]1098-a great man in a certain world pictures were [Phryne,—Phryne]164-phryne,—phryne in triumph , in ruin , in [a palace]1113-a palace , in [a poor - house]1114-a poor - house , on a bed of roses , on a hospital mattress ; [Phryne]165-phryne laughing with a belt of jewels about [her]165-phryne supple waist ; [Phryne]165-phryne lying with the stones of [the dead - house]1115-the dead - house under [her]165-phryne naked limbs,—but always [Phryne]165-phryne . [Phryne]165-phryne , who living had death in [her]165-phryne smile ; [Phryne]165-phryne , who lifeless had blank despair on [her]165-phryne face ; [Phryne]165-phryne , a thing that lived furiously every second of [her]165-phryne days , but [Phryne]165-phryne a thing that once being dead was carrion that never could live again . [Phryne]165-phryne has [many painters in [this school]1117-this school]1116-many painters in this school , as many as [Catherine]154-st. catherine and [Cecilia]166-cecilia had in [the schools of the Renaissance]1118-the schools of the renaissance , and [he]1119-he was chief amidst [them]1116-many painters in this school . How could [he]1119-he paint [Gretchen]161-gretchen if [the pure Scheffer]160-scheffer missed ? Not even if , like [the artist monks of old]1120-the artist monks of old , [he]1119-he steeped [his]1119-he brushes all Lent through in holy water . And in holy water [he]1119-he did not believe . One evening , having left [Antwerpen]46-antwerpen ringing [its]46-antwerpen innumerable bells over the grave of [its]46-antwerpen dead Art , [he]1119-he leaned out of the casement of [[an absent friend]1121-an absent friend 's old palace in [the Brabant street]1123-the brabant street that is named after [Mary of Burgundy]131-mary]1122-an absent friend 's old palace in the brabant street that is named after mary of burgundy ; an old casement crusted with quaint carvings , and gilded round in Spanish fashion , with many gargoyles and griffins , and illegible scutcheons . Leaning there , wondering with [himself]1119-he whether [he]1119-he would wait awhile and paint quietly in [this dim street]1124-this dim street , haunted with the shades of [Memling]167-memling and [Maes]168-maes , and [Otto Veneris]169-otto veneris and [Philip de Champagne]170-philip de champagne , or whether [he]1119-he would go into [the East]56-the east and seek new types , and lie under the red Egyptian heavens and create a true Cleopatra , which [no man]1125-no man has ever done yet,—young [Cleopatra]171-cleopatra , ankle - deep in roses and fresh from [Cæsar]172-cæsar 's kisses,—leaning [there]2000-there , [he]1119-he saw [a little peasant]755-a little peasant go by below , with two little white feet in two wooden shoes , and a face that had the pure and simple radiance of a flower . " There is [[my]1119-he [Gretchen]161-gretchen]2265-my gretchen , "[1119-he] [he]1119-he thought to [himself]1119-he , and went down and followed [her]755-a little peasant into [the cathedral]509-the cathedral . If [he]1119-he could get what was in [her]755-a little peasant face , [he]1119-he would get what [Scheffer]160-scheffer could not . A little later walking by [her]755-a little peasant in [the green lanes]716-the green lanes , [he]1119-he meditated , " It is the face of [Gretchen]161-gretchen , but not the soul — [the Red Mouse]173-the red mouse has never passed [this child]2266-this child 's lips . Nevertheless — "[1119-he] " Nevertheless — "[1119-he] [he]1119-he said to [himself]1119-he , and smiled . For [he]1119-he , [the painter]815-the painter all [his]1119-he life long of [Phryne]165-phryne living and of [Phryne]165-phryne dead , believed that [every daughter of [Eve]174-eve]1131-every daughter of eve either vomits [the Red Mouse]173-the red mouse or swallows it . It makes so little difference which,—either way [the Red Mouse]173-the red mouse has been [there]2000-there the evening towards [this little rush - covered hut]1133-this little rush - covered hut , [he]1119-he forgot [the Red Mouse]173-the red mouse , and began vaguely to see that there are creatures of [[his]1119-he mother]598-his mother 's sex from whom the beast of [the Brocken]175-the brocken slinks away . But [he]1119-he still said to [himself]1119-he , " Nevertheless . "[1119-he] " Nevertheless,"—for[1119-he] [he]1119-he knew well that when the steel cuts the silk , when the hound hunts the fawn , when the snake wooes the bird , when [the king]2154-the king covets [the vineyard]1136-the vineyard , there is only one end possible at any time . It is the strong against [the weak]1137-the weak , the fierce against the feeble , the subtle against [the simple]1138-the simple , [the master]1139-the master against [the slave]1140-the slave ; there is no equality in the contest and no justice — it is merely inevitable , and the issue of it is written . The next day [she]598-his mother had [her]598-his mother promised book hidden under the vine - leaves of [her]598-his mother empty basket as [she]598-his mother went [homeward]1141-homeward , and though [she]598-his mother had not seen [him]1119-he very long or spoken to [him]1119-he very much , [she]598-his mother was happy . The golden gates of knowledge had just opened to [her]598-his mother ; [she]598-his mother saw a faint , far - off glimpse of [the Hesperides gardens within]1142-the hesperides gardens within ; of the dragon [she]598-his mother had never heard , and had no fear . " Might [I]598-his mother know [your]1119-he name ? "[598-his mother] [she]598-his mother had asked [him]1119-he wistfully , as [she]598-his mother had given [him]1119-he the rosebud , and taken the volume in return that day . " [They]2267-they call [me]598-his mother [Flamen]176-flamen . "[598-his mother] " It is [your]1119-he name ? "[101-bébée] " Yes , for [the world]370-the world . [You]1119-he must call [me]101-bébée [Victor]177-victor , as [other women]2269-other women do . Why do [you]1119-he want [my]101-bébée name ? "[101-bébée] " [Jeannot]144-jeannot asked it of [me]101-bébée . "[101-bébée] " Oh , [Jeannot]144-jeannot asked it , did [he]144-jeannot ? "[101-bébée] " Yes ; besides , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , with [her]101-bébée eyes very soft and very serious , and [her]101-bébée happy voice hushed,—"besides , [I]101-bébée want to pray for [you]1119-he of course , every day ; and if [I]101-bébée do not know [your]1119-he name , how can [I]101-bébée make [[Our]2270-our Lady]275-our lady rightly understand ? The flowers know [you]1119-he without a name , but [she]275-our lady might not , because so very many are always beseeching [her]275-our lady , and [you]1119-he see [she]275-our lady has all [the world]370-the world to look after . "[101-bébée] [He]1143-he had looked at [her]101-bébée with a curious look , and had bade [her]101-bébée farewell , and let [her]101-bébée go [home]289-home alone that night . [Her]101-bébée work was quickly done , and by the light of the moon [she]101-bébée spread [her]101-bébée book on [her]101-bébée lap in [the porch of [the hut]284-the hut]1145-the porch of the hut and began [her]101-bébée new delight . [The children]373-the children had come and pulled at [her]101-bébée skirts and begged [her]101-bébée to play . But [Bébée]101-bébée had shaken [her]101-bébée head . " [I]101-bébée am going to learn to be very wise , [dear]2076-dear , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée told [them]373-the children ; " [I]101-bébée shall not have time to dance or to play . "[101-bébée] " But [people]337-people are not merry when [they]337-people are wise , [Bébée]101-bébée , "[178-franz] said [Franz]178-franz , [the biggest boy]1148-the biggest boy . " Perhaps not , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée : " but one can not be everything , [you]178-franz know , [Franz]178-franz . "[101-bébée] " But surely , [you]178-franz would rather be merry than anything else ? "[101-bébée] " [I]101-bébée think there is something better , [Franz]178-franz . [I]101-bébée am not sure ; [I]101-bébée want to find out ; [I]101-bébée will tell [you]178-franz when [I]101-bébée know . "[101-bébée] " Who has put that into [your]178-franz head , [Bébée]101-bébée ? "[101-bébée] " [The angels in [the cathedral]509-the cathedral]2275-the angels in the cathedral , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée told [them]1149-them ; and [the children]373-the children were awed and left [her]101-bébée , and went away to play blind - man's - buff by [themselves]373-the children , on the grass by the swan 's water . " But for all that [the angels]1960-the angels have said it , "[178-franz] said [Franz]178-franz to [[his]1151-his sisters]1152-his sisters , " [I]178-franz can not see what good it will be to [her]101-bébée to be wise , if [she]101-bébée will not care any longer afterwards for almond gingerbread and currant cake . "[178-franz] It was the little tale of " [Paul]179-paul and [Virginia]180-virginia "[1151-his] that [he]1151-his had given [her]101-bébée to begin [her]101-bébée studies with : but it was a grand copy , full of beautiful drawings nearly at every page . It was hard work for [her]101-bébée to read at first , but the drawings enticed and helped [her]101-bébée , and [she]101-bébée soon sank breathlessly into the charm of the story . Many words [she]101-bébée did not know ; many passages were beyond [her]101-bébée comprehension ; [she]101-bébée was absolutely ignorant , and had nothing but the force of [her]101-bébée own fancy to aid [her]101-bébée . But though stumbling at every step , as [a lame child]1153-a lame child through [a flowery hillside]1154-a flowery hillside in summer , [she]101-bébée was happy as [the child]377-the child would be , because of the sweet , strange air that was blowing about [her]101-bébée , and the blossoms that [she]101-bébée could gather into [her]101-bébée hand , so rare , so wonderful , and yet withal so familiar , because they were blossoms . With [her]101-bébée fingers buried in [her]101-bébée curls , with [her]101-bébée book on [her]101-bébée knee , with the moon rays white and strong on the page , [Bébée]101-bébée sat entranced as the hours went by ; [the children]373-the children 's play shouts died away ; the babble of the gossip at [the house]1157-the house doors ceased ; [people]337-people went by and called good night to [her]101-bébée ; [the little huts]1159-the little huts shut up one by one , like the white and purple convolvulus cups in the hedges . [Bébée]101-bébée did not stir , nor did [she]101-bébée hear them ; [she]101-bébée was deaf even to the singing of the nightingales in the willows , where [she]101-bébée sat in [her]101-bébée little thatch above , and the wet garden - ways beyond [her]101-bébée . A heavy step came tramping down [the lane]396-the lane . A voice called to [her]101-bébée , — " What are [you]101-bébée doing , [Bébée]101-bébée , there , this time of the night ? It is on the strike of twelve . "[101-bébée] [She]101-bébée started as if [she]101-bébée were doing some evil thing , and stretched [her]101-bébée arms out , and looked around with blinded , wondering eyes , as if [she]101-bébée had been rudely wakened from [her]101-bébée sleep . " What are [you]144-jeannot doing up so late ? "[144-jeannot] asked [Jeannot]144-jeannot ; [he]144-jeannot was coming from [the forest]522-the forest in the dead of night to bring food for [[his]144-jeannot family]1162-his family ; [he]144-jeannot lost [his]144-jeannot sleep thus often , but [he]144-jeannot never thought that [he]144-jeannot did anything except [his]144-jeannot duty in those long , dark , tiring tramps to and fro between [Soignies]48-soignies and [Laeken]2-laeken . [Bébée]101-bébée shut [her]101-bébée book and smiled with dreaming eyes , that saw [him]144-jeannot not at all . " [I]101-bébée was reading — and , [Jeannot]144-jeannot , [his]144-jeannot name is [Flamen]176-flamen for [the world]370-the world , but [I]101-bébée may call [him]144-jeannot [Victor]177-victor . "[101-bébée] " What do [I]1164-i care for [his]144-jeannot name ? "[1164-i] " [You]1164-i asked it this morning . "[1164-i] " More fool [I.]1164-i Why do [you]144-jeannot read ? Reading is not for [poor folk like [you]144-jeannot and [me]101-bébée]2279-poor folk like you and me . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée smiled up at the white clear moon that sailed above [the woods]515-the woods . [She]101-bébée was not awake out of [her]101-bébée dream . [She]101-bébée only dimly heard the words [he]1164-i spoke . " [You]101-bébée are [a little peasant]755-a little peasant , "[144-jeannot] said [Jeannot]144-jeannot roughly , as [he]144-jeannot paused at the gate . " It is all [you]101-bébée can do to get [your]101-bébée bread . [You]101-bébée have [no one]1950-no one to stand between [you]101-bébée and hunger . How will it be with [you]101-bébée when [the slug]2282-the slug gets [your]101-bébée roses , and the snail [your]101-bébée carnations , and [your]101-bébée hens die of damp , and [your]101-bébée lace is all wove awry , because [your]101-bébée head runs on reading and folly , and [you]101-bébée are spoilt for all simple pleasures and for all honest work ? "[144-jeannot] [She]101-bébée smiled , still looking up at the moon , with the dropping ivy touching [her]101-bébée hair . " [You]144-jeannot are cross , [dear Jeannot]144-jeannot . Good night . "[101-bébée] A moment afterwards the little rickety door was shut , and the rusty bolt drawn within it ; [Jeannot]144-jeannot stood in the cool summer night all alone , and knew how stupid [he]144-jeannot had been in [his]144-jeannot wrath . [He]144-jeannot leaned on the gate a minute ; then crossed [the garden]1940-the garden as softly as [his]144-jeannot wooden shoes would let [him]144-jeannot . [He]144-jeannot tapped gently on the shutter of the lattice . " Bébée — Bébée — just listen . [I]101-bébée spoke roughly , [dear]2076-dear — [I]101-bébée know [I]101-bébée have no right . [I]101-bébée am sorry . Will [you]2076-dear be friends with [me]101-bébée again?—do be [friends]668-friends again . "[101-bébée] [She]101-bébée opened the shutter a little way , so that [he]144-jeannot could see [her]101-bébée pretty mouth speaking , " [we]668-friends are [friends]668-friends — [we]668-friends will always be [friends]668-friends , of course — only [you]144-jeannot do not know . Good night . "[101-bébée] [He]144-jeannot went away with a heavy heart and a long - drawn step . [He]144-jeannot would have preferred that [she]101-bébée should have been angry with [him]144-jeannot . [Bébée]101-bébée , left alone , let the clothes drop off [her]101-bébée pretty round shoulders and [her]101-bébée rosy limbs , and shook out [her]101-bébée coils of hair , and kissed the book , and laid it under [her]101-bébée head , and went to sleep with a smile on [her]101-bébée face . Only , as [she]101-bébée slept , [her]101-bébée ringers moved as if [she]101-bébée were counting [her]101-bébée beads , and [her]101-bébée lips murmured , — " Oh , [dear Holy Mother]2287-dear holy mother , [you]144-jeannot have so much to think of — yes . [I]101-bébée know — [all the poor]2288-all the poor , and [all the little children]2289-all the little children . But take care of [him]144-jeannot ; [he]144-jeannot is called [Flamen]176-flamen , and [he]144-jeannot lives in [the street of [Mary of Burgundy]131-mary]2290-the street of mary of burgundy ; [you]144-jeannot can not miss [him]144-jeannot ; and if [you]144-jeannot will look for [him]144-jeannot always , and have a heed that [the angels]1960-the angels never leave [him]144-jeannot , [I]101-bébée will give [you]144-jeannot [my]101-bébée great cactus glower — [[my]101-bébée only one]2292-my only one — on [your]144-jeannot Feast of Roses this very year . Oh , [dear Mother]2253-dear mother , [you]144-jeannot will not forget ! "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée was [a dreamer]407-a dreamer in [her]101-bébée way , and aspired to be [a scholar]1167-a scholar too . But all the same , [she]101-bébée was not [a little fool]336-a little fool . [She]101-bébée had been reared in hardy , simple , honest ways of living , and would have thought it as shameful as a theft to have owed [her]101-bébée bread to [other folk]1169-other folk .
