So , though [she]101-bébée had a wakeful , restless night , full of strange fantasies , none the less was [she]101-bébée out in [[her]101-bébée garden]413-her garden by daybreak ; none the less did [she]101-bébée sweep out [her]101-bébée floor and make [her]101-bébée mash for the fowls , and wash out [her]101-bébée bit of linen and hang it to dry on a line among the tall , flaunting hollyhocks that were so proud of [themselves]1171-themselves because [they]1171-themselves reached to the roof . " What do [you]101-bébée want with books , [Bébée]101-bébée ? "[181-reine] said [Reine]181-reine , [[the sabot - maker]1172-the sabot - maker 's wife]1173-the sabot - maker 's wife , across the privet hedge , as [she]181-reine also hung out [her]181-reine linen . " [Franz]178-franz told [me]181-reine [you]101-bébée were reading last night . It is the silver buckles have done that : one mischief always begets another . "[181-reine] " Where is the mischief , good [Reine]181-reine ? "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , who was always prettily behaved with [[her]101-bébée elders]1174-her elders , though , when pushed to it , [she]101-bébée could hold [her]101-bébée own . " The mischief will be in discontent , "[1173-the sabot - maker 's wife] said [[the sabot - maker]1172-the sabot - maker 's wife]1173-the sabot - maker 's wife . " [People]337-people live on [[their]337-people own little patch]2295-their own little patch , and think it is [the world]370-the world ; that is as it should be — [everybody within [his]2297-everybody within his own own]2297-everybody within his own , like a nut in its shell . But when [you]101-bébée get reading , [you]101-bébée hear of a swarm of things [you]101-bébée never saw , and [you]101-bébée fret because [you]101-bébée can not see them , and [you]101-bébée dream , and dream , and a hole is burnt in [your]101-bébée soup - pot , and [your]101-bébée dough is as heavy as lead . [You]101-bébée are like bees that leave [their]2298-their own clover fields to buzz themselves dead against the glass of a hothouse . "[1173-the sabot - maker 's wife] [Bébée]101-bébée smiled , reaching to spread out [her]101-bébée linen . But [she]101-bébée said nothing . " What good is it talking to [them]1177-the neighbors and friends of her infancy ? "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée thought ; " [they]1177-the neighbors and friends of her infancy do not know . "[101-bébée] Already [the neighbors and friends of [her]101-bébée infancy]1177-the neighbors and friends of her infancy seemed so far , far away ; creatures of [a distant world]1178-a distant world , that [she]101-bébée had long left ; it was no use talking , [they]1177-the neighbors and friends of her infancy never would understand . " [Antoine]103-antoine should never have taught [you]103-antoine [your]103-antoine letters , "[181-reine] said [Reine]181-reine , groaning under the great blue shirts [she]181-reine was hanging on high among the leaves . " [I]181-reine told [him]103-antoine so at the time . [I]181-reine said , ' [The child]377-the child is [a good child , and spins , and sews , and sweeps]2300-a good child , and spins , and sews , and sweeps , rare and fine for [her]377-the child age ; why go and spoil [her]377-the child ? ' But [he]103-antoine was always headstrong . Not [a child of mine]2301-a child of mine knows a letter , [the saints]399-the saints be praised ! nor a word of any tongue but [our]2303-our own good Flemish . [You]101-bébée should have been brought up the same . [You]101-bébée would have come to no trouble then . "[181-reine] " [I]101-bébée am in no trouble , [dear Reine]181-reine , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , scattering the potato - peels to the clacking poultry , and [she]181-reine smiled into the faces of the golden oxlips that nodded to [her]181-reine back again in sunshiny sympathy . " Not yet , "[181-reine] said [Reine]181-reine , hanging [her]181-reine last shirt . But [Bébée]101-bébée was not hearing ; [she]181-reine was calling the chickens , and telling the oxlips how pretty they looked in the borders ; and in [her]181-reine heart [she]181-reine was counting the minutes till the old Dutch cuckoo - clock at [Mère Krebs's]57-mère krebs's — the only clock in [the lane]396-the lane — should crow out the hour at which [she]181-reine went down to [the city]225-the city . [She]181-reine loved [the hut]284-the hut , the birds , the flowers ; but they were little to [her]181-reine now compared with [the dark golden picturesque square]1182-the dark golden picturesque square , the changing crowds , the frowning roofs , the gray stones , and colors and shadows of the throngs for one face and for one smile . " [He]1183-he is sure to be [there]2000-there , "[181-reine] [she]181-reine thought , and started half an hour earlier than was [her]181-reine wo nt . [She]181-reine wanted to tell [him]1183-he all [her]181-reine rapture in the book ; [no one else]2192-no one else could understand . But all the day through [he]1183-he never came . [Bébée]101-bébée sat with a sick heart and a parched little throat , selling [her]101-bébée flowers and straining [her]101-bébée eyes through the tumult of [the square]718-the square . The whole day went by , and there was no sign of [him]1183-he . The flowers had sold well : it was a feast day ; [her]101-bébée pouch was full of pence — what was that to [her]101-bébée ? [She]101-bébée went and prayed in [the cathedral]509-the cathedral , but [it]509-the cathedral seemed cold , and desolate , and empty ; even the storied windows seemed dark . " Perhaps [he]1183-he is gore out of [the city]225-the city , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée thought ; and a terror fell on [her]101-bébée that frightened [her]101-bébée , it was so unlike any fear that [she]101-bébée had ever known — even the fear when [she]101-bébée had seen death on old [Antoine]103-antoine 's face had been nothing like this . Going [home]289-home through [the streets]608-the streets , [she]101-bébée passed [the café of [the Trois Frères]1190-the trois frères that looks out on the trees of [the park]512-the park]1189-the café of the trois frères that looks out on the trees of the park , and that has flowers in [its]1189-the café of the trois frères that looks out on the trees of the park balconies , and pleasant windows that stand open to let the sounds of [the soldiers]1192-the soldiers ' music enter . [She]101-bébée saw [him]103-antoine in one of the windows . There were amber and scarlet and black ; silks and satins and velvets . There was a fan painted and jewelled . There were [women]785-women 's faces . There was a heap of purple fruit and glittering sweetmeats . [He]103-antoine laughed there . [His]103-antoine beautiful Murillo head was dark against the white and gold within . [Bébée]101-bébée looked up,—paused a second,—then went onward , with a thorn in [her]101-bébée heart . [He]103-antoine Had not seen [her]101-bébée . " It is natural , of course — [he]103-antoine has [his]103-antoine world — [he]103-antoine does not think often of [me]101-bébée — there is no reason why [he]103-antoine should be as good as [he]103-antoine is , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said to [herself]101-bébée as [she]101-bébée went slowly over the stones . [She]101-bébée had the dog 's soul — only [she]101-bébée did not know it . But the tears Fell down [her]101-bébée cheeks , as [she]101-bébée walked . It looked so bright in there , so gay , with the sound of the music coming in through the trees , and [those women,—she]1194-those women,—she had seen [such women]1195-such women before ; sometimes in the winter nights , going [home]289-home from the lacework , [she]101-bébée had stopped at the doors of [the palaces]1197-the palaces , or of [the opera house]1198-the opera house , when [the carriages]525-the carriages were setting down [their]525-the carriages brilliant burdens ; and sometimes on the great feast days [she]101-bébée had seen [the people of the court]1200-the people of the court going out to some gala at [the theatre]1201-the theatre , or some great review of [troops]551-troops , or [some ceremonial of [foreign sovereigns]1204-foreign sovereigns]1203-some ceremonial of foreign sovereigns ; but [she]101-bébée had never thought about them before ; [she]101-bébée had never wondered whether velvet was better to wear than woollen serge , or - diamonds lighter on the head than a little cap of linen . But now — [Those women]1205-those women seemed to [her]101-bébée so dazzling , so wondrously , so superhumanly beautiful ; [they]1205-those women seemed like some of those new dahlia flowers , rose and purple and gold , that outblazed the sun on the south border of [[her]101-bébée little garden]1206-her little garden , and blanched all the soft color out of the homely roses , and pimpernels , and sweet - williams , and double - stocks , that had bloomed there ever since the days of [Waterloo]36-waterloo . But [the dahlias]1207-the dahlias had no scent ; and [Bébée]101-bébée wondered if [these women]1208-these women had any heart in [them,—they]1207-the dahlias looked all laughter , and glitter , and vanity . To [the child , whose dreams of womanhood]1209-the child , whose dreams of womanhood were evolved from the face of [the Mary of the Assumption]1210-the mary of the assumption , of the Susannah of [Mieris]135-mieris , and of [that Angel in the blue coif whose face has a light as of the sun,—to [her]1209-the child , whose dreams of womanhood who had dreamed [her]1209-the child , whose dreams of womanhood way into vague perceptions of [her]1209-the child , whose dreams of womanhood own sex 's maidenhood and maternity by help of those great pictures which had been before [her]101-bébée sight from infancy]1211-that angel in the blue coif whose face has a light as of the sun,—to her who had dreamed her way into vague perceptions of her own sex 's maidenhood and maternity by help of those great pictures which had been before her sight from infancy , there was some taint , some artifice , some want , some harshness in [these jewelled women]1212-these jewelled women ; [she]101-bébée could not have reasoned about it , but [she]101-bébée felt it , as [she]101-bébée felt that [the grand dahlias]1213-the grand dahlias missed a flower 's divinity , being scentless . [She]101-bébée was a little bit of wild thyme [herself]101-bébée ; hardy , fragrant , clean , tender , flowering by the wayside , full of honey , though only nourished on the turf and the stones , these gaudy , brilliant , ruby - bright , scarlet - mantled dahlias hurt [her]101-bébée with a dim sense of pain and shame . Fasting , next day at sunrise [she]101-bébée confessed to [Father Francis]105-father francis : — " [I]101-bébée saw [beautiful rich women]2306-beautiful rich women , and [I]101-bébée envied [them]2306-beautiful rich women ; and [I]101-bébée could not pray to [Mary]131-mary last night for thinking of [them]2306-beautiful rich women , for [I]101-bébée hated [them]2306-beautiful rich women so much . "[101-bébée] But [she]101-bébée did not say , — " [I]101-bébée hated [them]2306-beautiful rich women because [they]2306-beautiful rich women were with [him]1215-the good old man . "[101-bébée] Out of [the purest little soul]1214-the purest little soul , [Love]183-love entering drives forth [Candor]184-candor . " That is not like [you]101-bébée at all , [Bébée]101-bébée , "[1215-the good old man] said [the good old man]1215-the good old man , as [she]101-bébée knelt at [his]1215-the good old man feet on the bricks of [[his]1215-the good old man little bare study]1216-his little bare study , where all the books [he]1215-the good old man ever spelt out were treatises on the art of bee - keeping . " [[My]1215-the good old man dear]2056-my dear , [you]101-bébée never were covetous at all , nor did [you]101-bébée ever seem to care for the things of [the world]370-the world . [I]1215-the good old man wish [Jehan]185-old jehan had not given [you]101-bébée those silver buckles ; [I]1215-the good old man think they have set [your]101-bébée little soul on vanities . "[1215-the good old man] " It is not the buckles ; [I]101-bébée am not covetous , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée ; and then [her]101-bébée face grew warm . [She]101-bébée did not know why . and [she]101-bébée did not hear the rest of [Father Francis]105-father francis 's admonitions . But the next noon - time brought [him]1215-the good old man to [the market stall]989-the market stall , and the next also , and so the summer days slipped away , and [Bébée]101-bébée was quite happy if [she]101-bébée saw [him]1215-the good old man in the morning time , to give [him]1215-the good old man a fresh rose , or at evening by the gates , or under the beech - trees , when [he]1215-the good old man brought [her]101-bébée a new book , and sauntered awhile up [the green lane]657-the green lane beside [her]101-bébée . An innocent , unconscious love like [Bébée]101-bébée 's wants so little food to make it all content . Such mere trifles are beautiful and sweet to it . Such slender stray gleams of light suffice to make a broad , bright golden noon of perfect joy around it . All the delirium , and fever , and desire , and despair , that are in maturer passion , are far away from it : far as is the flash of the meteor across sultry skies from the blue forget - [me]0-i - not down in [the brown meadow brook]1219-the brown meadow brook . It was very wonderful to [Bébée]101-bébée that [he]1215-the good old man , [this stranger from [Rubes]150-rubes ' fairyland]1220-this stranger from rubes ' fairyland , could come at all to keep pace with [her]101-bébée little clattering wooden shoes over the dust and the grass in the dim twilight time . The days went by in a trance of sweet amaze , and [she]101-bébée kept count of the hours no more by the cuckoo - clock of [the mill - house]1078-the mill - house , or the deep chimes of [the Brussels belfries]1222-the brussels belfries ; but only by such moments as brought [her]101-bébée a word from [his]1215-the good old man lips , or even a glimpse of [him]1215-the good old man from afar , across [the crowded square]1223-the crowded square . [She]101-bébée sat up half the nights reading the books [he]1215-the good old man gave [her]101-bébée , studying the long cruel polysyllables , and spelling slowly through the phrases that seemed to [her]101-bébée so cramped and tangled , and which yet were a pleasure to unravel forsake of the thought they held . For [Bébée]101-bébée , [ignorant little simple soul that [she]101-bébée was]1224-ignorant little simple soul that she was , had a mind in [her]101-bébée that was eager , observant , quick to acquire , skilful to retain ; and it would happen in certain times that [Flamen]176-flamen , speaking to [her]101-bébée of the things which [he]176-flamen gave to [her]101-bébée to read , would think to [himself]176-flamen that [this child]2266-this child had more wisdom than was often to be found in [schools]1226-schools . Meanwhile [he]176-flamen pondered various studies in various stages of a Gretchen , and made love to [Bébée]101-bébée — made love at least by [his]1215-the good old man eyes and by [his]1215-the good old man voice , not hurrying [his]1215-the good old man pleasant task , but hovering about [her]101-bébée softly , and mindful not to scare [her]101-bébée , as [a man]710-a man will gently lower [his]710-a man hand over a poised butterfly that [he]710-a man seeks to kill , and which one single movement , a thought too quick , may scare away to safety . [Bébée]101-bébée knew where [he]176-flamen lived in [the street of Mary of [Burgundy]58-burgundy]2290-the street of mary of burgundy : in [an old palace that belonged to [a great Flemish noble , who never dwelt [there]2000-there [himself]1230-a great flemish noble , who never dwelt there himself]1230-a great flemish noble , who never dwelt there himself]1229-an old palace that belonged to a great flemish noble , who never dwelt there himself ; but to ask anything about [him]176-flamen — why [he]176-flamen was [there]2000-there ? what [his]176-flamen rank was ? why [he]176-flamen stayed in [the city]225-the city at all?—was a sort of treason that never entered [her]101-bébée thoughts . [Psyche]186-psyche , if [she]186-psyche had been as simple and loyal as [Bébée]101-bébée was , would never have lighted [her]186-psyche own candle ; but even [Psyche]186-psyche would not have borrowed [any one else]2051-any one else 's lamp to lighten the love darkness . To [Bébée]101-bébée [he]176-flamen was sacred , unapproachable , unquestionable ; [he]176-flamen was a wonderful , perfect happiness that had fallen into [her]186-psyche life ; [he]176-flamen was a gift of [God]108-god , as the sun was . [She]186-psyche took [his]176-flamen going and coming as [she]186-psyche took that of the sun , never dreaming of reproaching [his]176-flamen absence , never dreaming of asking if in the empty night [he]176-flamen shone on any other worlds than [hers]186-psyche . It was hardly so much a faith with [her]186-psyche as an instinct ; faith must reason ere it know itself to be faith . [Bébée]101-bébée never reasoned any more than [her]186-psyche roses did . [The good folks in [the market place]483-the market place]1235-the good folks in the market place watched [her]186-psyche a little anxiously ; [they]1235-the good folks in the market place thought ill of that little moss - rose that every day found its way to [one wearer]1237-one wearer only ; but after all [they]1235-the good folks in the market place did not see much , and [the neighbors]371-the neighbors nothing at all . For [he]176-flamen never went [home]289-home to [her]186-psyche , nor with [her]186-psyche , and most of the time that [he]176-flamen spent with [Bébée]101-bébée was in the quiet evening shadows , as [she]186-psyche went up with [her]186-psyche empty basket through [the deserted country roads]1240-the deserted country roads . [Bébée]101-bébée was all day long in [the city]225-the city , indeed , as [other girls]485-other girls were , but with [her]186-psyche it had always been different . [Antoine]103-antoine had always been with [her]186-psyche up to the day of [his]103-antoine death ; and after [his]103-antoine death [she]186-psyche had sat in the same place , surrounded by [the people [she]186-psyche had known from infancy]1243-the people she had known from infancy , and an insult to [her]186-psyche would have been answered by a stroke from [the cobbler]638-the cobbler 's strap or from [the tinker]637-the tinker 's hammer . There was [one girl only who ever tried to do [her]186-psyche any harm]1246-one girl only who ever tried to do her any harm — [a good - looking stout wench , who stood at the corner of the [Montagne de la Cour]59-montagne de la cour with a stall of fruit in the summer time , and in winter time drove a milk cart over the snow]1247-a good - looking stout wench , who stood at the corner of the montagne de la cour with a stall of fruit in the summer time , and in winter time drove a milk cart over the snow . [This girl]1248-this girl would get at [her]1248-this girl sometimes , and talk of [the students]2165-the students , and tell [her]1248-this girl how good it was to get out of [the town]412-the town on a holiday , and go to [any one of [the villages]1252-the villages where there was [Kermesse]7-the kermesse]1251-any one of the villages where there was kermesse and dance , and drink the little blue wine , and have trinkets bought for one , and come [home]289-home in the moonlight in [a char - à - banc]1254-a char - à - banc , with the horns sounding , and [the lads]2107-the lads singing , and the ribbons flying from the old horse 's ears . " [She]1256-the fruit girl is such [a little close sly thing]2309-a little close sly thing ! "[1256-the fruit girl] thought [the fruit girl]1256-the fruit girl , sulkily . To vice , innocence must always seem only a superior kind of chicanery . " [We]2310-we dance almost every evening , [the children]373-the children and [I]101-bébée , "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée had answered when urged fifty times by [this girl]1248-this girl to go to fairs , and balls at [the wine shops]1258-the wine shops . " That does just as well . And [I]101-bébée have seen [Kermesse]7-the kermesse once at [Malines]60-malines — it was beautiful . [I]101-bébée went with [Mère Dax]188-mère dax , but it cost a great deal [I]101-bébée know , though [she]188-mère dax did not let [me]101-bébée pay . "[101-bébée] " [[You]1256-the fruit girl little fool]2312-you little fool ! "[1256-the fruit girl] [the fruit girl]1256-the fruit girl would say , and grin , and eat a pear . But [the good honest old women who sat about in [the Grande Place]502-the grande place]1260-the good honest old women who sat about in the grande place , hearing , had always taken [the fruit girl]1256-the fruit girl to task , when [they]1260-the good honest old women who sat about in the grande place got [her]1256-the fruit girl by [herself]1256-the fruit girl . " Leave [the child]377-the child alone , [you]1256-the fruit girl mischievous one , "[1260-the good honest old women who sat about in the grande place] said [they]1260-the good honest old women who sat about in the grande place . " Be content with being base [yourself]1256-the fruit girl . Look [you]1256-the fruit girl , [Lisette]120-lisette ; [she]377-the child is not one like [you]1256-the fruit girl to make eyes at [the law students]2314-the law students , and pester [the painter lads]2315-the painter lads for a day 's outing . Let [her]377-the child be , or [we]2316-we will tell [[your]1256-the fruit girl mother]2231-your mother how [you]1256-the fruit girl leave the fruit for [the gutter children]2318-the gutter children to pick and thieve , while [you]1256-the fruit girl are stealing up the stairs into [[that young French fellow]2319-that young french fellow 's chamber]2320-that young french fellow 's chamber . Oh , oh ! a fine beating [you]1256-the fruit girl will get when [she]377-the child knows ! "[1260-the good honest old women who sat about in the grande place] [[Lisette]120-lisette 's mother]1263-lisette 's mother was [a fierce and strong old Brabantoise who exacted heavy reckoning with [[her]1263-lisette 's mother daughter]1265-her daughter for every single plum and peach that [she]1263-lisette 's mother sent out of [[her]1263-lisette 's mother dark sweet - smelling fruit shop]1266-her dark sweet - smelling fruit shop]1264-a fierce and strong old brabantoise who exacted heavy reckoning with her daughter for every single plum and peach that she sent out of her dark sweet - smelling fruit shop to be sunned in [the streets]608-the streets , and under [the students]2165-the students ' love - glances . So [the girl]1269-the girl took heed , and left [Bébée]101-bébée alone . " What should [I]1269-the girl want [her]377-the child to come with [us]2321-us for ? "[1269-the girl] [she]1269-the girl reasoned with [herself]1269-the girl . " [She]377-the child is twice as pretty as [I]1269-the girl am ; [Jules]113-jules might take to [her]377-the child instead — who knows ? "[1269-the girl] So that [she]1269-the girl was at once savage and yet triumphant when [she]1269-the girl saw , as [she]1269-the girl thought , [Bébée]101-bébée drifting down the high flood of temptation . " Oh , oh , [you]101-bébée dainty one ! "[1269-the girl] [she]1269-the girl cried one day to [her]101-bébée . " So [you]101-bébée would not take the nuts and mulberries that do for [us]2321-us [common folk]2322-common folk , because [you]101-bébée had a mind for a fine pine out of [the hothouses]2323-the hothouses ! That was all , was it ? Eh , well ; [I]1269-the girl do not begrudge [you]101-bébée . Only take care ; remember , the nuts and mulberries last through summer and autumn , and there are heaps of them on every fair - stall and [street corner]2324-street corner ; but the pine , that is eaten in a day , one springtime , and its like does not grow in the hedges . [You]101-bébée will have [your]101-bébée mouth full of sugar an hour,—and then , [eh!—you]101-bébée will go famished all the year . "[1269-the girl] " [I]101-bébée do not understand , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , looking up , with [her]101-bébée thoughts far away , and scarcely hearing the words spoken to [her]101-bébée . " Oh , [pretty little fool]2325-pretty little fool ! [you]2325-pretty little fool understand well enough , "[120-lisette] said [Lisette]120-lisette , grinning , as [she]120-lisette rubbed up a melon . " Does [he]2326-he give [you]2325-pretty little fool fine things ? [You]2325-pretty little fool might let [me]120-lisette see . "[120-lisette] " [No one]1950-no one gives [me]1269-the girl anything . "[1269-the girl] " Chut ! [you]101-bébée want [me]120-lisette to believe that . Why [Jules]113-jules is only [a lad]2328-a lad , and [[his]113-jules father]597-his father is [a silk mercer]2330-a silk mercer , and only gives [him]113-jules a hundred francs a month , but [Jules]113-jules buys [me]120-lisette all [I]120-lisette want — somehow — or do [you]101-bébée think [I]120-lisette would take the trouble to set [my]120-lisette cap straight when [he]113-jules goes by ? [He]113-jules gave [me]120-lisette these ear - rings , look . [I]120-lisette wish [you]101-bébée would let [me]120-lisette see what [you]101-bébée get . "[120-lisette] But [Bébée]101-bébée had gone away — unheeding — dreaming of [Juliet]189-juliet and of [Jeanne]114-jeanne d'Arc , of whom [he]1270-he had told [her]101-bébée tales . [He]1270-he made sketches of [her]101-bébée sometimes , but seldom pleased [himself]1270-he . It was not so easy as [he]1270-he had imagined that it would prove to portray this little flower - like face , with the clear eyes and [the child]377-the child 's open brow . [He]1270-he who had painted [Phryne]165-phryne so long and faithfully had got a taint on [his]1270-he brush — [he]1270-he could not paint this pure , bright , rosy dawn — [he]1270-he [who had always painted the glare of midnight gas on rouge or rags]1272-who had always painted the glare of midnight gas on rouge or rags . Yet [he]1270-he felt that if [he]1270-he could transfer to canvas the light that was on [Bébée]101-bébée 's face [he]1270-he would get what [Scheffer]160-scheffer had missed . For a time it eluded [him]1270-he . [You]1273-you shall paint a gold and glistening brocade , or a fan of peacock 's feathers , to perfection , and yet , perhaps , the dewy whiteness of the humble little field daisy shall baffle and escape [you]1273-you . [He]1270-he felt , too , that [he]1270-he must catch [her]101-bébée expression flying as [he]1270-he would do the flash of a swallow 's wing across a blue sky ; [he]1270-he knew that [Bébée]101-bébée , forced to studied attitudes in [an atelier]1274-an atelier , would be no longer the ideal that [he]1270-he wanted . More than once [he]1270-he came and filled in more fully [his]1270-he various designs in [the little hut garden]1275-the little hut garden , among the sweet gray lavender and the golden disks of the sunflowers ; and more than once [Bébée]101-bébée was missed from [her]101-bébée place in the front of [the Broodhuis]494-the broodhuis . [The Varnhart children]2025-the varnhart children would gather now and then open - mouthed at the wicket , and [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs would shake [her]106-mère krebs head as [she]106-mère krebs went by on [her]106-mère krebs sheepskin saddle , and mutter that [the child]377-the child 's head would be turned by vanity ; and [old Jehan]185-old jehan would lean on [his]185-old jehan stick and peer through the sweetbrier , and wonder stupidly if [this strange man who could make Bébée 's face beam over again upon that panel of wood]1279-this strange man who could make bébée 's face beam over again upon that panel of wood could not give [him]185-old jehan back [[his]185-old jehan dead daughter]1280-his dead daughter who had been pushed away under the black earth so long , long before , when the red mill had been brave and new , [the red mill that [the boys]1943-the boys and [girls]421-girls called old]1281-the red mill that the boys and girls called old . But except these , [no one]1950-no one noticed much . [Painters]1285-painters were no rare sights in [Brabant]3-brabant . [The people]504-the people were used to see [them]1285-painters coming and going , making pictures of mud and stones , and ducks and sheep , and of all common and silly things . " What does [he]185-old jehan pay [you]101-bébée , [Bébée]101-bébée ? "[504-the people] [they]504-the people used to ask , with [the shrewd Flemish]152-flemish thought after the main chance . " Nothing , "[504-the people] [Bébée]101-bébée would answer , with a quick color in [her]101-bébée face ; and [they]504-the people would reply in contemptuous reproof , " [Careless little fool]2331-careless little fool ; [you]101-bébée should make enough to buy [you]101-bébée wood all winter . When [the man from [Ghent]20-ghent]2332-the man from ghent painted [Trine]118-trine and [her]118-trine cow , [he]2332-the man from ghent gave [her]118-trine a whole gold bit for standing still so long in the clover . [The Krebs]118-trine would be sure to lend [you]101-bébée [her]118-trine cow , if it be the cow that makes the difference . "[504-the people] [Bébée]101-bébée was silent , weeding [her]101-bébée carnation bed;—what could [she]101-bébée tell [them]504-the people that [they]504-the people would understand ? [She]101-bébée seemed so far away from [them]504-the people all — [those good friends of [her]101-bébée childhood]1287-those good friends of her childhood — now that this wonderful new world of [his]1288-his giving had opened to [her]101-bébée sight . [She]101-bébée lived in a dream . Whether [she]101-bébée sat in [the market place]483-the market place taking copper coins , or in the moonlight with a book on [her]101-bébée knees , it was all the same . [Her]101-bébée feet ran , [her]101-bébée tongue spoke , [her]101-bébée hands worked ; [she]101-bébée did not neglect [[her]101-bébée goat]1290-her goat or [[her]101-bébée garden]413-her garden , [she]101-bébée did not forsake [[her]101-bébée house]1292-her house labor or [her]101-bébée good deeds to [old Annémie]142-annémie ; but all the while [she]101-bébée only heard one voice , [she]101-bébée only felt one touch , [she]101-bébée only saw one face . Here and there — one in a million — there is a female thing that can love like this , once and forever . [Such an one]1293-such an one is dedicated , birth upwards , to [the Mater Dolorosa]190-the mater dolorosa . [He]1294-he had something nearer akin to affection for [her]101-bébée than [he]1294-he had ever had in [his]1294-he life for anything , but [he]1294-he was never in love with [her]101-bébée — no more in love with [her]101-bébée than with the moss - rosebuds that [she]101-bébée fastened in [his]1294-he breast . Yet [he]1294-he played with [her]101-bébée , because [she]101-bébée was such [a little , soft , tempting female thing]1295-a little , soft , tempting female thing ; and because , to see [her]101-bébée face flush , and [her]101-bébée heart heave , to feel [her]101-bébée fresh feelings stir into life , and to watch [her]101-bébée changes from shyness to confidence , and from frankness again into fear , was a natural pastime in the lazy golden weather . That [he]1294-he spared [her]101-bébée as far as [he]1294-he did,—when after all [she]101-bébée would have married [Jeannot]144-jeannot anyhow,—and that [he]1294-he sketched [her]101-bébée face in the open air , and never entered [[her]101-bébée hut]491-her hut and never beguiled [her]101-bébée to [[his]1294-he own old palace in [the city]225-the city]1297-his own old palace in the city , was a new virtue in [himself]1294-he for which [he]1294-he hardly knew whether to feel respect or ridicule ; anyway , it seemed virtue to [him]1294-he . So long as [he]1294-he did not seduce the body , it seemed to [him]1294-he that it could never matter how [he]1294-he slew [the soul,—the little , honest , happy , pure , frank soul]1299-the soul,—the little , honest , happy , pure , frank soul , that amidst its poverty and hardships was like a robin 's song to the winter sun . " Hoot , toot , pretty innocent , so [you]101-bébée are no better than the rest of [us]2333-us , "[1300-her enemy] hissed [[her]101-bébée enemy]1300-her enemy , [Lisette]120-lisette , [the fruit girl]1256-the fruit girl , against [her]101-bébée as [she]101-bébée went by [the stall]1302-the stall one evening as the sun set . " Prut ! so it was no such purity after all that made [you]101-bébée never look at [the student lads]2334-the student lads and [the soldiers]1192-the soldiers , eh ? [You]101-bébée were so dainty of taste , [you]101-bébée must needs pick and choose , and , [Lord]2336-lord 's sake , after all [your]101-bébée coyness , to drop at a beckoning finger as one may say — pong!—in a minute , like an apple over - ripe ! Oh hé , [you]101-bébée sly one ! "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée flushed red , in a sort of instinct of offence ; not sure what [her]101-bébée fault was , but vaguely stung by the brutal words . [Bébée]101-bébée walked homeward by [him]1303-him , with [her]101-bébée empty baskets : looked at [him]1303-him with grave wondering eyes . " What did [she]101-bébée mean ? [I]101-bébée do not understand . [I]101-bébée must have done some wrong — or [she]101-bébée thinks so . Do [you]1303-him know ? "[101-bébée] [Flamen]176-flamen laughed , and answered [her]101-bébée evasively , — " [You]101-bébée have done [her]101-bébée the wrong of a fair skin when [hers]101-bébée is brown , and a little foot while [hers]101-bébée is as big as a trooper 's ; there is no greater sin , [Bébée]101-bébée , possible in [woman]2337-woman to [woman]2337-woman . "[176-flamen] " Hold [your]101-bébée peace , [[you]101-bébée shrill jade]2339-you shrill jade , "[176-flamen] [he]176-flamen added , in anger to [the fruiterer]1304-the fruiterer , flinging at [her]101-bébée a crown piece , that [the girl]1269-the girl caught , and bit with [her]101-bébée teeth with a chuckle . " Do not heed [her]101-bébée , [Bébée]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée is [a coarse - tongued brute]2340-a coarse - tongued brute , and is jealous , no doubt . "[176-flamen] " Jealous?—of what ? "[176-flamen] The word had no meaning to [Bébée]101-bébée . " That [I]101-bébée am not [a student]2341-a student or [a soldier]2342-a soldier , as [[her]101-bébée lovers]2343-her lovers are . "[101-bébée] As [[her]101-bébée lovers]2343-her lovers were ! [Bébée]101-bébée felt [her]101-bébée face burn again . Was [he]176-flamen [[her]101-bébée lover]1307-her lover then ? [The child]377-the child 's innocent body and soul thrilled with a hot , sweet delight and fear commingled . [Bébée]101-bébée was not quite satisfied until [she]101-bébée had knelt down that night and asked [the Master of [all poor maidens]1310-all poor maidens]1309-the master of all poor maidens to see if there were any wickedness in [her]101-bébée heart , hidden there like a bee in a rose , and if there were to take it out and make [her]101-bébée worthier of this wonderful new happiness in [her]101-bébée life . The next day , waking with a radiant little soul as a bird in [a forest]1311-a forest wakes in summer [Bébée]101-bébée was all alone in [the lane by the swans]1312-the lane by the swans ' water . In the gray of the dawn all [the good folk]1313-the good folk except [herself]101-bébée and [lame old [Jehan]185-old jehan]1314-lame old jehan had tramped off to a pilgrimage , Liége way , which [the bishop of [the city]225-the city]1315-the bishop of the city had enjoined on [all the faithful]1317-all the faithful as a sacred duty . Bébée doing [her]101-bébée work , singing , thinking how good [God]108-god was , and dreaming over a thousand fancies of the wonderful stories [he]185-old jehan had told [her]101-bébée , and of the exquisite delight that would lie for [her]101-bébée in watching for [him]185-old jehan all through the shining hours , [Bébée]101-bébée felt [her]101-bébée little heart leap like a squirrel as the voice that was the music of heaven to [her]101-bébée called through the stillness,—"Good day , [pretty one]2009-pretty one ! [you]2009-pretty one are as early as the lark , [Bébée]101-bébée . [I]101-bébée go to [Mayence]191-mayence , so [I]101-bébée thought [I]101-bébée would look at [you]2009-pretty one one moment as [I]101-bébée pass . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée ran down through the wet grass in a tumult of joy . [She]101-bébée had never seen [him]185-old jehan so early in the day — never so early as this , when [nobody]1935-nobody was up and stirring except birds and beasts and [peasant folk]1319-peasant folk . [She]101-bébée did not know how pretty [she]101-bébée looked [herself]101-bébée ; like a rain - washed wild rose ; [her]101-bébée feet gleaming with dew , [her]101-bébée cheeks warm with health and joy ; [her]101-bébée sunny clustering hair free from the white cap and tumbling a little about [her]101-bébée throat , because [she]101-bébée had been stooping over the carnations . [Flamen]176-flamen loosed the wicket latch , and thought there might be better ways of spending the day than in [the gray shadows of [old Mechlin]8-mechlin]1320-the gray shadows of old mechlin . " Will [you]101-bébée give [me]176-flamen a draught of water ? "[176-flamen] [he]176-flamen asked [her]101-bébée as [he]176-flamen crossed [the garden]1940-the garden . " [I]101-bébée will give [you]101-bébée breakfast , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , happy as a bird . [She]101-bébée felt no shame for the smallness of [[her]101-bébée home]1322-her home ; no confusion at the poverty of [[her]101-bébée little place]1323-her little place ; such embarrassments are born of self - consciousness , and [Bébée]101-bébée had no more self - consciousness than [her]101-bébée own sweet , gray lavender - bush blowing against the door . The lavender - bush has no splendor like the roses , has no colors like the hollyhocks ; it is a simple , plain , gray thing that the bees love and that [the cottagers]1324-the cottagers cherish , and that keeps the moth from the homespun linen , and that goes with the dead to [[their]1325-their graves]1326-their graves . It has many virtues and infinite sweetness , but it does not know it or think of it ; and if [the village girls]1327-the village girls ever tell it so , it fancies [they]1327-the village girls only praise it out of kindness as [they]1327-the village girls put its slender fragrant spears away in [their]1327-the village girls warm bosoms . [Bébée]101-bébée was like [her]101-bébée lavender , and now that this beautiful Purple Emperor butterfly came from the golden sunbeams to find pleasure for a second in [her]101-bébée freshness , [she]101-bébée was only very grateful , as the lavender - bush was to [the village girls]1327-the village girls . " [I]101-bébée will give [you]1329-he [your]1329-he breakfast , "[101-bébée] said [Bébée]101-bébée , flushing rosily with pleasure , and putting away the ivy coils that [he]1329-he might enter . " [I]101-bébée have very little , [you]1329-he know , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée added , wistfully . " Only goat 's milk and bread ; but if that will do — and there is some honey — and if [you]1329-he would eat a salad , [I]101-bébée would cut one fresh . "[101-bébée] [He]1329-he did enter , and glanced round [him]1329-he with a curious pity and wonder both in one . [It]1330-its was such a little , small , square place ; and [its]1330-its floor was of beaten clay ; and [its]1330-its unceiled roof [he]1329-he could have touched ; and [its]1330-its absolute poverty was so plain,—and yet [the child]377-the child looked so happy in it , and was so like a flower , and was so dainty and fresh , and even so full of grace . [She]101-bébée stood and looked at [him]1329-he with frank and grateful eyes ; [she]101-bébée could hardly believe that [he]1329-he was [here]1953-here ; [he]1329-he , [the stranger of [[Rubes]150-rubes ' land]2150-rubes ' land , in [[her]101-bébée own little rush - covered home]1335-her own little rush - covered home]1333-the stranger of rubes ' land , in her own little rush - covered home . But [she]101-bébée was not embarrassed by it ; [she]101-bébée was glad and proud . There is a dignity of [peasants]353-peasants as well as of kings,—the dignity that comes from all absence of effort , all freedom from pretence . [Bébée]101-bébée had this , and [she]101-bébée had more still than this : [she]101-bébée had the absolute simplicity of childhood with [her]101-bébée still . [Some women]1337-some women have it still when [they]1337-some women are four - score . [She]101-bébée could have looked at [him]1329-he forever , [she]101-bébée was so happy ; [she]101-bébée cared nothing now for [those dazzling dahlias]1338-those dazzling dahlias — [he]1329-he had left [them]1338-those dazzling dahlias ; [he]1329-he was actually here — here in [her]101-bébée own , [little dear home]1339-little dear home , with the cocks looking in at the threshold , and the sweet - peas nodding at the lattice , and the starling crying , " Bonjour ! Bonjour ! "[101-bébée] " [You]1329-he are tired , [I]101-bébée am sure [you]1329-he must be tired , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said , pulling [her]101-bébée little bed forward for [him]1329-he to sit on , for there were only two wooden stools in [the hut]284-the hut , and no chair at all . Then [she]101-bébée took [his]1329-he sketching - easel and brushes from [his]1329-he hand , and would have kneeled and taken the dust off [his]1329-he boots if [he]1329-he would have let [her]101-bébée ; and went hither and thither gladly and lightly , bringing [him]1329-he a wooden bowl of milk and the rest of the slender fare , and cutting as quick as thought fresh cresses and lettuce from [[her]101-bébée garden]413-her garden , and bringing [him]1329-he , as the crown of all , [Father Francis]105-father francis 's honey - comb on vine - leaves , with some pretty sprays of box and mignonette scattered about it — doing all this with a swift , sweet grace that robbed the labor of all look of servitude , and looking at [him]1329-he ever and again with a smile that said as clearly as any words , " [I]101-bébée can not do much , but what [I]101-bébée do , [I]101-bébée do with all [my]101-bébée heart . "[101-bébée] There was something in the sight of [her]101-bébée going and coming in [those simple household errands]1342-those simple household errands , across the sunlit floor , that moved [him]1329-he as some mountain air sung on an alp by [a girl driving [her]101-bébée cows to [pasture]1344-pasture]1343-a girl driving her cows to pasture may move [a listener who indifferent has heard the swell of the organ of La Hague]1345-a listener who indifferent has heard the swell of the organ of la hague , or the recitative of [a great singer in [San Carlo]62-san carlo]1346-a great singer in san carlo . The gray lavender blowing at the house door has its charm for [those who are tired of the camellias that float in the porcelain bowls of midnight suppers]1347-those who are tired of the camellias that float in the porcelain bowls of midnight suppers . [This man]806-this man was not good . [He]806-this man was idle and vain , and amorous and cold , and had been spoiled by the world in which [he]806-this man had passed [his]806-this man days ; but [he]806-this man had the temper of [an artist]1349-an artist : [he]806-this man had something , too , of [a poet]1966-a poet 's fancy ; [he]806-this man was vaguely touched and won by this simple soul that looked at [him]806-this man out of [Bébée]101-bébée 's eyes with some look that in all its simplicity had a divine gleam in it that made [him]806-this man half ashamed . [He]806-this man had known [women by the thousand]1351-women by the thousand , [good women]1352-good women and bad ; [women whom [he]806-this man had dealt ill with and [women who had dealt ill with]1354-women who had dealt ill with [him]806-this man]1353-women whom he had dealt ill with and women who had dealt ill with him ; but this [he]806-this man had not known — this frank , fearless , tender , gay , grave , innocent , industrious little life , helping itself , feeding itself , defending itself , working for [itself]1355-itself and for [others]876-others , and vaguely seeking all the while some unseen light , [some unknown god]1357-some unknown god , with a blind faith so infinitely ignorant and yet so infinitely pathetic . " All [the people]504-the people are gone on a pilgrimage , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée explained to [him]806-this man when [he]806-this man asked [her]101-bébée why [[her]101-bébée village]1358-her village was so silent this bright morning . " [They]504-the people are gone to pray for a fine harvest , and that [she]101-bébée wants [herself]101-bébée as well — it costs seven francs apiece . [They]504-the people take [their]504-the people food with [them]504-the people ; [they]504-the people go and laugh and eat in [the fields]306-the fields . [I]101-bébée think it is nonsense . [One]1951-one can say [one]1951-one 's prayers just as well here . [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs thinks so too , but then [she]101-bébée says , ' If [I]101-bébée do not go , it will look ill ; [people]337-people will say [I]101-bébée am irreligious ; and as [we]2350-we make so much by flour , [God]108-god would think it odd for [me]101-bébée to be absent ; and , besides , it is only seven francs there and back ; and if it does please [Heaven]137-heaven , that is cheap , [you]2351-you know . [One]1951-one will get it over and over again in [Paradise]63-paradise . ' That is what [Mere Krebs]192-mere krebs says . But , for [me]101-bébée , [I]101-bébée think it is nonsense . It can not please [God]108-god to go by [train]2353-train and eat galette and waste a whole day in getting dusty . "[101-bébée] When [I]0-i give [the Virgin]386-the virgin [my]0-i cactus flower , [I]0-i do give up a thing [I]0-i love , and [I]0-i let it wither on [her]386-the virgin altar instead of pleasing [me]0-i in bloom here all the week , and then , of course , [she]386-the virgin sees that [I]0-i have done it out of gratitude . But that is different : that [I]0-i am sorry to do , and yet [I]0-i am glad to do it out of love . Do [you]1360-you not know ? " "[1360-you] Yes , [I]0-i know very well . But is [the Virgin]386-the virgin all that [you]1360-you love like this ? " "[386-the virgin] No ; there is [the garden]1940-the garden , and there is [Antoine]103-antoine — [he]103-antoine is dead , [I]0-i know . But [I]0-i think that [we]1363-we should love the dead all the better , not the less , because [they]1364-they can not speak or say that [they]1364-they are angry ; and perhaps one pains [them]1364-they very much when [one]1951-one neglects [them]1364-they , and if [they]1364-they are ever so sad , [they]1364-they can not rise and rebuke [one]1951-one — that is why [I]0-i would rather forget the flowers for [the Church]246-the church than [I]0-i would the flowers for [[his]103-antoine grave]1368-his grave , because [God]108-god can punish [me]0-i , of course , if [he]108-god like , but [Antoine]103-antoine never can — any more — now . " "[103-antoine] [You]1369-her are logical in [your]1369-her sentiment , [[my]0-i dear]2056-my dear , " said [Flamen]176-flamen , who was more moved than [he]176-flamen cared to feel . "[1369-her] The union is a rare one in [your]1369-her sex . Who taught [you]1369-her to reason ? " "[1950-no one] [No one]1950-no one . And [I]0-i do not know what to be logical means . Is it that [you]1369-her laugh at [me]0-i ? " "[1369-her] No . [I]0-i do not laugh . And [[your]1369-her pilgrims]1372-your pilgrims — [they]1372-your pilgrims are gone for all day ? " "[1372-your pilgrims] Yes . [They]1372-your pilgrims are gone to [the Sacred Heart]1373-the sacred heart at [St. Marie en Bois]64-st. marie en bois . It is on the way to [Liége]65-liége . [They]1372-your pilgrims will come back at nightfall . And [some of [them]1372-your pilgrims]1374-some of them will be sure to have drunk too much , and [the children]373-the children will get so cross . [Prosper Bar]193-prosper bar , who is [a Calvinist]1376-a calvinist , always says , ' Do not mix up prayer and play ; [you]1369-her would not cut a gherkin in [your]1369-her honey ' ; but [I]0-i do not know why [he]193-prosper bar called prayer a gherkin , because it is sweet enough — sweeter than anything , [I]0-i think . When [I]0-i pray to [the Virgin]386-the virgin to let [me]0-i see [you]1369-her next day , [I]0-i go to bed quite happy , because [she]386-the virgin will do it , [I]0-i know , if it will be good for [me]0-i . " "[386-the virgin] But if it were not good for [you]1369-her , [Bébée]101-bébée ? Would [you]1369-her cease to wish it then ? " [He]193-prosper bar rose as [he]193-prosper bar spoke , and went across the floor and drew away [her]1369-her hand that was parting the flax , and took it in [his]193-prosper bar own and stroked it , indulgently and carelessly , as [a man]710-a man may stroke the soft fur of a young cat . Leaning against the little lattice and looking down on [her]1369-her with musing eyes , half smiling , half serious , half amorous , half sad , [Bébée]101-bébée looked up with a sudden and delicious terror that ran through [her]1369-her as the charm of the snake 's gaze runs through the bewildered bird . "[1369-her] Would [you]1369-her cease to wish it if it were not good ? " [he]193-prosper bar asked again . [Bébée]101-bébée 's face grew pale and troubled . [She]1369-her left [her]1369-her hand in [his]193-prosper bar because [she]1369-her did not think any shame of [his]193-prosper bar taking it . But the question suddenly flung the perplexity and darkness of doubt into the clearness of [[her]1369-her pure child]2355-her pure child 's conscience . All [her]1369-her ways had been straight and sunlit before [her]1369-her . [She]1369-her had never had a divided duty . The religion and the pleasure of [her]1369-her simple little life had always gone hand - in - hand , greeting [one another]320-one another , and never for an instant in conflict . In any hesitation of [her]1369-her own [she]1369-her had always gone to [Father Francis]105-father francis , and [he]105-father francis had disentangled the web for [her]1369-her and made all plain . But here was a difficulty in which [she]1369-her could never go to [Father Francis]105-father francis . Right and wrong , duty and desire , were for the first time arrayed before [her]1369-her in [their]2357-their ghastly and unending warfare . It frightened [her]1369-her with a certain breathless sense of peril — the peril of a time when in lieu of [that gentle Mother of Roses whom [she]1369-her kneeled to among the flowers]2358-that gentle mother of roses whom she kneeled to among the flowers , [she]1369-her would only see a dusky shadow looming between [her]1369-her and the beauty of life and the light of the sun . What [he]105-father francis said was quite vague to [her]1369-her . [She]1369-her attached no definite danger to [his]105-father francis words . [She]1369-her only thought — to see [him]105-father francis was so great a joy — if [Mary]131-mary forbade it , would [she]1369-her not take it if [she]1369-her could notwithstanding , always , always , always ? [He]105-father francis kept [her]1369-her hand in [his]105-father francis , and watched with contentment the changing play of the shade and sorrow , the fear and fascination , on [her]1369-her face . "[1378-you] [You]1378-you do not know , [Bébée]101-bébée ? " [he]105-father francis said at length , knowing well [himself]105-father francis ; so much better than ever [she]1369-her knew . "[101-bébée] Well , [dear]2076-dear , that is not flattering to [me]0-i . But it is natural . [The good Virgin]194-the good virgin of course gives [you]2076-dear all [you]2076-dear have , food , and clothes , and [[your]2076-dear garden]1380-your garden , and [your]2076-dear pretty plump chickens ; and [I]0-i am only [a stranger]2039-a stranger . [You]2076-dear could not offend [her]1382-her for [me]0-i ; that is not likely . " [The child]377-the child was cut to the heart by the sadness and humility of words of whose studied artifice [she]1369-her had no suspicion . [She]1369-her thought that [she]1369-her seemed to [him]2076-dear ungrateful and selfish , and yet all the mooring - ropes that held [her]1369-her little boat of life to [the harbor of [its]1369-her simple religion]2360-the harbor of its simple religion seemed cut away , and [she]1369-her seemed drifting helpless and rudderless upon [an unknown sea]2361-an unknown sea . "[2076-dear] [I]0-i never did do wrong — that [I]0-i know , " [she]1369-her said , timidly , and lifted [her]1369-her eyes to [his]2076-dear with an unconscious appeal in them . "[0-i] But — [I]0-i do not see why it should be wrong to speak with [you]0-i . [You]0-i are good , and [you]0-i lend [me]0-i beautiful things out of [other men]1383-other men 's minds that will make [me]0-i less ignorant : [[Our]1384-our Lady]275-our lady could not be angry with that — [she]275-our lady must like it . " "[1386-our lady?—oh] [[Our]1384-our Lady?—oh]1386-our lady?—oh , [poor little simpleton!—where]1387-poor little simpleton!—where will [her]275-our lady reign be when Ignorance has once been cut down root and branch ? " [he]195-bébée?—you thought to [himself]195-bébée?—you : but [he]195-bébée?—you only answered , — "[275-our lady] But whether [she]275-our lady like it or not , [Bébée?—you]195-bébée?—you beg the question , [[my]0-i dear]2056-my dear ; [you]2056-my dear are — [you]2056-my dear are not so frank as usual — think , and tell [me]0-i honestly ? " [He]195-bébée?—you knew quite well , but it amused [him]195-bébée?—you to see the perplexed trouble that this , the first divided duty of [her]0-i short years , brought with it . [Bébée]101-bébée looked at [him]195-bébée?—you , and loosened [her]101-bébée hand from [his]195-bébée?—you , and sat quite still . [Her]101-bébée lips had a little quiver in them . "[0-i] [I]0-i think . " [she]101-bébée said at last , "[0-i] [I]0-i think — if it be wrong , still [I]0-i will wish it — yes . Only [I]0-i will not tell [myself]0-i it is right . [I]0-i will just say to [[Our]1389-our Lady]275-our lady , ' [I]0-i am wicked , perhaps , but [I]0-i can not help it ' So , [I]0-i will not deceive [her]275-our lady at all ; and perhaps in time [she]275-our lady may forgive . But [I]0-i think [you]1391-he only say it to try [me]0-i . It can not , [I]0-i am sure , be wrong — any more than it is to talk to [Jeannot]144-jeannot or to [Bac]133-bac . " [He]1391-he had driven [her]101-bébée into the subtleties of doubt , but [the honest little soul in [her]101-bébée]2362-the honest little soul in her found a way out , as a flower in [a cellar]2363-a cellar finds its way through the stones to light . [He]1391-he plucked the ivy leaves and threw them at the chickens on the bricks without , with a certain impatience in the action . The simplicity and the directness of the answer disarmed [him]1391-he ; [he]1391-he was almost ashamed to use against [her]101-bébée the weapons of [his]1391-he habitual warfare . It was like a maître d'armes fencing with bare steel against [a little naked child armed with a blest palm - sheaf]2364-a little naked child armed with a blest palm - sheaf . When [she]101-bébée had thus brought [him]1391-he all [she]101-bébée had , and [he]1391-he to please [her]101-bébée had sat down to the simple food , [she]101-bébée gathered a spray of roses and set it in a pot beside [him]1391-he , then left [him]1391-he and went and stood at a little distance , waiting , with [her]101-bébée hands lightly crossed on [her]101-bébée chest , to see if there were anything that [he]1391-he might want . [He]1391-he ate and drank well to please [her]101-bébée , looking at [her]101-bébée often as [he]1391-he did so . "[0-i] [I]0-i break [your]1392-you bread , [Bébée]101-bébée , " [he]1391-he said , with a tone that seemed strange to her,—"I[0-i] break [your]1392-you bread . [I]0-i must keep [Arab]196-arab faith with [you]0-i . " "[0-i] What is that ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i mean — [I]0-i must never betray [you]0-i . " "[0-i] Betray [me]0-i How could [you]0-i ? " "[0-i] Well — hurt [you]0-i in any way . " "[0-i] Ah , [I]0-i am sure [you]0-i would never do that . " [He]1392-you was silent , and looked at the spray of roses . "[0-i] Sit down and spin , " [he]1392-you said impatiently . "[0-i] [I]0-i am ashamed to see [you]1392-you stand there , and [a woman]217-a woman never looks so well as when [she]217-a woman spins . Sit down , and [I]0-i will eat the good things [you]1392-you have brought [me]0-i . But [I]0-i can not if [you]1392-you stand and look . " "[1392-you] [I]0-i beg [your]0-i pardon . [I]0-i did not know , " [she]0-i said , ashamed lest [she]0-i should have seemed rude to [him]1392-you ; and [she]0-i drew out [her]0-i wheel under the light of the lattice , and sat down to it , and began to disentangle the threads . It was a pretty picture — the low , square casement ; the frame of ivy , the pink and white of the climbing sweet - peas : [the girl]1269-the girl 's head ; the cool , wet leaves : the old wooden spinning - wheel , that purred like a sleepy cat . "[0-i] [I]0-i want to paint [you]1392-you as [Gretchen]161-gretchen , only it will be a shame . " [he]1392-you said . "[161-gretchen] Who is [Gretchen]161-gretchen ? " "[161-gretchen] [You]1392-you shall read of [her]161-gretchen by - and - by . And [you]1392-you live [here]1953-here all by [yourself]1392-you ? " "[1392-you] Since [Antoine]103-antoine died — yes . " "[103-antoine] And are never dull ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i have no time , and [I]0-i do not think [I]0-i would be if [I]0-i had time — there is so much to think of , and [one]1951-one never can understand . " "[1951-one] But [you]1392-you must be very brave and laborious to do all [your]1392-you work [yourself]1392-you . Is it possible [a child]334-a child like [you]1392-you can spin , and wash , and bake , and garden , and do everything ? " "[1397-many] Oh , [many]1397-many do more than [I.]0-i [[Babette]197-babette 's eldest daughter]1398-babette 's eldest daughter is only twelve , and [she]1398-babette 's eldest daughter does much more , because [she]1398-babette 's eldest daughter has all [the children]373-the children to look after ; and [they]373-the children are very , very poor ; [they]373-the children often have nothing but a stew of nettles and perhaps a few snails , days together . " "[101-bébée] That is lean , bare , ugly , gruesome poverty ; there is plenty of that everywhere . But [you]1392-you , [Bébée]101-bébée — [you]1392-you are an idyll . " [Bébée]101-bébée looked across [the hut]284-the hut and smiled , and broke [her]101-bébée thread . [She]101-bébée did not know what [he]2056-my dear meant , but if [she]101-bébée were anything that pleased [him]2056-my dear , it was well . "[101-bébée] Who were [those beautiful women]1400-those beautiful women ? " [she]101-bébée said suddenly , the color mounting into [her]101-bébée cheeks . "[1401-what women] [What women]1401-what women , [[my]0-i dear]2056-my dear ? " "[1401-what women] Those [I]0-i saw at the window with [you]1392-you , the other night — [they]1400-those beautiful women had jewels . " "[1400-those beautiful women] [Oh!—women]1403-oh!—women , tiresome enough . If [I]0-i had seen [you]1392-you , [I]0-i would have dropped [you]1392-you some fruit . [Poor little Bébée]101-bébée ! Did [you]1392-you go by , and [I]0-i never knew ? " "[1392-you] [You]1392-you were laughing — " "[1392-you] Was [I]0-i ? " "[0-i] Yes , and [they]1400-those beautiful women were beautiful . " "[1400-those beautiful women] In [their]1400-those beautiful women own eyes ; not in [mine]0-i . " "[1400-those beautiful women] No ? " [She]0-i stopped [her]0-i spinning and gazed at [him]1392-you with wistful , wondering eyes . Could it be that they were not beautiful to [him]1392-you ? those deep red , glowing , sun - basked dahlia flowers ? "[1400-those beautiful women] Do [you]1392-you know , " [she]0-i said very softly , with a flush of penitence that came and went , "[1400-those beautiful women] when [I]0-i saw [them]1400-those beautiful women , [I]0-i hated [them]1400-those beautiful women ; [I]0-i confessed it to [Father Francis]105-father francis next day . [You]1392-you seemed so content with , [them]1400-those beautiful women , and [they]1400-those beautiful women looked so gay and glad there — and then the jewels ! Somehow , [I]0-i seemed to [myself]0-i such a little thing , and so ugly and mean . And yet , do [you]1392-you know — " "[1392-you] And yet — well ? " "[1400-those beautiful women] [They]1400-those beautiful women did not look to [me]0-i good — [those women]1205-those women , " said [Bébée]101-bébée , thoughtfully , looking across at [him]1392-you in deprecation of [his]1392-you possible anger . "[1400-those beautiful women] [They]1400-those beautiful women were [great people]1405-great people , [I]0-i suppose , and [they]1400-those beautiful women appeared very happy ; but though [I]0-i seemed nothing to [myself]0-i after [them]1400-those beautiful women , still [I]0-i think [I]0-i would not change . " "[1392-you] [You]1392-you are wise without books , [Bébée]101-bébée . " "[101-bébée] Oh , no , [I]0-i am not wise at all . [I]0-i only feel . And give [me]0-i books ; oh , pray , give [me]0-i books ! [You]1392-you do not know ; [I]0-i will learn so fast ; and [I]0-i will not neglect anything , that [I]0-i promise . [The neighbors]371-the neighbors and [Jeannot]144-jeannot say that [I]0-i shall let the flowers die , and the hut get dirty , and never spin or prick [Annémie]142-annémie 's patterns ; but that is untrue . [I]0-i will do all , just as [I]0-i have done , and more too , if only [you]1392-you will give [me]0-i things to read , for [I]0-i do think when [one]1951-one is happy , [one]1951-one ought to work more — not less . " "[0-i] But will these books make [you]1392-you happy ? If [you]1392-you ask [me]0-i the truth , [I]0-i must tell [you]1392-you — no . [You]1392-you are happy as [you]1392-you are , because [you]1392-you know nothing else than [your]1392-you own little life ; for ignorance is happiness , [Bébée]101-bébée , let [sages]1409-sages , ancient and modern , say what [they]1409-sages will . But when [you]1392-you know a little , [you]1392-you will want to know more : and when [you]1392-you know much , [you]1392-you will want to see much also , and then — and then — the thing will grow — [you]1392-you will be no longer content . That is , [you]1392-you will be unhappy . " [Bébée]101-bébée watched [him]1392-you with wistful eyes . "[1392-you] Perhaps that is true . No doubt it is true , if [you]1392-you say it . But [you]1392-you know all [the world]370-the world seems full of voices that [I]0-i hear , but that [I]0-i can not understand ; it is with [me]0-i as [I]0-i should think it is with [people who go to [foreign countries]1412-foreign countries and do not know the tongue that is spoken when [they]1411-people who go to foreign countries and do not know the tongue that is spoken when they land land]1411-people who go to foreign countries and do not know the tongue that is spoken when they land ; and it makes [me]0-i unhappy , because [I]0-i can not comprehend , and so the books will not make [me]0-i more so , but less . And as for being content — when [I]0-i thought [you]1392-you were gone away out of [the city]225-the city , last night , [I]0-i thought [I]0-i would never be able to pray any more , because [I]0-i hated [myself]0-i , and [I]0-i almost hated [the angels]1960-the angels , and [I]0-i told [Mary]131-mary that [she]131-mary was cruel , and [she]131-mary turned [her]131-mary face from [me]0-i — as it seemed , forever . " [She]131-mary spoke quite quietly and simply , spinning as [she]131-mary spoke , and looking across at [him]1392-you with earnest eyes , that begged [him]1392-you to believe [her]131-mary . [She]131-mary was saying the pure truth , but [she]131-mary did not know the force or the meaning of that truth . [He]1392-you listened with a smile ; it was not new to [him]1392-you ; [he]1392-you knew [her]131-mary heart much better than [she]131-mary knew it [herself]131-mary , but there was an unconsciousness , and yet a strength , in the words that touched [him]1392-you though . [He]1392-you threw the leaves away , irritably , and told [her]131-mary to leave off [her]131-mary spinning . "[131-mary] Some day [I]0-i shall paint [you]1415-you with that wheel as [I]0-i painted [the Broodhuis]126-the broodhuis . Will [you]1415-you let [me]0-i , [Bébée]101-bébée ? " "[1415-you] Yes . " [She]131-mary answered [him]1392-you as [she]131-mary would have answered if [he]1392-you had told [her]131-mary to go on pilgrimage from [one end of [the Low Countries]458-the low countries]2367-one end of the low countries to the other . "[1415-you] What were [you]0-i going to do to - day ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i am going into [the market]272-the market with the flowers ; [I]0-i go every day . " "[0-i] How much will [you]0-i make ? " "[0-i] Two or three francs , if [I]0-i am lucky . " "[0-i] And do [you]0-i never have a holiday ? " "[0-i] Oh , yes ; but not often , [you]0-i know , because it is on the fete days that [the people]504-the people want the most flowers . " "[504-the people] But in the winter ? " "[504-the people] Then [I]0-i work at the lace . " "[0-i] Do [you]0-i never go into [the woods]515-the woods ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i have been once or twice ; but it loses a whole day . " "[0-i] [You]0-i are afraid of not earning ? " "[0-i] Yes . Because [I]0-i am afraid of owing [people]337-people anything . " "[0-i] Well , give up this one day , and [we]1420-we will make holiday . [The people]504-the people are out ; [they]504-the people will not know . Come into [the forest]522-the forest , and [we]1420-we will dine at a café in [the woods]515-the woods ; and [we]1420-we will be as poetic as [you]1424-you like , and [I]0-i will tell [you]1424-you a tale of one called [Rosalind]198-rosalind , who pranked [herself]198-rosalind in [boy]1425-boy 's attire , all for love , in [the Ardennes country yonder]1426-the ardennes country yonder . Come , it is the very day for [the forest]522-the forest ; it will make [me]0-i [a lad]2328-a lad again at [Meudon]66-meudon , when the lilacs were in bloom . Poor [Paris]15-paris ! Come . " "[0-i] Do [you]0-i mean it ? " The color was bright in [her]0-i face , [her]0-i heart was dancing , [her]0-i little feet felt themselves already on the fresh green turf . [She]0-i had no thought that there could be any harm in it . [She]0-i would have gone with [Jeannot]144-jeannot or [old Bac]133-bac . "[0-i] Of course [I]0-i mean it . Come . [I]0-i was going to [Mayence]191-mayence to see [the Magi]1429-the magi and [Van Dyck]199-van dyck 's Christ . [We]1430-we will go to [Soignies]48-soignies instead , and study green leaves . [I]0-i will paint [your]1431-you face by sunlight . It is the best way to paint [you]1431-you . [You]1431-you belong to the open air . So should [Gretchen]161-gretchen ; or how else should [she]161-gretchen have the blue sky in [her]161-gretchen eyes ? " "[161-gretchen] But [I]0-i have only wooden shoes ! " [Her]0-i face was scarlet as [she]0-i glanced at [her]0-i feet ; [he]2369-he who had wanted to give [her]0-i the silk stockings — how would [he]2369-he like to be seen walking abroad with [those two clumsy , clattering , work - a - day , little sabots]2370-those two clumsy , clattering , work - a - day , little sabots ? "[161-gretchen] Never mind . [[My]0-i dear]2056-my dear , in [my]0-i time [I]0-i have had enough of satin shoes and of silver gilt heels ; they click - clack as loud as yours , and cost much more to those who walk with [them]1433-them , not to mention that [they]1433-them will seldom deign to walk at all . [Your]1431-you wooden shoes are picturesque . [Paganini]200-paganini made a violin out of a wooden shoe . Who knows what music may lurk in [yours]1431-you , only [you]1431-you have never heard it . Perhaps [I]0-i have . It was [Bac]133-bac who gave [you]1431-you the red shoes that was [the barbarian]1434-the barbarian , not [I.]0-i Come . " "[0-i] [You]0-i really mean it ? " "[0-i] Come . " "[0-i] But [they]1435-they will miss [me]0-i at market . " "[1435-they] [They]1435-they will think [you]1431-you are gone on the pilgrimage : [you]1431-you need never tell [them]1435-they [you]1431-you have not . " "[1435-they] But if [they]1435-they ask [me]0-i ? " "[1435-they] Does it never happen that [you]0-i say any other thing than the truth ? " "[0-i] Any other thing than the truth ! Of course not . [People]337-people take for granted that [one]1951-one tells truth ; it would be very base to cheat [them]337-people . Do [you]0-i really mean that [I]0-i may come?—in [the forest!—and]1438-the forest!—and [you]0-i will tell [me]0-i stories like those [you]0-i give [me]0-i to read ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i will tell [you]0-i a better story . Lock [[your]0-i hut]1439-your hut , [Bébée]101-bébée , and come . " "[101-bébée] And to think [you]0-i are not ashamed ! " "[0-i] Ashamed ? " "[0-i] Yes , because of [my]0-i wooden shoes . " Was it possible ? [Bébée]101-bébée thought , as [she]101-bébée ran out into [the garden]1940-the garden and locked the door behind [her]101-bébée , and pushed the key under the waterbutt as usual , being quite content with that prudent precaution against robbers which had served [Antoine]103-antoine all [his]103-antoine days . Was it possible , this wonderful joy?—her cheeks were like [her]101-bébée roses , [her]101-bébée eyes had a brilliance like the sun ; the natural grace and mirth of [the child]377-the child blossomed in a thousand ways and gestures . As [she]101-bébée went by the shrine in the wall , [she]101-bébée bent [her]101-bébée knee a moment and made the sign of the cross ; then [she]101-bébée gathered a little moss - rose that nodded close under the border of the palisade , and turned and gave it to [him]103-antoine . "[0-i] Look , [she]1440-she sends [you]0-i this . [She]1440-she is not angry , [you]0-i see , and it is much more pleasure when [she]1440-she is pleased — do [you]0-i not know ? " [He]103-antoine shrank a little as [her]101-bébée fingers touched [him]103-antoine . "[1440-she] What a pity [you]0-i had [no mother]1441-no mother , [Bébée]101-bébée ! " [he]103-antoine said , on an impulse of emotion , of which in [Paris]15-paris [he]103-antoine would have been more ashamed than of any guilt . In the deserted lane by [the swans ' water]2373-the swans ' water , under the willows , the horses waited to take [him]103-antoine to [Mechlin]8-mechlin ; [little , quick , rough horses , with round brass bells , in the Flemish fashion , and gay harness]2374-little , quick , rough horses , with round brass bells , in the flemish fashion , and gay harness , and a low char - à - banc , in which a wolf - skin and red rugs , and all [a painter]2033-a painter 's many necessities , were tossed together . [He]103-antoine lifted [her]101-bébée in , and the little horses flew fast through [the green country]2376-the green country , ringing chimes at each step , till [they]2374-little , quick , rough horses , with round brass bells , in the flemish fashion , and gay harness plunged into the deep glades of [the woods of [Cambre]67-cambre and [Soignies]48-soignies]2377-the woods of cambre and soignies . [Bébée]101-bébée sat breathless with delight . [She]101-bébée had never gone behind horses in all [her]101-bébée life , except once or twice in [a wagon]2378-a wagon when [the tired teamsters]2379-the tired teamsters had dragged a load of corn across [the plains]410-the plains , or when [the miller]442-the miller 's old gray mare had hobbled wearily before [a cart - load of [noisy , happy , mischievous children]2383-noisy , happy , mischievous children going [home]289-home from the masses and fairs , and flags , and flowers , and church banners , and puppet - shows , and lighted altars , and whirling merry - go - rounds of the [Fête Dieu]68-fête dieu]2382-a cart - load of noisy , happy , mischievous children going home from the masses and fairs , and flags , and flowers , and church banners , and puppet - shows , and lighted altars , and whirling merry - go - rounds of the fête dieu . [She]101-bébée had never known what it was to sail as on the wings of the wind along [broad roads]2385-broad roads , with [yellow wheat - lands]2386-yellow wheat - lands , and green hedges , and wayside trees , and [little villages]2387-little villages , and [reedy canal water]2388-reedy canal water , all flying by [her]101-bébée to the sing - song of the joyous bells . "[101-bébée] Oh , how good it is to live ! " [she]101-bébée cried , clapping [her]101-bébée hands in a very ecstasy , as the clear morning broadened into gold and the west wind rose and blew from the sands by [the sea]896-the sea . "[101-bébée] Yes — it is good — if [one]1951-one did not tire so soon , " said [he]442-the miller , watching [her]101-bébée with a listless pleasure . But [she]101-bébée did not hear ; [she]101-bébée was beyond the reach of any power to sadden [her]101-bébée ; [she]101-bébée was watching the white oxen that stood on [the purple brow of [the just reapen lands]2391-the just reapen lands]2390-the purple brow of the just reapen lands , and the rosy clouds that blew like a shower of apple - blossoms across the sky to the south . There was [a sad darkling Calvary on the edge of [the harvest - field]2393-the harvest - field]2392-a sad darkling calvary on the edge of the harvest - field that looked black against the blue sky ; its shadow fell across [the road]1011-the road , but [she]101-bébée did not see it : [she]101-bébée was looking at the sun . There is not much change in [the great Soignies woods]2395-the great soignies woods . [They]2395-the great soignies woods are aisles on aisles of beautiful green trees , crossing and recrossing ; tunnels of dark foliage that look endless ; long avenues of beech , of oak , of elm , or of fir , with the bracken and the brushwood growing dense between ; a delicious forest growth everywhere , shady even at noon , and by a little past midday dusky as evening ; with the forest fragrance , sweet and dewy , all about , and under the fern the stirring of wild game , and the white gleam of little rabbits , and the sound of the wings of birds . [Soignies]48-soignies is not legend - haunted like [the Black Forest]69-the black forest , nor king - haunted like [Fontainebleau]70-fontainebleau , nor [sovereign of two historic streams like [the brave woods of [Heidelberg]71-heidelberg]2397-the brave woods of heidelberg]2396-sovereign of two historic streams like the brave woods of heidelberg ; nor wild and romantic , arid broken with black rocks , and poetized by the shade of [Jaques]72-jaques , and swept through by [a perfect river]2398-a perfect river , like [[its]2398-a perfect river neighbors of [Ardennes]50-the green ardennes]2399-its neighbors of ardennes ; nor throned aloft on mighty mountains like the majestic oak glades of [the Swabian hills of [the ivory carvers]2401-the ivory carvers]2400-the swabian hills of the ivory carvers . [Soignies]48-soignies is only [a Flemish forest in a plain]2402-a flemish forest in a plain , throwing [its]48-soignies shadows over [corn - fields]2403-corn - fields and [cattle pastures]2404-cattle pastures , with no panorama beyond [it]48-soignies and no wonders in [its]48-soignies depth . But [it]48-soignies is [a fresh , bold , beautiful forest]2405-a fresh , bold , beautiful forest for all that . It has only green leaves to give,—green leaves always , league after league ; but there is about it that vague mystery which [all forests]2406-all forests have , and this universe of leaves seems boundless , and [Pan]201-pan might dwell in it , and [St. Hubert]129-st. hubert , and [John Keats]202-john keats . [Bébée]101-bébée , in [her]101-bébée rare holidays with [the Bac children]2407-the bac children or with [[Jeannot]144-jeannot 's sisters]2408-jeannot 's sisters , had never penetrated farther than [the glades of [the Cambre]67-cambre]2409-the glades of the cambre , and had never entered the heart of [the true forest]2410-the true forest , which is much still what it must have been in the old days when [the burghers of [Brabant]3-brabant]2411-the burghers of brabant cut [their]2411-the burghers of brabant yew bows and [their]2411-the burghers of brabant pike staves from it to use against [the hosts of [Spain]75-spain]2412-the hosts of spain . To Bébée [it]48-soignies was as [an enchanted land]2413-an enchanted land , and every play of light and shade , every hare speeding across [the paths]2414-the paths , every thrush singing in the leaves , every little dog - rose or harebell that blossomed in the thickets , was to [her]101-bébée a treasure , a picture , a poem , a delight . [He]144-jeannot had seen [girls]421-girls thus in [the woods of [Vincennes]76-vincennes]2416-the woods of vincennes and of [Versailles]77-versailles in the student days of [his]144-jeannot youth : [little work - girls fresh from châlets of [the Jura]78-the jura]2417-little work - girls fresh from châlets of the jura or from [vine - hung huts of [the Loire]79-the loire]2418-vine - hung huts of the loire , who had brought [their]2417-little work - girls fresh from châlets of the jura poor little charms to perish in [Paris]15-paris ; and who dwelt under the hot tiles and amidst the gilded shop signs till [they]2417-little work - girls fresh from châlets of the jura were as pale and thin as [their]2417-little work - girls fresh from châlets of the jura own starved balsams ; and who , when [they]2417-little work - girls fresh from châlets of the jura saw [the green woods]2419-the green woods , laughed and cried a little , and thought of the broad sun - swept fields , and wished that [they]2417-little work - girls fresh from châlets of the jura were back again behind [their]2417-little work - girls fresh from châlets of the jura drove of cows , or weeding among the green grapes . But [those little work - girls]2420-those little work - girls had been mere homely daisies , and daisies already with the dust of [the pavement]2421-the pavement and of the dancing - gardens upon [them]2417-little work - girls fresh from châlets of the jura . [Bébée]101-bébée was as pure and fresh as these dew - wet dog - roses that [she]101-bébée found in [the thickets of thorn]2422-the thickets of thorn . [He]144-jeannot had meant to treat [her]101-bébée as [he]144-jeannot had used to do [those work - girls]2423-those work - girls — a little wine , a little wooing , a little folly and passion , idle as a butterfly and brief as a rainbow — one midsummer day and night — then a handful of gold , a caress , a good - morrow , and forgetfulness ever afterwards — that was what [he]144-jeannot had meant when [he]144-jeannot had brought [her]101-bébée out to [the forest of [Soignies]48-soignies]2424-the forest of soignies . But — [she]101-bébée was different , [this child]2266-this child .
