[He]144-jeannot made the great sketch of [her]101-bébée for [his]144-jeannot Gretchen , sitting on a moss - grown trunk , with marguerites in [her]101-bébée hand ; [he]144-jeannot sent for [their]2426-their breakfast far into [the woods]515-the woods , and saw [her]101-bébée set [her]101-bébée pearly teeth into early peaches and costly sweetmeats ; [he]144-jeannot wandered with [her]101-bébée hither and thither , and told [her]101-bébée tales out of the poets and talked to [her]101-bébée in the dreamy , cynical , poetical manner that was characteristic of [him]144-jeannot , being half artificial and half sorrowful , as [his]144-jeannot temper was . But [Bébée]101-bébée , all unconscious , intoxicated with happiness , and yet touched by it into that vague sadness which the summer sun brings with it even to young things , if [they]2428-they have soul in them,—Bébée said to [him]144-jeannot what [the work - girls of [Paris]15-paris]2429-the work - girls of paris never had done . Beautiful things : things fantastic , ignorant , absurd , very simple , very unreasonable oftentimes , but things beautiful always , and sometimes even very wise by a wisdom not of [the world]370-the world ; by a certain light divine that does shine now and then as through an alabaster lamp , through minds that have no grossness to obscure [them]2426-their . [Her]101-bébée words were not equal to the burden of [her]101-bébée thoughts at times , but [he]144-jeannot knew how to take the pearl of the thought from the broken shell and tangled sea - weed of [her]101-bébée simple , untutored speech . "[101-bébée] If there be [a God]1443-a god anywhere , " [he]144-jeannot thought to [himself]144-jeannot , "[101-bébée] [this little Fleming]1444-this little fleming is very near [him]1443-a god . " [She]101-bébée was so near that , although [he]144-jeannot had no belief in [any God]2431-any god , [he]144-jeannot could not deal with [her]101-bébée as [he]144-jeannot had used to do with [the work - girls in [the primrose paths of old [Vincennes]76-vincennes]2433-the primrose paths of old vincennes]2432-the work - girls in the primrose paths of old vincennes . "[1444-this little fleming] To be [Gretchen]161-gretchen , [you]161-gretchen must count the leaves of [your]161-gretchen daisies , " [he]144-jeannot said to [her]161-gretchen , as [he]144-jeannot painted,—painted [her]161-gretchen just as [she]161-gretchen was , with [her]161-gretchen two little white feet in the wooden shoes , and the thick green leaves behind ; the simplest picture possible , the dress of gray — only cool dark gray — with white linen bodice , and no color anywhere except in the green of the foliage ; but where [he]144-jeannot meant the wonder and the charm of it to lie was in [the upraised , serious , child - like face]2434-the upraised , serious , child - like face , and the gaze of the grave , smiling eyes . It was [Gretchen]161-gretchen , spinning , out in the open air among the flowers . [Gretchen]161-gretchen , with the tall dog - daisies growing up about [her]161-gretchen feet , among the thyme and the roses , before [she]161-gretchen had had need to gather , one to ask [her]161-gretchen future of its parted leaves . [The Gretchen of [Scheffer]160-scheffer]2435-the gretchen of scheffer tells no tale ; [she]2435-the gretchen of scheffer is [a fair - haired , hard - working , simple - minded peasant , with whom [neither angels nor devils]2437-neither angels nor devils have anything to do , and whose eyes never can open to either hell or heaven]2436-a fair - haired , hard - working , simple - minded peasant , with whom neither angels nor devils have anything to do , and whose eyes never can open to either hell or heaven . But [the Gretchen of [Flamen]176-flamen]2438-the gretchen of flamen said much more than this : looking at it , [men]707-men would sigh from shame , and [women]785-women weep from sorrow . "[161-gretchen] Count the daisies ? " echoed [Bébée]101-bébée . "[161-gretchen] Oh , [I]0-i know what [you]0-i mean . A little — much — passionately — until death — not at all . What [the girls]1445-the girls say when [they]1445-the girls want to see if [any one]690-any one loves [them]1445-the girls ? Is that it ? " [She]2438-the gretchen of flamen looked at [him]2441-him without any consciousness , except as [she]2438-the gretchen of flamen loved the flowers . "[1445-the girls] Do [you]0-i think the daisies know ? " [she]2438-the gretchen of flamen went on , seriously , parting their petals with [her]2438-the gretchen of flamen fingers . "[0-i] [Flowers]141-flowers do know many things — that is certain . " "[141-flowers] Ask [them]141-flowers for [yourself]0-i . " "[141-flowers] Ask [them]141-flowers what ? " "[141-flowers] How much — [any one]690-any one — loves [you]0-i ? " "[141-flowers] Oh , but [every one]2111-every one loves [me]0-i ; there is [no one that is bad]1449-no one that is bad . [Antoine]103-antoine used to say to [me]0-i . ' Never think of [yourself]0-i , [Bébée]101-bébée ; always think of [other people]1450-other people , so [every one]2111-every one will love [you]0-i . ' And [I]0-i always try to do that , and [every one]2111-every one does . " "[0-i] But that is not the love the daisy tells of to [your]0-i sex . " "[1453-the girls that you see] No ? " "[1453-the girls that you see] No ; [the girls that [you]0-i see]1453-the girls that you see count the flowers — [they]1453-the girls that you see are thinking , not of all [the village]1454-the village , but of [some one unlike all the rest , whose shadow falls across [theirs]1453-the girls that you see in the moonlight]1455-some one unlike all the rest , whose shadow falls across theirs in the moonlight ! [You]0-i know that ? " "[0-i] Ah , yes — and [they]1453-the girls that you see marry afterwards — yes . " [She]0-i said it softly , musingly , with no embarrassment ; it was an unreal , remote thing to [her]0-i , and yet it stirred [her]0-i heart a little with a vague trouble that was infinitely sweet . There is little talk of love in the lives of [the poor]2442-the poor ; [they]2442-the poor have no space for it ; love to [them]2442-the poor means more mouths to feed , more wooden shoes to buy , more hands to dive into the meagre bag of coppers . Now and then [a girl of [the commune]2444-the commune]2443-a girl of the commune had been married , and had ploughing in [the fields]306-the fields or to [her]2443-a girl of the commune lace - weaving in [the city]225-the city . [Bébée]101-bébée had thought little of it . "[1453-the girls that you see] [They]1453-the girls that you see marry or [they]1453-the girls that you see do not marry . That is as it may be , " said [Flamen]176-flamen , with a smile . "[101-bébée] [Bébée]101-bébée , [I]0-i must paint [you]101-bébée as [Gretchen]161-gretchen before [she]161-gretchen made a love - dial of [the daisies]1456-the daisies . What is the story ? Oh , [I]0-i have told [you]101-bébée stories enough . [Gretchen]161-gretchen 's [you]101-bébée would not understand , just yet . " "[161-gretchen] But what did [the daisies]1456-the daisies say to [her]161-gretchen ? " "[1456-the daisies] [[My]0-i dear]2056-my dear , [the daisies]1456-the daisies always say the same thing , because [daisies]1460-daisies always tell the truth and know [men]707-men . [The daisies]1456-the daisies always say ' a little ' ; it is [the girl]1269-the girl 's ear that tricks [her]1269-the girl , and makes [her]1269-the girl hear ' till death,'—a folly and falsehood of which the daisy is not guilty . " "[1456-the daisies] But who says it if the daisy does not ? " "[1464-the devil] Ah , [the devil]1464-the devil perhaps — who knows ? [He]1464-the devil has so much to do in these things . " But [Bébée]101-bébée did not smile ; [she]101-bébée had a look of horror in [her]101-bébée blue eyes ; [she]101-bébée belonged to [a peasantry who believed in exorcising [the fiend]2448-the fiend by the aid of the cross , and who not so very many generations before had driven [him]1464-the devil out of human bodies by rack and flame]2447-a peasantry who believed in exorcising the fiend by the aid of the cross , and who not so very many generations before had driven him out of human bodies by rack and flame . [She]101-bébée looked with a little wistful fear on the white , golden - eyed marguerites that lay on [her]101-bébée lap . "[1464-the devil] Do [you]0-i think [the fiend]2448-the fiend is in these ? " [she]101-bébée whispered , with awe in [her]101-bébée voice . [Flamen]176-flamen smiled . "[0-i] When [you]1269-the girl count [them]1466-them [he]2448-the fiend will be there , no doubt . " [Bébée]101-bébée threw them with a shudder on the grass . "[2448-the fiend] Have [I]0-i spoilt [your]1269-the girl holiday , [dear]2076-dear ? " [he]176-flamen said , with a certain self - reproach . [She]1269-the girl was silent a minute , then [she]1269-the girl gathered up the daisies again , and stroked them and put them to [her]1269-the girl lips . "[0-i] It is not [they]1466-them that do wrong . [You]0-i say [the girls]1445-the girls ' ears deceive [them]1445-the girls . It is [the girls who want a lie]1469-the girls who want a lie and will not believe a truth because it humbles [them]1445-the girls ; it is [the girls that are to blame]1470-the girls that are to blame , not the daisies . As for [me]0-i , [I]0-i will not ask [the daisies]1456-the daisies anything ever , so [the fiend]2448-the fiend will not enter into [them]1456-the daisies . " "[2448-the fiend] Nor into [you]1269-the girl . [Poor little Bébée]101-bébée ! " "[101-bébée] Why , [you]1269-the girl pity [me]0-i for that ? " "[1269-the girl] Yes . Because , if [women]785-women never see the serpent 's face , neither do [they]785-women ever scent the smell of the paradise roses ; and it will be hard for [you]1269-the girl to die without a single rose d'amour in [your]1269-the girl pretty breast , [poor little Bébée]1474-poor little bébée ? " "[1474-poor little bébée] [I]0-i do not understand . But [you]1269-the girl frighten [me]0-i a little . " [He]2448-the fiend rose and left [his]2448-the fiend easel and threw [himself]2448-the fiend at [her]101-bébée feet on the grass ; [he]2448-the fiend took the little wooden shoes in [his]2448-the fiend hands as reverently as [he]2448-the fiend would have taken the broidered shoes of [a duchess]2449-a duchess ; [he]2448-the fiend looked up at [her]101-bébée with tender , smiling eyes . "[1269-the girl] [Poor little Bébée]101-bébée ! " [he]2448-the fiend said again . "[101-bébée] Did [I]0-i frighten [you]101-bébée indeed ? Nay , that was very base of [me]0-i . [We]1475-we will not spoil [our]1475-we summer holiday . There is no such thing as [a fiend]1476-a fiend , [[my]0-i dear]2056-my dear . There are only [men]707-men — such as [I]0-i am . Say the daisy spell over for [me]0-i , [Bébée]101-bébée . See if [I]0-i do not love [you]101-bébée a little , just as [you]101-bébée love [your]101-bébée flowers . " [She]101-bébée smiled , and the happy laughter came again over [her]101-bébée face . "[101-bébée] Oh , [I]0-i am sure [you]0-i care for [me]0-i a little , " [she]101-bébée said , softly , "[0-i] or [you]0-i would not be so good and get [me]0-i books and give [me]0-i pleasure ; and [I]0-i do not want the daisies to tell [me]0-i that , because [you]0-i say it [yourself]0-i , which is better . " "[0-i] Much better . " [he]2450-he answered [her]101-bébée dreamily , and lay there in the grass , holding the little wooden shoes in [his]2450-he hands . [He]2450-he was not in love with [her]101-bébée . [He]2450-he was in no haste . [He]2450-he preferred to play with [her]101-bébée softly , slowly , as one separates the leaves of a rose , to see the deep rose of its heart . [Her]101-bébée own ignorance of what [she]101-bébée felt had a charm for [him]2450-he . [He]2450-he liked to lift the veil from [her]101-bébée eyes by gentle degrees , watching each new pulse - beat , each fresh instinct tremble into life . It was an old , old story to [him]2450-he ; [he]2450-he knew each chapter and verse to weariness , though there still was no other story that [he]2450-he still read as often . But to [her]101-bébée it was so new . To [him]2450-he it was a long beaten track ; [he]2450-he knew every turn of it ; [he]2450-he recognized every wayside blossom ; [he]2450-he had passed over a thousand times each tremulous bridge ; [he]2450-he knew so well beforehand where each shadow would fall , and where each fresh bud would blossom , and where each harvest would be reaped . But to [her]101-bébée it was so new . [She]101-bébée followed [him]2450-he as [a blind child a man that guides [her]101-bébée through [a garden]2452-a garden and reads [her]101-bébée a wonder tale . [He]2450-he was good to [her]101-bébée , that was all [she]101-bébée knew]2451-a blind child a man that guides her through a garden and reads her a wonder tale . he was good to her , that was all she knew . When [he]2450-he touched [her]101-bébée ever so lightly [she]101-bébée felt a happiness so perfect , and yet so unintelligible , that [she]101-bébée could have wished to die in it . And in [her]101-bébée humility and [her]101-bébée ignorance [she]101-bébée wondered always how [he]2450-he — so great , so wise , so beautiful — could have thought it ever worth [his]2450-he while to leave [the paradise of [Rubes]150-rubes ' land]2453-the paradise of rubes ' land to wait with [her]101-bébée under [her]101-bébée little rush - thatched roof , and bring [her]101-bébée here to see the green leaves and the living things of [the forest]522-the forest . As [they]2455-they went , [a man]710-a man was going under the trees with a load of wood upon [his]710-a man back . [Bébée]101-bébée gave a little cry of recognition . "[0-i] Oh , look , that is [Jeannot]144-jeannot ! How [he]1479-he will wonder to see [me]0-i here ! " [Flamen]176-flamen drew [her]101-bébée a little downward , so that [the forester]1047-the forester passed onward without perceiving [them]1480-your neighbors . "[1479-he] Why do [you]0-i do that ? " said [Bébée]101-bébée . "[1479-he] Shall [I]0-i not speak to [him]1479-he ? " "[0-i] Why ? To have all [[your]0-i neighbors]1480-your neighbors chatter of [your]0-i feast in [the forest]522-the forest ? It is not worth while . " "[1479-he] Ah , but [I]0-i always tell [them]1480-your neighbors everything , " said [Bébée]101-bébée . whose imagination had been already busy with the wonders that [she]0-i would unfold to [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs and [the Varnhart children]2025-the varnhart children . "[0-i] Then [you]0-i will see but little of [me]0-i , [[my]0-i dear]2056-my dear . Learn to be silent , [Bébée]101-bébée . It is [a woman]217-a woman 's first duty , though [her]217-a woman hardest . " "[217-a woman] Is it ? " [She]0-i did not speak for some time . [She]0-i could not imagine a state of things in which [she]0-i would not narrate the little daily miracles of [her]0-i life to [the good old garrulous women]2459-the good old garrulous women and [the little open - mouthed romps]2460-the little open - mouthed romps . And yet — [she]0-i lifted [her]0-i eyes to [his]2461-his . "[217-a woman] [I]0-i am glad [you]0-i have told [me]0-i that , " [she]0-i said . "[0-i] Though indeed . [I]0-i do not see why one should not say what [one]1951-one does , yet — somehow — [I]0-i do not like to talk about [you]0-i . It is like the pictures in [the galleries]517-the galleries , and the music in [the cathedral]509-the cathedral , and the great still evenings , when [the fields]306-the fields are all silent , and it is as if [Christ]110-christ walked abroad in them ; [I]0-i do not know how to talk of those things to [the others]1488-the others — only to [you]0-i — and [I]0-i do not like to talk about [you]0-i to [them]1488-the others — do [you]0-i not know ? " "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i know . But what [affinity]1489-affinity have [I.]0-i Bébée , to [your]0-i thoughts of [[your]0-i God]1490-your god walking in [[His]110-christ cornfields]1491-his cornfields ? " [Bébée]101-bébée 's eyes glanced down through [the green aisle of [the forests]2463-the forests]2462-the green aisle of the forests , with the musing seriousness in them that was like the child - angels of [Botticelli]203-botticelli 's dreams . "[0-i] [I]0-i can not tell [you]0-i very well . But when [I]0-i am in [the fields]306-the fields at evening and think of [Christ]110-christ . [I]0-i feel so happy , and of such good will to all the rest , and [I]0-i seem to see heaven quite plain through the beautiful gray air where the stars are — and so [I]0-i feel when [I]0-i am with [you]0-i — that is all . Only — " "[0-i] Only what ? " "[0-i] Only in those evenings , when [I]0-i was all alone , heaven seemed up there , where the stars are , and [I]0-i longed for wings ; but now , it is here , and [I]0-i would only shut [my]0-i wings if [I]0-i had them , and not stir . " [He]110-christ looked at [her]0-i , and took , [her]0-i hands and kissed them — but reverently — as [a believer]2464-a believer may kiss a shrine . In that moment to [Flamen]176-flamen [she]0-i was sacred ; in that moment [he]110-christ could no more have hurt [her]0-i with passion than [he]110-christ could have hurt [her]0-i with a blow . It was an emotion with [him]110-christ , and did not endure . But whilst it lasted , it was true . Then [he]110-christ took [her]0-i to dine at one of the wooden cafés under the trees . There was a little sheet of water in front of it and [a gay garden]2465-a gay garden around . There was [a balcony]2466-a balcony and [a wooden stairway]2467-a wooden stairway ; there were long trellised arbors , and little white tables , and great rosebushes like [her]0-i own at [home]289-home . [They]2025-the varnhart children had an arbor all to [themselves]2025-the varnhart children ; a cool sweet - smelling bower of green , with a glimpse of scarlet from the flowers of some twisting beans . [They]2025-the varnhart children had a meal , the like of which [she]0-i had never seen ; such a huge melon in the centre of it , and curious wines , and coffee or cream in silver pots , or what looked like silver to [her—"just]2469-her—"just[2025-the varnhart children] like the altar - vases in [the church]246-the church , " [she]0-i said to [herself]0-i . "[2025-the varnhart children] If only [the Varnhart children]2025-the varnhart children were [here]1953-here ! " [she]0-i cried ; but [he]110-christ did not echo the wish . It was just sunset . There was a golden glow on [the little bit of water]2470-the little bit of water . On the other side of [the garden]1940-the garden [some one]1967-some one was playing a guitar . Under a lime - tree [some girls]2473-some girls were swinging , crying , Higher ! higher ! at each toss . In [a longer avenue of trellised green]2474-a longer avenue of trellised green , at a long table , there was [a noisy party of [students]523-students and girls of [the city]225-the city]2475-a noisy party of students and girls of the city ; [their]2025-the varnhart children laughter was mellowed by distance as it came over the breadth of [the garden]1940-the garden , and [they]2025-the varnhart children sang , with fresh shrill Flemish voices , songs from an opera bouffe of La Monnaie . It was all pretty , and gay , and pleasant . There was everywhere about an air of light - hearted enjoyment . [Bébée]101-bébée sat with a wondering look in [her]101-bébée wide - opened eyes , and all the natural instincts of [her]101-bébée youth , that were like curled - up fruit buds in [her]101-bébée , unclosed softly to the light of joy . "[2025-the varnhart children] Is life always like this in [[your]1496-him Rubes ' land]1497-your rubes ' land ? " [she]101-bébée asked [him]1496-him ; [that vague far - away country of which [she]101-bébée never asked [him]1496-him anything more definite , and which yet was so clear before [her]101-bébée fancy]2479-that vague far - away country of which she never asked him anything more definite , and which yet was so clear before her fancy . "[2025-the varnhart children] Yes , " [he]1496-him made answer to [her]101-bébée . "[2025-the varnhart children] Only — instead of those leaves , flowers and pomegranates ; and in lieu of that tinkling guitar , a voice whose notes are esteemed like [king]1498-king 's jewels ; and in place of those little green arbors , [great white palaces]1499-great white palaces , cool and still , with ilex woods and orange groves and [sapphire seas beyond [them]1499-great white palaces]1500-sapphire seas beyond them . Would [you]1501-you like to come [there]2000-there , [Bébée?—and]204-bébée?—and wear laces such as [you]1501-you weave , and hear singing and laughter all night long , and never work any more in the mould of [the garden]1940-the garden , or spin any more at that tiresome wheel , or go any more out in the wind , and the rain , and the winter mud to [the market]272-the market ? " [Bébée]101-bébée listened , leaning [her]101-bébée round elbows on the table , and [her]101-bébée warm cheeks on [her]101-bébée hands , as [a child]334-a child gravely listens to a fairy story . But the sumptuous picture , and the sensuous phrase [he]204-bébée?—and had chosen , passed by [her]101-bébée . It is of no use to tempt the little chaffinch of [the woods]515-the woods with a ruby instead of a cherry . The bird is made to feed on the brown berries , on the morning dews , on the scarlet hips of roses , and the blossoms of the wind - tossed pear boughs ; the gem , though it be [a monarch]2482-a monarch 's , will only strike hard and tasteless on its beak . "[0-i] [I]0-i would like to see it all , " said [Bébée]101-bébée , musingly trying to follow out [her]101-bébée thoughts . "[0-i] But as for the garden work and the spinning — that [I]0-i do not want to leave , because [I]0-i have done it all [my]0-i life ; and [I]0-i do not think [I]0-i should care to wear lace — it would tear very soon ; [one]1951-one would be afraid to run ; and do [you]1506-you see [I]0-i know how it is made — all that lace . [I]0-i know how blind the eyes get over it , and how the hearts ache ; [I]0-i know how [the old women]873-the old women starve , and [the little children]518-the little children cry ; [I]0-i know that there is not a sprig of it that is not stitched with pain ; [the great ladies]1509-the great ladies do not think , [I]0-i dare say , because [they]1509-the great ladies have never worked at it or watched [the others]1488-the others : but [I]0-i have . And so , [you]1506-you see , [I]0-i think if [I]0-i wore it [I]0-i should feel sad , and if a nail caught on it [I]0-i should feel as if it were tearing the flesh of [[my]0-i friends]1511-my friends . Perhaps [I]0-i say it badly ; but that is what [I]0-i feel . " "[1506-you] [You]1506-you do not say it badly — [you]1506-you speak well , for [you]1506-you speak from the heart , " [he]1506-you answered [her]1506-you , and felt a tinge of shame that [he]1506-you had tempted [her]1506-you with the gold and purple of a baser world than any that [she]1506-you knew . "[1506-you] And yet [you]1506-you want to see [new lands]1512-new lands ? " [he]1506-you pursued . "[1506-you] What is it [you]1506-you want to see there ? " "[1506-you] Ah , quite other things than these , " cried [Bébée]101-bébée , still leaning [her]101-bébée cheeks on [her]101-bébée hands . "[1506-you] That dancing and singing is very pretty and merry , but it is just as good when [old Claude]205-old claude fiddles and [the children]373-the children skip . This wine , [you]1506-you tell [me]0-i , is something very great ; but fresh milk is much nicer , [I]0-i think . It is not these kind of things [I]0-i want — [I]0-i want to know all about [the people who lived before [us]1515-us]1514-the people who lived before us ; [I]0-i want to know what the stars are , and what the wind is ; [I]0-i want to know where the lark goes when [you]1506-you lose [him]1516-him out of sight against the sun ; [I]0-i want to know how [the old artists]1517-the old artists got to see [God]108-god , that [they]1517-the old artists could paint [him]1516-him and [all [his]1516-him angels]1518-all his angels as [they]1517-the old artists have done ; [I]0-i want to know how the voices got into the bells , and how [they]1519-they can make [one]1951-one 's heart beat , hanging up there as [they]1519-they do , all alone among the jackdaws ; [I]0-i want to know what it is when [I]0-i walk in [the fields]306-the fields in the morning , and it is all gray and soft and still , and the corn - crake cries in the wheat , and the little mice run [home]289-home to [[their]1523-their holes]1524-their holes , that makes [me]0-i so glad and yet so sorrowful , as if [I]0-i were so very near [God]108-god , and yet so all alone , and such a little thing ; because [you]1525-you see the mouse [she]1526-her has [[her]1526-her hole]1527-her hole , and the crake [[her]1526-her own people]1528-her own people , but [I]0-i — " [Her]1526-her voice faltered a little and stopped : [she]1526-her had never before thought out into words [her]1526-her own loneliness ; from the long green arbor the voices of [the girls]1445-the girls and [the students]2165-the students sang , — "[0-i] Ah ! le doux son d'un baiser tendre ! " [Flamen]176-flamen was silent . [The poet in [him]176-flamen]2485-the poet in him — and in [an artist]1349-an artist there is always more or less of [the poet]2487-the poet — kept [him]176-flamen back from ridicule , nay , moved [him]176-flamen to pity and respect . They were absurdly simple words no doubt , had little wisdom in them , and were quite childish in [their]2488-their utterance , and yet they moved [him]176-flamen curiously as [a man very base and callous]2489-a man very base and callous may at times be moved by the look in a dying deer 's eyes , or by the sound of a song that [some lost love]2490-some lost love once sang . [He]176-flamen rose and drew [her]1526-her hands away , and took [her]1526-her small face between [his]176-flamen own hands instead . "[0-i] [Poor little Bébée]101-bébée ! " [he]176-flamen said gently , looking down on [her]1526-her with a breath that was almost a sigh . "[101-bébée] [Poor little Bébée!—to]1529-poor little bébée!—to envy the corncrake and the mouse ! " [She]1526-her was a little startled ; [her]1526-her cheeks grew very warm under [his]176-flamen touch , but [her]1526-her eyes looked still into [his]176-flamen without fear . [He]176-flamen stooped and touched [her]1526-her forehead with [his]176-flamen lips , gently and without passion , almost reverently ; [she]1526-her grew rose - hued as the bright bean - flowers , up to the light gold ripples of [her]1526-her hair ; [she]1526-her trembled a little and drew back , but [she]1526-her was not alarmed nor yet ashamed ; [she]1526-her was too simple of heart to feel the fear that is born of passion and of consciousness . It was as [Jeannot]144-jeannot kissed [[his]176-flamen sister]2491-his sister [Marie]206-marie , who was fifteen years old and sold milk for [the Krebs people in [the villages]1252-the villages]2492-the krebs people in the villages with [a little green cart]2494-a little green cart and a yellow dog — no more . And yet the sunny arbor leaves and the glimpse of the blue sky swam round [her]1526-her indistinctly , and the sounds of the guitar grew dull upon [her]1526-her ear and were lost as in a rushing hiss of water , because of the great sudden unintelligible happiness that seemed to bear [her]1526-her little life away on it as a sea wave bears [a young child]2495-a young child off its feet . "[1530-you] [You]1530-you do not feel alone now , [Bébée]101-bébée ? " [he]176-flamen whispered to [her]101-bébée . "[101-bébée] No ! " [she]1526-her answered [him]176-flamen softly under [her]1526-her breath , and sat still , while all [her]1526-her body quivered like a leaf . No ; how could [she]1526-her ever be alone now that this sweet , soft , unutterable touch would always be in memory upon [her]1526-her ; how could [she]1526-her wish ever again now to be the corn - crake in the summer corn or the gray mouse in [the hedge of hawthorn]2496-the hedge of hawthorn ? At that moment [a student]2341-a student went by past the entrance of [the arbor]2498-the arbor ; [he]2341-a student had a sash round [his]2341-a student loins and a paper feather in [his]2341-a student cap ; [he]2341-a student was playing a fife and dancing ; [he]2341-a student glanced in as [he]2341-a student went . "[101-bébée] It is time to go [home]289-home , [Bébée]101-bébée , " said [Flamen]176-flamen . So it came to pass that [Bébée]101-bébée 's day in [the big forest]2499-the big forest came and went as simply almost as any day that [she]1526-her had played away with [the Varnhart children]2025-the varnhart children under the beech shadows of [Cambre woods]2501-cambre woods . And when [he]176-flamen took [her]1526-her to [[her]1526-her hut]491-her hut at sunset before [the pilgrims]2503-the pilgrims had returned there was a great bewildered tumult of happiness in [her]1526-her heart , but there was no memory with [her]1526-her that prevented [her]1526-her from looking at the shrine in the wall as [she]1526-her passed it , and saying with a quick gesture of the cross on brow and bosom , — "[101-bébée] Ah , [dear Holy Mother]2287-dear holy mother , how good [you]2287-dear holy mother have been ! and [I]0-i am back again , [you]2287-dear holy mother see , and [I]0-i will work harder than ever because of all this joy that [you]2287-dear holy mother have given [me]0-i . " And [she]1526-her took another moss - rose and changed it for that of the morning , which was faded , and said to [Flamen]176-flamen . — "[1533-she] Look — [she]1533-she sends [you]2287-dear holy mother this . Now do [you]2287-dear holy mother know what [I]0-i mean ? [One]1951-one is more content when [She]1951-one is content . " [He]176-flamen did not answer , but [he]176-flamen held [her]1526-her hands against [him]176-flamen a moment as they fastened in the rose bud . "[101-bébée] Not a word to [the pilgrims]2503-the pilgrims , [Bébée]101-bébée — [you]2287-dear holy mother remember ? " "[101-bébée] Yes , [I]0-i will remember . [I]0-i do not tell [them]2503-the pilgrims every time [I]0-i pray — it will be like being silent about that — it will be no more wrong than that . " But there was a touch of anxiety in the words ; [she]1526-her was not quite certain ; [she]1526-her wanted to be reassured . [Instinct]207-instinct moved [her]1526-her not to speak of [him]176-flamen ; but habit made it seem wrong to [her]1526-her to have any secret from [the people who had been about [her]1526-her from [her]1526-her birth]2504-the people who had been about her from her birth . [He]176-flamen did not reassure [her]1526-her ; [her]1526-her anxiety was pretty to watch , and [he]176-flamen left the trouble in [her]1526-her heart like a bee in the chalice of a lily . Besides , the little wicket gate was between [them]2505-them ; [he]176-flamen was musing whether [he]176-flamen would push it open once more . [Her]1526-her fate was in the balance , though [she]1526-her did not dream it : [he]176-flamen had dealt with [her]1526-her tenderly , honestly , sacredly all that day — almost as much so as [stupid Jeannot]144-jeannot could have done . [He]176-flamen had been touched by [her]1526-her trust in [him]176-flamen , and by the unconscious beauty of [her]1526-her fancies , into a mood that was unlike all [his]176-flamen life and habits . But after all , [he]176-flamen said to [himself]176-flamen — After all ! — Where [he]176-flamen stood in the golden evening [he]176-flamen saw the rosy curled mouth , the soft troubled eves , the little brown hands that still tried to fasten the rosebud , the young peach - like skin where the wind stirred the bodice;—she was only [a little Flemish peasant]2506-a little flemish peasant , [this poor little Bébée]2507-this poor little bébée , a little thing of [the fields]306-the fields and [the streets]608-the streets , for all the dreams of [God]108-god that abode with [her]1526-her . After all — soon or late — the end would be always the same . What matter ! [She]1526-her would weep a little to - morrow , and [she]1526-her would not kneel any more at the shrine in the garden wall ; and then — and then — [she]1526-her would stay [here]1953-here and marry [the good boor [Jeannot]144-jeannot]2511-the good boor jeannot , just the same after a while ; or drift away after [him]144-jeannot to [Paris]15-paris , and leave [her]1526-her two little wooden shoes , and [her]1526-her visions of [Christ]110-christ in [the fields]306-the fields at evening , behind [her]1526-her forevermore , and do as [all the others]2513-all the others did , and take not only silken stockings but the Cinderella slipper that is called Gold , which brings all other good things in its train;—what matter ! [He]144-jeannot had meant this from the first , because [she]1526-her was so pretty , and those little wooden sabots ran so lithely over the stones ; though [he]144-jeannot was not in love with [her]1526-her , but only idly stretched [his]144-jeannot hand for [her]1526-her as [a child]334-a child by instinct stretches to a fruit that hangs in the sun a little rosier and a little nearer than the rest . What matter — [he]144-jeannot said to [himself]144-jeannot — [she]1526-her loved [him]144-jeannot , poor little soul , though [she]1526-her did not know it ; and there would always be [Jeannot]144-jeannot glad enough of a handful of bright French gold . [He]144-jeannot pushed the gate gently against [her]1526-her ; [her]1526-her hands fastened the rosebud and drew open the latch themselves . "[2503-the pilgrims] Will [you]1536-you come in a little ? " [she]1526-her said , with the happy light in [her]1526-her face . "[1536-you] [You]1536-you must not stay long , because the flowers must be watered , and then there are [Annémie]142-annémie 's patterns — they must be done or [she]1537-she will have no money and so no food — but if [you]1536-you would come in for a little ? And see , if [you]1536-you wait a minute [I]0-i will show [you]1536-you the roses that [I]0-i shall cut to - morrow the first thing , and take down to [St. Guido]6-st. guido to [[Our]1538-our Lady]275-our lady 's altar in thank - offering for to - day . [I]0-i should like [you]1536-you to choose them — [you]1536-you [yourself]1536-you — and if [you]1536-you would just touch them [I]0-i should feel as if [you]1536-you gave them to [her]275-our lady too . Will [you]1536-you ? " [She]101-bébée spoke with the pretty outspoken frankness of [her]101-bébée habitual speech , just tempered and broken with the happy , timid hesitation , the curious sense at once of closer nearness and of greater distance , that had come on [her]101-bébée since [he]1536-you had kissed [her]101-bébée among the bright beanflowers . [He]1536-you turned from [her]101-bébée quickly . "[1536-you] No , [dear]2076-dear , no . Gather [your]2076-dear roses alone , [Bébée]101-bébée ; if [I]0-i touch [them]1541-them [their]1541-them leaves will fall . " Then , with a hurriedly backward glance down [the dusky lane]2515-the dusky lane to see that [none]633-none were looking , [he]1536-you bent [his]1536-you head and kissed [her]101-bébée again quickly and with a sort of shame , and swung the gate behind [him]1536-you and went away through the boughs and the shadows . [Bébée]101-bébée looked after [him]1536-you wistfully till [his]1536-you figure was lost in the gloom . [The village]1454-the village was very quiet ; a dog barking afar off and a cow lowing in [the meadow]2518-the meadow were the only living things that made [their]2519-their presence heard ; [the pilgrims]2503-the pilgrims had not returned . [She]0-i leaned on the gate a few minutes in that indistinct , dreamy happiness which is the prerogative of innocent love . "[1542-he] How wonderful it is that [he]1542-he should give a thought to [me]0-i ! " [she]0-i said again and again to [herself]0-i . It was as if [a king]2521-a king had stooped for a little knot of daisied grass to set it in [his]2521-a king crown where the great diamonds should be . [She]0-i did not reason . [She]0-i did not question . [She]0-i did not look beyond that hour — such is the privilege of youth . "[1542-he] How [I]0-i will read ! How [I]0-i will learn ! How wise [I]0-i will try to be ; and how good , if [I]0-i can ! " [she]0-i thought , swaying the little gate lightly under [her]0-i weight , and looking with glad eyes at the goats as [they]2503-the pilgrims frisked with [[their]2503-the pilgrims young]2522-their young in [the pasture on the other side of the big trees]2523-the pasture on the other side of the big trees , whilst one by one the stars came out , and an owl hooted from [the palace woods]2524-the palace woods , and the frogs croaked good - nights in the rushes . Then , like a little day laborer as [she]0-i was , with the habit of toil and the need of [the poor]2442-the poor upon [her]0-i from [her]0-i birth up , [she]0-i shut down the latch of the gate , kissed it where [his]2526-his hand had rested , and went to the well to draw its nightly draught for [the dry garden]2527-the dry garden . "[1543-dear roses] Oh , [dear roses]1543-dear roses ! " [she]0-i said to [them]1543-dear roses as [she]0-i rained the silvery showers over [their]1543-dear roses nodding heads . "[1543-dear roses] Oh , dear roses!—tell [me]0-i — was ever [anybody]632-anybody so happy as [I]0-i am ? Oh , if [you]1543-dear roses say ' yes ' [I]0-i shall tell [you]1543-dear roses [you]1543-dear roses lie ; silly flowers that were only born yesterday ! " But the roses shook the water off them in the wind , and said , as [she]0-i wished [them]1543-dear roses to say , — "[1950-no one] No — [no one]1950-no one — ever before , [Bébée]101-bébée — [no one]1950-no one ever before . " For roses , like everything else upon [earth]269-earth , only speak what [our]2529-our own heart puts into them . [An old man]450-an old man went past up [the lane]396-the lane ; [old Jehan , who was too ailing and aged to make one of the pilgrimage]2532-old jehan , who was too ailing and aged to make one of the pilgrimage . [He]450-an old man looked at the little quick - moving form , grayish white in the starlight , with the dark copper vessel balanced on [her]101-bébée head , going to and fro betwixt the well and [the garden]1940-the garden . "[101-bébée] [You]101-bébée did not go to the pilgrimage , [poor little one]1547-poor little one ! " [he]450-an old man said across the sweetbrier hedge . "[101-bébée] Nay , that was too bad ; work , work , work — [thy]101-bébée pretty back should not be bent double yet . [You]101-bébée want a holiday , [Bébée]101-bébée ; well , [the Fête Dieu]68-fête dieu is near . [Jeannot]144-jeannot shall take [you]101-bébée , and maybe [I]0-i can find a few sous for gingerbread and merry - go - rounds . [You]101-bébée sit dull in [the market]272-the market all day ; [you]101-bébée want a feast . " [Bébée]101-bébée colored behind the hedge , and ran in and brought three new - laid eggs that [she]101-bébée had left in the flour - bin in the early morning , and thrust them on [him]144-jeannot through a break in the brier . It was the first time [she]0-i had ever done anything of which [she]0-i might not speak : [she]0-i was ashamed , and yet the secret was so sweet to [her]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i am very happy , [Jehan]185-old jehan , thank [God]108-god ! " [she]0-i murmured , with a tremulous breath and a shine in [her]0-i eyes that [the old man]285-the old man 's ears and sight were too dull to discern . "[0-i] So was [she]0-i " muttered [Jehan]185-old jehan , as [he]185-old jehan thrust the eggs into [his]185-old jehan old patched blue blouse,—"so[0-i] was [she]0-i . And then a stumble — a blow in [the lane there]1549-the lane there — a horse 's kick — and all was over . All over , [[my]0-i pretty one]1977-my pretty one — for ever and ever . " On a sudden impulse [Flamen]176-flamen , going through the woodland shadows to [the city]225-the city , paused and turned back ; all [his]176-flamen impulses were quick and swayed [him]176-flamen now hither , now thither , in many contrary ways . [He]176-flamen knew that the hour was come — that [he]176-flamen must leave [her]0-i and spare [her]0-i , as to [himself]176-flamen [he]176-flamen phrased it , or teach [her]0-i the love words that the daisies whisper to [women]785-women . And why not?—anyway [she]0-i would marry [Jeannot]144-jeannot . [He]176-flamen , half - way to [the town]412-the town , walked back again and paused a moment at the gate ; an emotion half pitiful , half cynical , stirred in [him]176-flamen . Anyway [he]176-flamen would leave [her]0-i in a few days : [Paris]15-paris had again opened [her]15-paris arms to [him]176-flamen ; [his]176-flamen old life awaited [him]176-flamen ; [women who claimed [him]176-flamen by imperious , amorous demands reproached [him]176-flamen]2538-women who claimed him by imperious , amorous demands reproached him ; and after all this day [he]176-flamen had got the Gretchen of [his]176-flamen ideal , a great picture for the future of [his]176-flamen fame . As [he]176-flamen would leave [her]0-i anyway so soon , [he]176-flamen would leave [her]0-i unscathed — poor little field flower — [he]176-flamen could never take it with [him]176-flamen to blossom or wither in [Paris]15-paris . [[His]176-flamen world]2539-his world would laugh too utterly if [he]176-flamen made for [himself]176-flamen [a mistress out of a little Fleming in two wooden shoes]2540-a mistress out of a little fleming in two wooden shoes . Besides — Besides , something that was half weak and half noble moved [him]176-flamen not to lead [this child]2266-this child , in [her]0-i trust and [her]0-i ignorance , into ways that when [she]0-i awakened from [her]0-i trance would seem to [her]0-i shameful and full of sorrow . For [he]176-flamen knew that [Bébée]101-bébée was not as [others]876-others are . [He]176-flamen turned back and knocked at the hut door and opened it . [Bébée]101-bébée was just beginning to undress [herself]101-bébée ; [she]101-bébée had taken off [her]101-bébée white kerchief and [her]101-bébée wooden shoes ; [her]101-bébée pretty shoulders and [her]101-bébée little neck shone white in the moon ; [her]101-bébée feet were bare on the mud floor . [She]101-bébée started with a cry and threw the handkerchief again on [her]101-bébée shoulders , but there was no fear of [him]176-flamen ; only the unconscious instinct of [her]101-bébée girlhood . [He]176-flamen thought for a moment that [he]176-flamen would not go away until the morrow — "[1551-her] Did [you]1551-her want [me]0-i ? " said [Bébée]101-bébée softly , with happy eyes of surprise and yet a little startled , fearing some evil might have happened to [him]176-flamen that [he]176-flamen should have returned thus . "[1551-her] No ; [I]0-i do not want [you]1551-her , [dear]2076-dear , " [he]176-flamen said gently ; no — [he]176-flamen did not want [her]1551-her , [poor little soul]681-poor little soul ; [she]1551-her wanted [him]176-flamen , but [he]176-flamen — there were so many of these things in [his]176-flamen life , and [he]176-flamen liked [her]1551-her too well to love [her]1551-her . "[0-i] No , [dear]2076-dear , [I]0-i did not want [you]1551-her , " said [Flamen]176-flamen , drawing [her]1551-her arms about [him]176-flamen , and feeling [her]1551-her flutter like a little bird , while the moonlight came in through the green leaves and fell in fanciful patterns on the floor . "[0-i] But [I]0-i came to say — [you]1551-her have had one happy day . Wholly happy , have [you]1551-her not , [poor little Bébée]101-bébée ? " "[101-bébée] Ah , yes ! " [she]1551-her sighed rather than said the answer in [her]1551-her wondrous gladness ; drawn there close to [him]176-flamen , with the softness of [his]176-flamen lips upon [her]1551-her . Could [he]176-flamen have come back only to ask that ? "[101-bébée] Well , that is something . [You]1551-her will remember it always , [Bébée]101-bébée ? " [he]176-flamen murmured in [his]176-flamen unconscious cruelty . "[1551-her] [I]0-i did not wish to spoil [your]101-bébée cloudless pleasure , [dear]2076-dear — for [you]101-bébée care for [me]0-i a little , do [you]101-bébée not?—so [I]0-i came back to tell [you]101-bébée only now , that [I]0-i go away for a little while to - morrow . " "[0-i] Go away ! " [She]1551-her trembled in [his]176-flamen arms and turned cold as ice ; a great terror and darkness fell upon [her]1551-her ; [she]1551-her had never thought that [he]176-flamen would ever go away . [He]176-flamen caressed [her]1551-her , and played with [her]1551-her as [a boy]2544-a boy may with a bird before [he]176-flamen wrings its neck . "[101-bébée] [You]101-bébée will come back ? " [He]176-flamen kissed [her]1551-her : "[101-bébée] Surely . " "[101-bébée] To - morrow ? " "[101-bébée] Nay — not so soon . " "[101-bébée] In a week ? " "[101-bébée] Hardly . " "[101-bébée] In a month , then ? " "[101-bébée] Perhaps . " "[101-bébée] Before winter , anyway ? " [He]176-flamen looked aside from the beseeching , tearful , candid eyes , and kissed [her]1551-her hair and [her]1551-her throat , and said , "[2076-dear] Yes , [dear]2076-dear — beyond a doubt . " [She]1551-her clung to [him]176-flamen , crying silently ; [he]176-flamen wished that [women]785-women would not weep . "[2076-dear] Come , [Bébée]101-bébée , listen , " [he]176-flamen said coaxingly , thinking to break the bitterness to [her]1551-her . "[101-bébée] This is not wise , and it gives [me]0-i pain . There is so much for [you]101-bébée to do . [You]101-bébée know so little . There is so much to learn . [I]0-i will leave [you]101-bébée many books , and [you]101-bébée must grow quite learned in [my]0-i absence . [The Virgin]386-the virgin is all very well in [her]386-the virgin way , but [she]386-the virgin can not teach [us]1557-us much , [poor lady]1558-poor lady . For [[her]386-the virgin kingdom]1559-her kingdom is called Ignorance . [You]101-bébée must teach [yourself]101-bébée . [I]0-i leave [you]101-bébée that to do . The days will go by quickly if [you]101-bébée are laborious and patient . Do [you]101-bébée love [me]0-i , [little one]1934-little one ? " For an answer [she]101-bébée kissed [his]1934-little one hand . "[101-bébée] [You]101-bébée are [a busy little Bébée]1561-a busy little bébée always , " [he]1934-little one said , with [his]1934-little one lips caressing [her]101-bébée soft brown arms that were round [his]1934-little one neck . "[101-bébée] But [you]101-bébée must be busier than ever whilst [I]0-i am gone . So [you]101-bébée will forget . No , no , [I]0-i do not mean that:—I mean so the time will pass quickest . And [I]0-i shall finish [your]101-bébée picture , [Bébée]101-bébée , and all [Paris]15-paris will see [you]101-bébée , and [the great ladies]1509-the great ladies will envy [the little girl]1563-the little girl with [her]1563-the little girl two wooden shoes . Ah ! that does not please [you?—you]101-bébée care for none of these vanities . No . [Poor little Bébée]101-bébée , why did [God]108-god make [you]101-bébée , or [Chance]209-chance breathe life into [you]101-bébée ? [You]101-bébée are so far away from [[us]1564-us all]1565-us all . It was cruel . What harm has [[your]101-bébée poor little soul]1566-your poor little soul ever done that , pure as a flower , it should have been sent to [the hell of [this world]1568-this world]1567-the hell of this world ? " [She]101-bébée clung to [him]2546-he , sobbing without sound . "[101-bébée] [You]101-bébée will come back ? [You]101-bébée will come back ? " [she]101-bébée moaned , clasping [him]2546-he closer and closer . [Flamen]176-flamen 's own eyes grew dim . But [he]2546-he lied to [her]101-bébée : "[0-i] [I]0-i will — [I]0-i promise . " It was so much easier to say so , and it would break [her]101-bébée sorrow . So [he]2546-he thought . For the moment again [he]2546-he was tempted to take [her]101-bébée with [him]2546-he — but , [he]2546-he resisted it — [he]2546-he would tire , and [she]101-bébée would cling to [him]2546-he forever . There was a long silence . The bleating of [the little kid]2547-the little kid in [the shed without]2548-the shed without was the only sound ; the gray lavender blew to and fro . [Her]101-bébée arms were close about [his]2546-he throat ; [he]2546-he kissed [them]2549-them again , and kissed [her]101-bébée eyes , [her]101-bébée cheek , [her]101-bébée mouth ; then put [her]101-bébée from [him]2546-he quickly and went out . [She]101-bébée ran to [him]2546-he , and threw [herself]101-bébée on the damp ground and held [him]2546-he there , and leaned [her]101-bébée forehead on [his]2546-he feet . But though [he]2546-he looked at [her]101-bébée with wet eyes , [he]2546-he did not yield , and [he]2546-he still said , — "[0-i] [I]0-i will come back soon — very soon ; be quiet , [dear]2076-dear , let [me]0-i go . " Then [he]2546-he kissed [her]101-bébée once more many times , and put [her]101-bébée gently within the door and closed it . A low , sharp , sudden cry reached [him]2546-he , went to [his]2546-he heart , but [he]2546-he did not turn ; [he]2546-he went on through [the wet , green little garden]2550-the wet , green little garden , and the curling leaves , where [he]2546-he had found peace and had left desolation . "[0-i] [I]0-i will let [her]2076-dear alone , and [she]2076-dear will marry [Jeannot]144-jeannot , " thought [Flamen]176-flamen ; and [he]176-flamen believed [himself]176-flamen [a good man]2551-a good man for once in [his]176-flamen life , and pitied [himself]176-flamen for having become [a sentimentalist]2552-a sentimentalist . [She]2076-dear would marry [Jeannot]144-jeannot , and bear many [children]2553-children , as [those people]974-those people always did ; and [ruddy little peasants]2555-ruddy little peasants would cling about these pretty , soft , little breasts of [hers]2076-dear ; and [she]2076-dear would love [them]2555-ruddy little peasants after the manner of [such women]1195-such women , and be very content clattering over the stones in [her]2076-dear wooden shoes ; and growing brown and stout , and more careful after money , and ceasing to dream of unknown things , and not seeing [God]108-god at all in [the fields]306-the fields , but looking low and beholding only the ears of the gleaning wheat and the feet of [the tottering children]2558-the tottering children ; and so gaining [her]2076-dear bread , and losing [her]2076-dear soul , and stooping nearer and nearer to earth till [she]2076-dear dropped into it like one of [her]2076-dear own wind - blown wall - flowers when the bee has sucked out all its sweetness and the heats have scorched up all its bloom:—yes , of course , [she]2076-dear would marry [Jeannot]144-jeannot and end so ! Meanwhile [he]144-jeannot had [[his]144-jeannot Gretchen]2559-his gretchen , and that was the one great matter . So [he]144-jeannot left [the street of Mary of [Burgundy]58-burgundy]2290-the street of mary of burgundy , and went on [his]144-jeannot way out of [the chiming city]2561-the chiming city as [its]2561-the chiming city matin bells were rung , and took with [him]144-jeannot a certain regret , and the only innocent affection that had ever awakened in [him]144-jeannot ; and thought of [his]144-jeannot self - negation with half admiration and half derision ; and so drifted away into the whirlpool of [his]144-jeannot amorous , cynical , changeful , passionate , callous , many - colored life , and said to [himself]144-jeannot as [he]144-jeannot saw the last line of [the low green plains]2562-the low green plains shine against the sun , "[1570-she] [She]1570-she will marry [Jeannot]144-jeannot — of course , [she]1570-she will marry [Jeannot]144-jeannot . And [[my]0-i [Gretchen]161-gretchen]2265-my gretchen is greater than [Scheffer]160-scheffer 's . " What else mattered very much , after all , except what [they]2563-they would say in [[Paris]15-paris of [Gretchen]161-gretchen]81-paris of gretchen ? [People]337-people saw that [Bébée]101-bébée had grown very quiet . But that was all [they]2563-they saw . [Her]101-bébée little face was pale as [she]101-bébée sat among [her]101-bébée glowing autumn blossoms , by the side of [[the cobbler]638-the cobbler 's stall]2566-the cobbler 's stall ; and when [the Varnhart children]2025-the varnhart children cried at the gate to [her]101-bébée to come and play , [she]101-bébée would answer gently that [she]101-bébée was too busy to have play - time now . [The fruit girl of [the Montagne de la Cour]277-the montagne de la cour]2568-the fruit girl of the montagne de la cour hooted after [her]101-bébée , "[161-gretchen] Gone so soon?—oh hé ! what did [I]0-i say?—a fine pine is sugar in the teeth a second only , but the brown nuts [you]1572-you may crack all the seasons round . Well , did [you]1572-you make good harvest while it lasted ? has [Jeannot]144-jeannot a fat bridal portion promised ? " And [old Jehan]185-old jehan , who was the tenderest soul of [them]2025-the varnhart children all in the lane by [the swans ' water]2373-the swans ' water , would come and look at [her]101-bébée wistfully as [she]101-bébée worked among the flowers , and would say to [her]101-bébée , — "[144-jeannot] [Dear little one]1945-dear little one , there is some trouble : does it come of that painted picture ? [You]1945-dear little one never laugh now , [Bébée]101-bébée , and that is bad . [A girl]461-a girl 's laugh is pretty to hear ; [[my]0-i girl]1981-my girl laughed like little bells ringing — and then it stopped , all at once ; [they]1576-they said [she]1981-my girl was dead . But [you]1945-dear little one are not dead , [Bébée]101-bébée . And yet [you]1945-dear little one are so silent ; [one]1951-one would say [you]1945-dear little one were . " But to the mocking of [the fruit girl]1256-the fruit girl , as to the tenderness of [old Jehan]185-old jehan , [Bébée]101-bébée answered nothing ; the lines of [her]101-bébée pretty curled mouth grew grave and sad , and in [her]101-bébée eyes there was a wistful , bewildered , pathetic appeal like the look in the eyes of a beaten dog , which , while it aches with pain , does not cease to love [its master]2572-its master . One resolve upheld and made [her]101-bébée feet firm on the stones of [the streets]608-the streets and [her]101-bébée lips mute under all [they]1576-they said to [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée would learn all [she]101-bébée could , and be good , and patient , and wise , if trying could make [her]101-bébée wise , and so do [his]185-old jehan will in all things — until [he]185-old jehan should come back . "[1951-one] [You]1945-dear little one are not gay , [Bébée]101-bébée , " said [Annémie]142-annémie , who grew so blind that [she]142-annémie could scarce see the flags at the mastheads , and who still thought that [she]142-annémie pricked the lace patterns and earned [her]142-annémie bread . "[101-bébée] [You]1945-dear little one are not gay , [dear]2076-dear . Has [any lad]1579-any lad gone to [sea]2132-sea that [your]1945-dear little one heart goes away with , and do [you]1945-dear little one watch for [[his]1579-any lad ship]1581-his ship coming in with [the coasters]1582-the coasters ? It is weary work waiting ; but it is all [the men]477-the men think [us]1584-we fit for , [child]2004-child . [They]477-the men may set sail as [they]477-the men like ; [every new port]1586-every new port has new faces for [them]477-the men ; but [we]1584-we are to sit still and to pray if [we]1584-we like , and never murmur , be the voyage ever so long , but be ready with a smile and a kiss , a fresh pipe of tobacco , and a dry pair of socks;—that is [a man]710-a man . [We]1584-we may have cried [our]1584-we hearts out ; [we]1584-we must have ready the pipe and the socks , or , ' Is that what [you]1588-you call love ? ' [they]477-the men grumble . [You]1945-dear little one want mortal patience if [you]1945-dear little one love [a man,—it]1589-a man,—it is like [a fretful child]1590-a fretful child that thumps [you]1945-dear little one when [your]1945-dear little one breast is bare to it . Still , be [you]1945-dear little one patient , [dear]2076-dear , just as [I]0-i am , just as [I]0-i am . " And [Bébée]101-bébée would shudder as [she]101-bébée swept the cobwebs from the garret walls,—patient as [she]101-bébée was , [[she]101-bébée who had sat here fifty years watching for [a dead man]1949-a dead man and for [a wrecked ship]2576-a wrecked ship]2574-she who had sat here fifty years watching for a dead man and for a wrecked ship . The wheat was reapen in [the fields]306-the fields , and [the brown earth]2578-the brown earth turned afresh . The white and purple chrysanthemums bloomed against the flowerless rose - bushes , and the little gray Michaelmas daisy flourished where the dead carnations had spread their glories . Leaves began to fall and chilly winds to sigh among the willows ; the squirrels began to store away their nuts , and [the poor]2442-the poor to pick up the broken bare boughs . "[1592-he] [He]1592-he said [he]1592-he would come before winter , " thought [Bébée]101-bébée , every day when [she]101-bébée rose and felt each morning cooler and grayer than the one before it ; winter was near . [Her]101-bébée little feet already were cold in [their]2580-their wooden shoes ; and the robin already sang in the twigs of the sear sweetbrier ; but [she]101-bébée had the brave sweet faith which nothing kills , and [she]101-bébée did not doubt — oh ! no , [she]101-bébée did not doubt , [she]101-bébée was only tired . Tired of the strange , sleepless , feverish nights ; tired of the long , dull , empty days : tired of watching down [the barren , leafless lane]2581-the barren , leafless lane : tired of hearkening breathless to each step on the rustling dead leaves ; tired of looking always , always , always , into the ruddy autumn evenings and the cold autumn starlight , and never hearing what [she]101-bébée listened for , never seeing what [she]101-bébée sought ; tired as [a child]334-a child may be lost in a wood , and wearily wearing its small strength and breaking its young heart in search of [the track forever missed]2583-the track forever missed , of [the home forever beyond the horizon]2584-the home forever beyond the horizon . Still [she]101-bébée did [her]101-bébée work and kept [her]101-bébée courage . [She]101-bébée took [her]101-bébée way into [the town]412-the town with [her]101-bébée basket full of the ruby and amber of the dusky autumn blossoms , and when those failed , and [the garden]1940-the garden was quite desolate , except for a promise of haws and of holly , [she]101-bébée went , as [she]101-bébée had always done , to [the lace - room]484-the lace - room , and gained [her]101-bébée bread and the chickens ' corn each day by winding the thread round the bobbins ; and at nightfall when [she]101-bébée had plodded [home]289-home through [the darksome roads]2589-the darksome roads and over the sodden turf , and had lit [her]101-bébée rushlight and sat down to [her]101-bébée books , with [her]101-bébée hand buried in [her]101-bébée hair , and [her]101-bébée eyes smarting from the strain of the lace - work and [her]101-bébée heart aching with that new and deadly pain which never left [her]101-bébée now , [she]101-bébée would read — read — read — read , and try and store [her]101-bébée brain with knowledge , and try and grasp these vast new meanings of life that the books opened to [her]101-bébée , and try and grow less ignorant against [he]2590-he should return . There was much [she]101-bébée could not understand , bait there was also much [she]101-bébée could . [Her]101-bébée mind was delicate and quick , [her]101-bébée intelligence swift and strong ; [she]101-bébée bought old books at bookstalls with pence that [she]101-bébée saved by going without [her]101-bébée dinner . [The keeper of the stall]2591-the keeper of the stall , [a shrewd old soul]2592-a shrewd old soul , explained some hard points to [her]101-bébée , and chose good volumes for [her]101-bébée , and lent others to [this solitary little student in [her]101-bébée wooden shoes and with [her]101-bébée pale child]2593-this solitary little student in her wooden shoes and with her pale child 's face . So [she]101-bébée toiled hard and learned much , and grew taller and very thin , and got a look in [her]101-bébée eyes like a lost dog 's , and yet never lost heart or wandered in the task that [he]2591-the keeper of the stall had set [her]101-bébée , or in [her]101-bébée faith in [his]2591-the keeper of the stall return . "[1592-he] Burn the books , [Bébée]101-bébée , " whispered [the children]373-the children again and again , clinging to [her]101-bébée skirts . "[101-bébée] Burn the wicked , silent things . Since [you]101-bébée have had [them]1593-them [you]101-bébée never sing , or romp , or laugh , and [you]101-bébée look so white — so white . " [Bébée]101-bébée kissed [them]373-the children , but kept to [her]101-bébée books . [Jeannot]144-jeannot going by from [the forest]522-the forest night after night saw the light twinkling in the hut window , and sometimes crept softly up and looked through the chinks of the wooden shutter , and saw [her]101-bébée leaning over some big old volume with [her]101-bébée pretty brows drawn together , and [her]101-bébée mouth shut close in earnest effort , and [he]144-jeannot would curse [the man who had changed [her]101-bébée so and go away with rage in [his]144-jeannot breast and tears in [his]144-jeannot eyes]2596-the man who had changed her so and go away with rage in his breast and tears in his eyes , not daring to say anything , but knowing that never would [Bébée]101-bébée 's little brown hand lie in love within [his]144-jeannot own . Nor even in friendship , for [he]144-jeannot had rashly spoken rough words against [the stranger]711-the stranger from [[Rubes]150-rubes ' land]2150-rubes ' land , and [Bébée]101-bébée ever since then had passed [him]144-jeannot by with a grave , simple greeting , and when [he]144-jeannot had brought [her]101-bébée in timid gifts a barrow - load of fagots , had thanked [him]144-jeannot , but had bidden [him]144-jeannot take the wood [home]289-home to [[his]144-jeannot mother]598-his mother . "[1594-you] [You]1594-you think evil things of [me]0-i , [Bébée]101-bébée ? " good [Jeannot]144-jeannot had pleaded , with a sob in [his]144-jeannot voice ; and [she]101-bébée had answered gently , — "[1594-you] No ; but do not speak to [me]0-i , that is all . " Then [he]144-jeannot had cursed [[her]101-bébée absent lover]2601-her absent lover , and [Bébée]101-bébée gone within and closed [her]101-bébée door . [She]101-bébée had no idea that [the people]504-the people thought ill of [her]101-bébée . [They]504-the people were cold to [her]101-bébée , and such coldness made [her]101-bébée heart ache a little more . But the one great love in [her]101-bébée possessed [her]101-bébée so strongly that all other things were half unreal . [She]101-bébée did [her]101-bébée daily housework from sheer habit , and [she]101-bébée studied because [he]144-jeannot had told [her]101-bébée to do it , and because with the sweet , stubborn , credulous faith of [her]101-bébée youth , [she]101-bébée never doubted that [he]144-jeannot would return . Otherwise there was no perception of real life in [her]101-bébée ; [she]101-bébée dreamed and prayed , and prayed and dreamed , and never ceased to do either one or the other , even when [she]101-bébée was scattering potato - peels to the fowls , or shaking carrots loose of the soil , or sweeping the snow from [her]101-bébée hut door , or going out in the raw dark dawn as the single little sad bell of [St. Guido]6-st. guido tolled through the stillness for the first mass . For though even [Father Francis]105-father francis looked angered at [her]101-bébée because [he]105-father francis thought [she]101-bébée was stubborn , and hid some truth and some shame from [him]105-father francis at confession , yet [she]101-bébée went resolutely and oftener than ever to kneel in [the dusty , dusky , crumbling old church]2603-the dusty , dusky , crumbling old church , for it was all [she]101-bébée could do for [him]144-jeannot who was absent — so [she]101-bébée thought — and [she]101-bébée did not feel quite so far away from [him]144-jeannot when [she]101-bébée was beseeching [Christ]110-christ to have care of [his]144-jeannot soul and of [his]144-jeannot body . All [her]101-bébée pretty dreams were dead . [She]101-bébée never heard any story in the robin 's song , or saw any promise in the sunset clouds , or fancied that [angels]2604-angels came about [her]101-bébée in the night — never now . [The fields]306-the fields were gray and sad ; the birds were little brown things ; the stars were cold and far off ; [the people [she]101-bébée had used to care for]2606-the people she had used to care for were like mere shadows that went by [her]101-bébée meaningless and without interest , and all [she]101-bébée thought of was the one step that never came : all [she]101-bébée wanted was the one touch [she]101-bébée never felt . "[1595-you] [You]1595-you have done wrong , [Bébée]101-bébée , and [you]1595-you will not own it , " said [the few neighbors who ever spoke to [her]101-bébée]2607-the few neighbors who ever spoke to her . [Bébée]101-bébée looked at [them]2607-the few neighbors who ever spoke to her with wistful , uncomprehending eyes . "[101-bébée] [I]0-i have done no wrong , " [she]0-i said gently , but [no one]1950-no one believed [her]0-i . [A girl]461-a girl did not shut [herself]461-a girl up and wane pale and thin for nothing , so [they]2607-the few neighbors who ever spoke to her reasoned . [She]461-a girl might have sinned as [she]461-a girl had liked if [she]461-a girl had been sensible after it , and married [Jeannot]144-jeannot . But to fret mutely , and shut [her]461-a girl lips , and seem as though [she]461-a girl had done nothing,—that was guilt indeed . For [[her]461-a girl village]1358-her village , in [its]1358-her village small way , thought as [the big world]2611-the big world thinks . Full winter came . The snow was deep , and the winds drove [the people]504-the people with whips of ice along [the dreary country roads]2613-the dreary country roads and [the steep streets of [the city]225-the city]2614-the steep streets of the city . The bells of the dogs and the mules sounded sadly through the white misty silence of [the Flemish plains]2616-the flemish plains , and the weary horses slipped and fell on the frozen ruts and on the jagged stones in [the little frost - shut [Flemish towns]2618-flemish towns]2617-the little frost - shut flemish towns . Still [the Flemish folk]2619-the flemish folk were gay enough in many places . There were [fairs]2620-fairs and [kermesses]2621-kermesses ; there were puppet plays and church feasts ; there were sledges on [the plains]410-the plains and skates on [the canals]2623-the canals ; there were warm woollen hoods and ruddy wood fires ; there were tales of demons and [saints]2036-saints , and bowls of hot onion soup ; sugar images for [the little children]518-the little children , and blessed beads for [the maidens clasped on rosy throats with lovers]2626-the maidens clasped on rosy throats with lovers ' kisses ; and in [the city]225-the city itself there was the high tide of the winter pomp and mirth , with festal scenes in [the churches]2628-the churches , and balls at [the palaces]1197-the palaces , and all manner of gay things in toys and jewels , and music playing cheerily under the leafless trees , and flashes of scarlet cloth , and shining furs , and happy faces , and golden curls , in [the carriages that climbed [the Montagne de la Cour]277-the montagne de la cour]2630-the carriages that climbed the montagne de la cour , and filled [the big place around the statue of [stout Godfrey]210-stout godfrey]2632-the big place around the statue of stout godfrey . In [the little village]2633-the little village above [St. Guido]6-st. guido , [Bébée 's neighbors]2634-bébée 's neighbors were merry too , in [their]2634-bébée 's neighbors simple way . [The women]346-the women worked away wearily at [their]346-the women lace in the dim winter light , and made a wretched living by it , but all the same [they]346-the women got penny playthings for [[their]346-the women babies]2636-their babies , and a bit of cake for [their]346-the women Sunday - hearth . [They]346-the women drew together in homely and cordial friendship , and of an afternoon when dusk fell wove [their]346-the women lace in company in [[Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs 's mill - house kitchen]2637-mère krebs 's mill - house kitchen with [the children]373-the children and the dogs at [their]346-the women feet on the bricks , so that one big fire might serve for all , and all be lighted with one big rush candle , and all be beguiled by chit - chat and songs , stories of spirits , and whispers of ghosts , and now and then when the wind howled at its worst , a paternoster or two said in common for [the men]477-the men toiling in [the barges]937-the barges or drifting up [the Scheldt]39-the scheldt . In these gatherings [Bébée]101-bébée 's face was missed , and the blithe soft sound of [her]101-bébée voice , like a young thrush singing , was never heard . [The people]504-the people looked in , and saw [her]101-bébée sitting over a great open book ; often [[her]101-bébée hearth]2642-her hearth had no fire . Then [the children]373-the children grew tired of asking [her]101-bébée to play ; and [[their]373-the children elders]2644-their elders began to shake [their]2644-their elders heads ; [she]101-bébée was so pale and so quiet , there must be some evil in it — so [they]2644-their elders began to think . [Little by little people]2645-little by little people dropped away from [her]101-bébée . Who knew , [the gossips]2646-the gossips said , what shame or sin [the child]377-the child might not have on [her]101-bébée sick little soul ? True , [Bébée]101-bébée worked hard just the same , and just the same was seen trudging to and fro in the dusk of dawns and afternoons in [her]101-bébée two little wooden shoes . [She]101-bébée was gentle and laborious , and gave [the children]373-the children [her]101-bébée goat 's milk , and [the old women]873-the old women the brambles of [[her]101-bébée garden]413-her garden . But [they]373-the children grew afraid of [her]101-bébée — afraid of that sad , changeless , far - away look in [her]101-bébée eves , and of the mute weariness that was on [her]101-bébée — and , being perplexed , were sure , like [all ignorant creatures]2651-all ignorant creatures , that what was secret must be also vile . So [they]373-the children hung aloof , and let [her]101-bébée alone , and by and by scarcely nodded as [they]373-the children passed [her]101-bébée but said to [Jeannot]144-jeannot , — "[0-i] [You]1596-you were spared a bad thing , [lad]1597-lad : [the child]377-the child was [that grand painter]1599-that grand painter 's light - o'-love , that is plain to see . The mischief all comes of the stuff [old Antoine]103-antoine filled [her]377-the child head with — a stray little by - blow of chickweed that [he]103-antoine cockered up like a rare carnation . Oh ! do not fly in a rage , [Jeannot]144-jeannot ; [the child]377-the child is no good , and would have made [an honest man]1601-an honest man rue . Take heart of grace , and praise [the saints]399-the saints , and marry [Katto 's Lisa]211-lisa . " But [Jeannot]144-jeannot would never listen to [the slanderers]2652-the slanderers , and would never look at [Lisa]211-lisa , even though the door of [the little hut]1021-the little hut was always closed against [him]144-jeannot ; and whenever [he]144-jeannot met [Bébée]101-bébée on [the highway]254-the highway [she]101-bébée never seemed to see [him]144-jeannot more than [she]101-bébée saw the snow that [her]101-bébée sabots were treading . One night in the midwinter - time [old Annémie]142-annémie died . [Bébée]101-bébée found [her]101-bébée in the twilight with [her]101-bébée head against the garret window , and [her]101-bébée left side all shrivelled and useless . [She]101-bébée had a little sense left , and a few fleeting breaths to draw . "[211-lisa] Look for [the brig]1603-the brig , " [she]101-bébée muttered . "[1604-you] [You]1604-you will not see the flag at [the masthead]1605-the masthead for the fog to - night ; but [his]1606-his socks are dry and [his]1606-his pipe is ready . Keep looking — keep looking — [she]1603-the brig will be in port to - night . " But [[her]101-bébée dead sailor]2655-her dead sailor never came into port ; [she]101-bébée went to [him]1606-his . [The poor , weakened , faithful old body of [her]101-bébée]2656-the poor , weakened , faithful old body of her was laid in [the graveyard of [the poor]2442-the poor]2657-the graveyard of the poor , and [the ships]907-the ships came and went under the empty garret window , and [Bébée]101-bébée was all alone . [She]101-bébée had no more anything to work for , or any bond with the lives of [others]876-others . [She]101-bébée could live on the roots of [[her]101-bébée garden]413-her garden and the sale of [her]101-bébée hens ' eggs , and [she]101-bébée could change the turnips and carrots that grew in a little strip of [her]101-bébée ground for the quantity of bread that [she]101-bébée needed . So [she]101-bébée gave [herself]101-bébée up to the books , and drew [herself]101-bébée more and more within from [the outer world]2662-the outer world . [She]101-bébée did not know that [the neighbors]371-the neighbors thought very evil of [her]101-bébée ; [she]101-bébée had only one idea in [her]101-bébée mind — to be more worthy of [him]2664-him against [he]2664-him should return . The winter passed away somehow , [she]101-bébée did not know how . It was a long , cold , white blank of frozen silence : that was all . [She]101-bébée studied hard , and had got a quaint , strange , deep , scattered knowledge out of [her]101-bébée old books ; [her]101-bébée face had lost all its roundness and color , but , instead , the forehead had gained breadth and the eyes had the dim fire of [a student]2341-a student 's . Every night when [she]101-bébée shut [her]101-bébée volumes [she]101-bébée thought , — "[1607-him] [I]0-i am a little nearer [him]1607-him . [I]0-i know a little more . " Just so every morning , when [she]101-bébée bathed [her]101-bébée hands in the chilly water , [she]101-bébée thought to [herself]101-bébée , "[0-i] [I]0-i will make [my]0-i skin as soft as [I]0-i can for [him]1607-him , that it may be like [the ladies ' [he]1607-him has loved]1608-the ladies ' he has loved . " Love to be perfect must be a religion , as well as a passion . [Bébée]101-bébée 's was so . Like [[George Herbert]212-george herbert 's serving - maiden]2666-george herbert 's serving - maiden , [she]101-bébée swept no specks of dirt away from a floor without doing it to the service of [[her]101-bébée lord]2667-her lord . Only [[Bébée]101-bébée 's lord]2668-bébée 's lord was [a king of earth , made of earth 's dust and vanities]2669-a king of earth , made of earth 's dust and vanities . But what did [she]101-bébée know of that ? The winter went by , and the snow - drops and crocus and pale hepatica smiled at [her]101-bébée from the black clods . Every other springtime [Bébée]101-bébée had run with fleet feet under the budding trees down into [the city]225-the city , and had sold sweet little wet bunches of violets and brier before all the snow was melted from the eaves of [the Broodhuis]494-the broodhuis . "[1608-the ladies ' he has loved] The winter is gone , " [the townspeople]2672-the townspeople used to say ; "[1608-the ladies ' he has loved] look , there is [Bébée]101-bébée with the flowers . " But this year [they]2672-the townspeople did not see the little figure itself like a rosy crocus standing against [the brown timbers of [the Maison de Roi]2674-the maison de roi]2673-the brown timbers of the maison de roi . [Bébée]101-bébée had not heart to pluck a single blossom of them all . [She]101-bébée let [them]2672-the townspeople all live , and tended [them]2672-the townspeople so that [the little garden]2675-the little garden should look its best and brightest to [him]2668-bébée 's lord when [his]2668-bébée 's lord hand should lift its latch . Only [he]2668-bébée 's lord was so long coming — so very long ; the violets died away , and the first rosebuds came in [their]2672-the townspeople stead , and still [Bébée]101-bébée looked every dawn and every nightfall vainly down [the empty road]2676-the empty road . Nothing kills [young creatures]2677-young creatures like the bitterness of waiting . Pain [they]2677-young creatures will bear , and privation [they]2677-young creatures will pass through , fire and water and storm will not appall [them]2677-young creatures , nor wrath of heaven and earth , but waiting — the long , tedious , sickly , friendless days , that drop one by one in [their]2677-young creatures eternal sameness into the weary past , these kill slowly but surely , as the slow dropping of water frets away rock . The summer came . Nearly a year had gone by . [Bébée]101-bébée worked early and late . [The garden]1940-the garden bloomed like one big rose , and [the neighbors]371-the neighbors shook [their]371-the neighbors heads to see the flowers blossom and fall without bringing in a single coin . [She]101-bébée [herself]101-bébée spoke less seldom than ever ; and now when [old Jehan]185-old jehan , who never had understood the evil thoughts of [[his]185-old jehan neighbors]2680-his neighbors , asked [her]101-bébée what ailed [her]101-bébée that [she]101-bébée looked so pale and never stirred down to [the city]225-the city , now [her]101-bébée courage failed [her]101-bébée , and the tears brimmed over [her]101-bébée eyes , and [she]101-bébée could not call up a brave brief word to answer [him]185-old jehan . For the time was so long , and [she]101-bébée was so tired . Still [she]101-bébée never doubted that [[her]101-bébée lover]1307-her lover would comeback : [he]1307-her lover had said [he]1307-her lover would come : [she]101-bébée was as sure that [he]1307-her lover would come as [she]101-bébée was sure that [God]108-god came in the midst of [the people]504-the people when the silver bell rang and [the Host]2684-the host was borne by on high . [Bébée]101-bébée did not heed much , but [she]101-bébée vaguely - felt the isolation [she]101-bébée was left in : as [a child too young to reason]2685-a child too young to reason feels cold and feels hunger . "[101-bébée] [No one]1950-no one wants [me]0-i here now that [Annémie]142-annémie is gone , " [she]101-bébée thought to [herself]101-bébée , as the sweet green spring days unfolded themselves one by one like the buds of the brier - rose hedges . And now and then even [the loyal little soul of [her]101-bébée]2686-the loyal little soul of her gave way , and sobbing on [her]101-bébée lonely bed in the long dark nights , [she]101-bébée would cry out against [him]1307-her lover , "[142-annémie] Oh , why not have left [me]0-i alone ? [I]0-i was so happy — so happy ! " And then [she]101-bébée would reproach [herself]101-bébée with treason to [him]1307-her lover and ingratitude , and hate [herself]101-bébée and feel guilty in [her]101-bébée own sight to have thus sinned against [him]1307-her lover in thought for one single instant .
