For there are natures in which the generosity of love is so strong that it feels its own just pain to be disloyalty ; and [Bébée]101-bébée 's was one of them . And if [he]1307-her lover had killed [her]101-bébée [she]101-bébée would have died hoping only that no moan had escaped [her]101-bébée under the blow that ever could accuse [him]1307-her lover . These natures , utterly innocent by force of self - accusation and self - abasement , suffer at once the torment of [the victim]2687-the victim and [the criminal]2688-the criminal . One day in the May weather [she]101-bébée sat within doors with a great book upon [her]101-bébée table , but no sight for it in [her]101-bébée aching eyes . The starling hopped to and fro on the sunny floor ; the bees boomed in [the porch]2689-the porch ; the tinkle of sheep 's bells came in on the stillness . All was peaceful and happy except the little weary , breaking , desolate heart that beat in [her]101-bébée like a caged bird 's . "[0-i] [He]1610-he will come ; [I]0-i am sure [he]1610-he will come , " [she]101-bébée said to [herself]101-bébée ; but [she]101-bébée was so tired , and it was so long — oh , dear God!—so very long . A hand tapped at the lattice . The shrill voice of [Reine]181-reine , [[the sabot - maker]1172-the sabot - maker 's wife]1173-the sabot - maker 's wife , broken with anguish , called through the hanging ivy , — "[1610-he] Bébée , [you]1611-you are [a wicked one]1612-a wicked one , [they]1613-they say , but [the only one there]1614-the only one there is at [home]289-home in [the village]1454-the village this day . Get [you]1611-you to [town]476-town for the love of [Heaven]137-heaven , and send [Doctor Max]213-doctor max hither , for [my]0-i pet , [my]0-i flower , [[my]0-i child]2089-my child lies dying , and [not a soul near]1619-not a soul near , and [she]2089-my child black as a coal with choking — go , go , go!—and [Mary]131-mary will forgive [you]1611-you [your]1611-you sins . Save [the little one]276-the little one , [dear Bébée]1621-dear bébée , do [you]1611-you hear ? and [I]0-i will pray [God]108-god and speak fair [the neighbors]371-the neighbors for [you]1611-you . Go ! " [Bébée]101-bébée rose up , startled by the now unfamiliar sound of a human voice , and looked at [the breathless mother]2692-the breathless mother with eyes of pitying wonder . "[0-i] Surely [I]0-i will go , " [she]0-i said , gently ; "[0-i] but there is no need to bribe [me]0-i . [I]0-i have not sinned greatly — that [I]0-i know . " Then [she]0-i went out quickly and ran through [the lanes]1083-the lanes and into [the city]225-the city for [the sick child]2695-the sick child , and found [the wise man]2696-the wise man , and sent [him]2696-the wise man , and did the errand rather in a sort of sorrowful sympathetic instinct than in any reasoning consciousness of doing good . When [she]0-i was moving through the once familiar and happy ways as the sun was setting on the golden fronts of [the old houses]2697-the old houses , and the chimes were ringing from [the many towers]2698-the many towers , a strange sense of unreality , of non - existence , fell upon [her]0-i . Could it be [she?—she]0-i indeed — who had gone [there]2000-there the year before the gladdest thing that [the earth]915-the earth bore , with no care except to shelter [her]0-i flowers from the wind , and keep the freshest blossoms for [[the burgomaster]576-the burgomaster 's housewife]2702-the burgomaster 's housewife ? [She]0-i did not think thus to [herself]0-i ; but a vague doubt that [she]0-i could ever have been [the little gay , laborious , happy Bébée]2703-the little gay , laborious , happy bébée , with troops of [friends and endless joys for every day that dawned]2704-friends and endless joys for every day that dawned , came over [her]0-i as [she]0-i went by the black front of [the Broodhuis]126-the broodhuis . The strong voice of [Lisa]211-lisa , [the fruit girl]1256-the fruit girl , jarred on [her]0-i as [she]0-i passed the stall under [its]126-the broodhuis yellow awning that was flapping sullenly in the evening wind . "[0-i] Oh hé , [little fool]1623-little fool , " [the mocking voice]2706-the mocking voice cried , "[1623-little fool] the rind of the fine pine is full of prickles , and stings the lips when the taste is gone?—to be sure — crack common nuts like [me]0-i and [you]1623-little fool are never wanting — hazels grow free in every copse . Prut , tut ! [[your]1623-little fool grand lover]1624-your grand lover lies a - dying ; so [the students]2165-the students read out of this just now ; and [you]1623-little fool such a simpleton as not to get a roll of napoleons out of [him]1624-your grand lover before [he]1624-your grand lover went to rot in [Paris]15-paris . [I]0-i dare say [he]1624-your grand lover was poor as sparrows , if [one]1951-one knew the truth . [He]1624-your grand lover was only [a painter]2033-a painter after all . " [Lisa]211-lisa tossed [her]0-i as [she]211-lisa spoke a torn sheet , in which [she]211-lisa was wrapping gentians : it was a piece of newspaper some three weeks old , and in it there was a single line or so which said that [the artist Flamen , whose Gretchen was the wonder of the Salon of the year]2707-the artist flamen , whose gretchen was the wonder of the salon of the year , lay sick unto death in [[his]2707-the artist flamen , whose gretchen was the wonder of the salon of the year rooms in [Paris]15-paris]2708-his rooms in paris . [Bébée]101-bébée stood and read ; the strong ruddy western light upon the type , the taunting laughter of [the fruit girl]1256-the fruit girl on [her]1256-the fruit girl ear . A bitter shriek rang from [her]1256-the fruit girl that made even the cruelty of [Lisa]211-lisa 's mirth stop in a sudden terror . [She]1256-the fruit girl stood staring like a thing changed to stone down on the one name that to [her]1256-the fruit girl rilled [all the universe]2710-all the universe . "[2033-a painter] Ill — [he]1624-your grand lover is ill — do [you]1628-you hear ? " [she]1256-the fruit girl echoed piteously , looking at [Lisa]211-lisa ; "[1628-you] and [you]1628-you say [he]1624-your grand lover is poor ? " "[1628-you] Poor ? for sure ! is [he]1624-your grand lover not [a painter]2033-a painter ? " said [the fruit girl]1256-the fruit girl , roughly . [She]1256-the fruit girl judged by [[her]1256-the fruit girl own penniless student lads]2712-her own penniless student lads ; and [she]1256-the fruit girl was angered with [herself]1256-the fruit girl for feeling sorrow for this little silly thing that [she]1256-the fruit girl had loved to torture . "[1624-your grand lover] [You]1624-your grand lover have been bad and base to [me]0-i ; but now — [I]0-i bless [you]1624-your grand lover , [I]0-i love [you]1624-your grand lover , [I]0-i will pray for [you]1624-your grand lover , " said [Bébée]101-bébée , in a swift broken breath , and with a look upon [her]1256-the fruit girl face that startled into pain [[her]1256-the fruit girl callous enemy]2713-her callous enemy . Then without another word , [she]1256-the fruit girl thrust the paper in [her]1256-the fruit girl bosom , and ran out of [the square]718-the square breathless with haste and with a great resolve . [He]2713-her callous enemy was ill — and [he]2713-her callous enemy was poor ! [The brave little soul of [her]1256-the fruit girl]2715-the brave little soul of her leaped at once to action . [He]2713-her callous enemy was sick , and far away ; and poor [they]2716-they said . All danger and all difficulty faded to nothing before the vision of [his]2713-her callous enemy need . [Bébée]101-bébée was only [a little foundling who ran about in wooden shoes]2717-a little foundling who ran about in wooden shoes ; but [she]101-bébée had the "[0-i] dog 's soul " in [her]101-bébée — [the soul that will follow faithfully though to receive a curse , that will defend loyally though to meet a blow]2718-the soul that will follow faithfully though to receive a curse , that will defend loyally though to meet a blow , and that will die mutely loving to the last . [She]1256-the fruit girl went [home]289-home , how [she]1256-the fruit girl never knew ; and without the delay of a moment packed up a change of linen , and fed the fowls and took the key of [the hut]284-the hut down to [[old Jehan]185-old jehan 's cabin]2721-old jehan 's cabin . [The old man]285-the old man was only half - witted by reason of [his]285-the old man affliction for [[his]285-the old man dead daughter]1280-his dead daughter , but [he]285-the old man was shrewd enough to understand what [she]1256-the fruit girl wanted of [him]285-the old man , and honest enough to do it . "[0-i] [I]0-i am going into [the city]225-the city , " [she]0-i said to [him]285-the old man : "[0-i] and if [I]0-i am not back to - night , will [you]1631-you feed the starling and the hens , and water the flowers for [me]0-i ? " [Old Jehan]185-old jehan put [his]185-old jehan head out of [his]185-old jehan lattice : it was seven in the evening , and [he]185-old jehan was going to bed . "[1631-you] What are [you]0-i after , [little one]1934-little one ? " [he]285-the old man asked : going to show the fine buckles at [a students]2724-a students ' ball ? Nay , fie ; that is not like [you]0-i . "[0-i] " [I]0-i am going to — pray — dear [Jehan]185-old jehan , "[0-i] [she]0-i answered , with a sob in [her]0-i throat and the first falsehood [she]0-i ever had told . " Do what [I]1633-he ask [you]1633-he — do for [[your]1633-he dead daughter]2725-your dead daughter 's sake — or the birds and the flowers will die of hunger and thirst . Take the key and promise [me]1633-he . "[1633-he] [He]1633-he took the key , and promised . " Do not let [them]2726-them see those buckles shine ; they will rob [you]101-bébée , "[1633-he] [he]1633-he added . [Bébée]101-bébée ran from [him]1633-he fast ; every moment that was lost was so precious and so terrible . To pause a second for fear 's sake never occurred to [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée went forth as fearlessly as [a young swallow]1634-a young swallow , born in northern April days , flies forth on instinct to [new lands]1512-new lands and over [unknown seas]1636-unknown seas when autumn falls . Necessity and action breathed new life into [her]101-bébée . [The hardy and brave peasant ways of [her]101-bébée]1637-the hardy and brave peasant ways of her were awoke once more . [She]101-bébée had been strong to wait silently with the young life in [her]101-bébée dying out drop by drop in the heart - sickness of long delay . [She]101-bébée was strong now to throw [herself]101-bébée into strange countries and dim perils and immeasurable miseries , on the sole chance that [she]101-bébée might be of service to [him]1633-he . [A few human souls here and there]1638-a few human souls here and there can love like dogs . [Bébée]101-bébée 's was one . It was dark . The May days are short in [the north lands of [the Scheldt]39-the scheldt]1639-the north lands of the scheldt . [She]101-bébée had [her]101-bébée little winter cloak of frieze and [her]101-bébée wooden shoes and [her]101-bébée little white cap with the sunny curls rippling out of it in their pretty rebellion . [She]101-bébée had [her]101-bébée little lantern too ; and [her]101-bébée bundle , and [she]101-bébée had put a few fresh eggs in [her]101-bébée basket , with some sweet herbs and the palm - sheaf that [Father Francis]105-father francis had blessed last Easter ; for who could tell , [she]101-bébée thought , how ill [he]1633-he might not be , or how poor ? [She]101-bébée hardly gave a look to [the hut]284-the hut as [she]101-bébée ran by [its]284-the hut garden gate ; all [her]101-bébée heart was on in front , in [the vague far - off country where [he]1633-he lay sick unto death]1641-the vague far - off country where he lay sick unto death . [She]101-bébée ran fast through [the familiar lanes]1642-the familiar lanes into [the city]225-the city . [She]101-bébée was not very sure where [Paris]15-paris was , but [she]101-bébée had the name clear and firm , and [she]101-bébée knew that [people]337-people were always coming and going thence and thither , so that [she]101-bébée had no fear [she]101-bébée should not find it . [She]101-bébée went straight to [the big , busy , bewildering place in [the [Leopold]85-leopold quarter where the iron horses fumed every day and night along the iron ways]1646-the leopold quarter where the iron horses fumed every day and night along the iron ways]1645-the big , busy , bewildering place in the leopold quarter where the iron horses fumed every day and night along the iron ways . [She]101-bébée had never been [there]2000-there before , but [she]101-bébée knew it was by [that great highway]1648-that great highway that the traffic to [Paris]15-paris was carried on , and [she]101-bébée knew that it would carry [people]337-people also as well . There were bells clanging , lights flashing , and [crowds]1650-crowds pushing and shouting , as [she]101-bébée ran up — [a little gray figure]1651-a little gray figure , with the lantern - spark glimmering like any tiny glow - worm astray in a gas - lit city . " To [Paris]15-paris ? "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée asked , entreatingly , going where [she]101-bébée saw [others]876-others going , to a little grated wicket in a wall . " Twenty - seven francs — quick ! "[1653-they] [they]1653-they demanded of [her]101-bébée . [Bébée]101-bébée gave a great cry , and stood still , trembling and trying not to sob aloud . [She]101-bébée had never thought of money ; [she]101-bébée had forgotten that youth and strength and love and willing feet and piteous prayers,—all went for nothing as [this world]1568-this world is made . A hope flashed on [her]101-bébée and a glad thought . [She]101-bébée loosed the silver buckles , and held them out . " Would [you]1653-they take these ? They are worth much more . "[101-bébée] There was a derisive laughter ; [some one]1967-some one bade [her]101-bébée with an oath begone ; rough shoulders jostled [her]101-bébée away . [She]101-bébée stretched [her]101-bébée arms out piteously . " Take [me]101-bébée — oh , pray take [me]101-bébée ! [I]101-bébée will go with the sheep , with the cattle — only , only take [me]101-bébée ! "[101-bébée] But in the rush and roar [none]633-none heeded [her]101-bébée ; [some thief]1657-some thief snatched the silver buckles from [her]101-bébée hand , and made off with them and was lost in the throng ; [a great iron beast]1658-a great iron beast rushed by [her]101-bébée , snorting flame and bellowing smoke ; there was a roll like thunder , and all was dark ; the night express had passed on its way to [Paris]15-paris . [Bébée]101-bébée stood still , crushed for a moment with the noise and the cruelty and the sense of absolute desolation ; [she]101-bébée scarcely noticed that the buckles had been stolen ; [she]101-bébée had only one thought — to get to [Paris]15-paris . " Can [I]101-bébée never go without money ? "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée asked at the wicket ; [the man there]1659-the man there glanced a moment , with a touch of pity , at the little wistful face . " The least is twenty francs — surely [you]101-bébée must know that ? "[1659-the man there] [he]1659-the man there said , and shut [his]1659-the man there grating with a clang . [Bébée]101-bébée turned away and went out of [the great cruel , tumultuous place]1660-the great cruel , tumultuous place ; [her]101-bébée heart ached and [her]101-bébée brain was giddy , but the sturdy courage of [her]101-bébée nature rose to need . " There is no way at all to go without money to [Paris]15-paris , [I]101-bébée suppose ? "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée asked of [an old woman whom [she]101-bébée knew a little , who sold nuts and little pictures of [saints and wooden playthings under the trees]1662-saints and wooden playthings under the trees , in [the avenue hard by]1663-the avenue hard by]1661-an old woman whom she knew a little , who sold nuts and little pictures of saints and wooden playthings under the trees , in the avenue hard by . [The old woman]627-the old woman shook [her]627-the old woman head . " Eh?—no , [dear]2076-dear . There is nothing to be done anywhere in [the world]370-the world without money . Look , [I]627-the old woman can not get a litre of nuts to sell unless [I]627-the old woman pay beforehand . "[627-the old woman] " Would it be far to walk ? "[627-the old woman] " Far ! [Holy Jesus]2729-holy jesus ! [It]1660-the great cruel , tumultuous place is right away in [the heart of [France]11-france]2730-the heart of france — over two hundred miles , [they]2731-they say ; straight out through [the forest]522-the forest . Not but what [[my]627-the old woman son]2733-my son did walk it once;—and [he]2733-my son [a shoemaker , who knows what walking costs]2734-a shoemaker , who knows what walking costs ; and [he]2733-my son is well - to - do [there]2000-there now — not that [he]2733-my son ever writes . When [they]2731-they want nothing [people]337-people never write . "[627-the old woman] " And [he]2733-my son walked into [Paris]15-paris ? "[627-the old woman] " Yes , ten years ago . [He]2733-my son had nothing but a few sous and an ash stick , and [he]2733-my son had a fancy to try [his]2733-my son luck [there]2000-there . And after all [our]2738-our feet were given [us]2738-our to travel with . If [you]101-bébée go [there]2000-there and [you]101-bébée see [him]2733-my son , tell [him]2733-my son to send [me]627-the old woman something — [I]627-the old woman am tired of selling nuts . "[627-the old woman] [Bébée]101-bébée said nothing , but went on [[her]101-bébée road]1665-her road ; since there was no other way but to walk , [she]101-bébée would take that way ; the distance and the hardship did not appall two little feet that were used to traverse so many miles of sun - baked summer dust and of frozen winter mud unblenchingly year after year . The time it would take made [her]101-bébée heart sink indeed . [He]1666-he was ill . [God]108-god knew what might happen . But neither the length of leagues nor the fatigue of body daunted [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée only saw [his]1666-he eyes dim with pain and [his]1666-he lips burned with fever . [She]101-bébée would walk twenty miles a day , and then , perhaps , [she]101-bébée might get lifts here and there on [hay wagons]1667-hay wagons or in [pedlers]1668-pedlers ' carts ; [people]337-people had always used to be kind to [her]101-bébée . Anyhow [she]101-bébée counted [she]101-bébée might reach [Paris]15-paris well in fifteen days . [She]101-bébée sat under a shrine in [a by street]1670-a by street a moment , and counted the copper pieces [she]101-bébée had on [her]101-bébée ; they were few , and the poor pretty buckles that [she]101-bébée might have sold to get money were stolen . [She]101-bébée had some twenty sous and a dozen eggs ; [she]101-bébée thought [she]101-bébée might live on that ; [she]101-bébée had wanted to take the eggs to [him]1666-he , but after all , to keep life in [her]101-bébée until [she]101-bébée could reach [Paris]15-paris was the one great thing . " What a blessing it is to have been born poor ; and to have lived hardly — [one]1951-one wants so little ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée thought to [herself]101-bébée . Then [she]101-bébée put up the sous in the linen bosom of [her]101-bébée gown , and trimmed [her]101-bébée little lantern and knelt down in the quiet darkness and prayed a moment , with the hot agonized tears rolling down [her]101-bébée face , and then rose and stepped out bravely in the cool of the night , on [the great southwest road towards [Paris]15-paris]1671-the great southwest road towards paris . The thought never once crossed [her]101-bébée to turn back , and go again into the shelter of [[her]101-bébée own little hut]1672-her own little hut among the flowers . [He]1666-he was sick there , dying , for anything [she]101-bébée knew ; that was the only thing [she]101-bébée remembered . It was a clear , starlit night , and everywhere the fragrance of the spring was borne in from [the wide green plains]1673-the wide green plains , and [the streams where the rushes]1674-the streams where the rushes were blowing . [She]101-bébée walked ten miles easily , the beautiful gray shadow all about [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée had never been so far from [home]289-home in all [her]101-bébée life , except to [that one Kermesse at [Mechlin]8-mechlin]1676-that one kermesse at mechlin . But [she]101-bébée was not afraid . With the movement , and the air , and the sense that [she]101-bébée was going to [him]1666-he , which made [her]101-bébée happy even in [her]101-bébée misery , something of the old , sweet , lost fancies came to [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée smiled at the stars through [her]101-bébée tears , and as the poplars swayed and murmured in the wind , they looked to [her]101-bébée like the wings and the swords of [a host of angels]1677-a host of angels . [Her]101-bébée way lay out through [the forest]522-the forest , and in [that sweet green woodland]1679-that sweet green woodland [she]101-bébée was not afraid — no more afraid than the fawns were . At [Boitsfort]86-boitsfort [she]101-bébée shrank a little , indeed . Here there were [the open - air restaurants]1680-the open - air restaurants , and [the café gardens]1681-the café gardens all alight for [the pleasure - seekers from [the city]225-the city]1682-the pleasure - seekers from the city ; here there were music and laughter , and horses with brass bells , and bright colors on high in the wooden balconies , and below among the blossoming hawthorn hedges . [She]101-bébée had to go through it all , and [she]101-bébée shuddered a little as [she]101-bébée ran , thinking of that one priceless , deathless forest day when [he]1684-he had kissed [her]101-bébée first . But [the pleasure - people]1685-the pleasure - people were all busied with [their]1685-the pleasure - people mirth and mischief , and took no notice of [the little gray figure in the starry night]1686-the little gray figure in the starry night . [She]101-bébée went on along [the grassy roads]1687-the grassy roads , under the high arching trees , with the hoot of the owls and the cry of the rabbits on the stillness . At [Groenendael]87-groenendael , in [the heart of [the forest]522-the forest]1688-the heart of the forest midnight was striking as [she]101-bébée entered [the village]1454-the village . [Every one]2111-every one was asleep . The lights were all out [The old ruined priory]1692-the old ruined priory frowned dark under the clouds . [She]101-bébée shivered a little again , and began to feel chill and tired , yet did not dare to knock at any one of the closed house doors — [she]101-bébée had no money . So [she]101-bébée walked on [her]101-bébée first ten unknown miles , meeting [a few people]1693-a few people only , and being altogether unmolested — a small gray figure , trotting in two little wooden shoes . [They]1693-a few people thought [her]101-bébée [a peasant]809-a peasant going to a fair or [a lace mill]1695-a lace mill , and [no one]1950-no one did [her]101-bébée more harm than to wish [her]101-bébée good night in [rough Flemish]1697-rough flemish . When the dawn began to whiten above [the plains of [the east]1699-the east]1698-the plains of the east , [she]101-bébée saw [an empty cow - shed filled with hay]1700-an empty cow - shed filled with hay ; [she]101-bébée was a little tired , and lay down and rested an hour or two , as a young lamb might have lain on the dried clover , for [she]101-bébée knew that [she]101-bébée must keep [her]101-bébée strength and husband [her]101-bébée power , or never reach across [the dreary length of [the foreign land]1702-the foreign land to [Paris]15-paris]1701-the dreary length of the foreign land to paris . But by full sunrise [she]101-bébée was on [her]101-bébée way again , bathing [her]101-bébée face in [a brook]1703-a brook and buying a sou 's worth of bread and flet - milk at [the first cottage that [she]101-bébée passed in bright , leaf - bowered Hoey - laert]1704-the first cottage that she passed in bright , leaf - bowered hoey - laert . [The forest]522-the forest was still all around [her]101-bébée , with its exquisite life of bough and blossom , and murmur of insect and of bird . [She]101-bébée told [her]101-bébée beads , praying as [she]101-bébée went , and was almost happy . [God]108-god would not let [him]1706-him die . Oh , no , not till [she]101-bébée had kissed [him]1706-him once more , and could die with [him]1706-him . The hares ran across [the path]1004-the path , and the blue butterflies flew above - head . There was purple gloom of pine wood , and sparkling verdure of aspen and elm . There were distant church carillons ringing , and straight golden shafts of sunshine streaming . [She]101-bébée was quite sure [God]108-god would not let [him]1706-him die . [She]101-bébée hoped that [he]1706-him might be very poor . At times [he]1706-him had talked as if [he]1706-him were , and then [she]101-bébée might be of so much use . [She]101-bébée knew how to deal with fever and suffering . [She]101-bébée had sat up many a night with [the children of [the village]1454-the village]1708-the children of the village . [The gray sisters]1710-the gray sisters had taught [her]101-bébée many of [their]1710-the gray sisters ways of battling with disease ; and [she]101-bébée could make fresh cool drinks , and [she]101-bébée could brew beautiful remedies from simple herbs . There was so much that [she]101-bébée might do ; [her]101-bébée fancy played with it almost happily . And then , only to touch [his]1706-him hand , only to hear [his]1706-him voice ; [her]101-bébée heart rose at the thought , as a lark to its morning song . At [Rixensart]88-rixensart , buried in [its]88-rixensart greenery , as [she]101-bébée went through [it]88-rixensart in morning light , [some peasants]1711-some peasants greeted [her]101-bébée cheerily , and called to [her]101-bébée to rest in [a house porch]1712-a house porch , and gave [her]101-bébée honey and bread . [She]101-bébée could not eat much ; [her]101-bébée tongue was parched and [her]101-bébée throat was dry , but the kindness was precious to [her]101-bébée , and [she]101-bébée went on [her]101-bébée road the stronger for it . " It is a long way to walk to [Paris]15-paris , "[1713-the woman] said [the woman]1713-the woman , with some curious wonder . [Bébée]101-bébée smiled , though [her]101-bébée eyes grew wet . " [She]101-bébée has the look of [the little Gesù]2741-the little gesù , "[1714-the rixensart people] said [the Rixensart people]1714-the rixensart people ; and [they]1714-the rixensart people watched [her]101-bébée away with a vague timid pity . So [she]101-bébée went on through [Ottignies]89-ottignies and [La Roche]90-la roche to [Villers]91-villers , and left [the great woods]1715-the great woods and [the city]225-the city chimes behind [her]101-bébée , and came through [the green abbey valleys through [Tilly]92-tilly and [Ligny]93-ligny]1717-the green abbey valleys through tilly and ligny , and [Fleurus]94-fleurus , and so into [the coal and iron fields]1718-the coal and iron fields that lie round [Charleroi]95-charleroi . Here [her]101-bébée heart grew sick , and [her]101-bébée courage sank under the noise and the haste , before the blackness and the hideousness . [She]101-bébée had never seen anything like it . [She]101-bébée thought it was hell , with the naked , swearing , fighting [people]337-people , and the red fires leaping night and day . Nevertheless , if hell it were , since it lay betwixt [her]101-bébée and [him]1720-him , [she]101-bébée found force to brave and cross it . [The miners]1721-the miners and [glass - blowers]1722-glass - blowers and [nail - makers]1723-nail - makers , rough and fierce and hard , frightened [her]101-bébée . [The women]346-the women did not look like [women]785-women , and [the children]373-the children ran and yelled at [her]101-bébée , and set [their]373-the children dogs upon [her]101-bébée . The soil was thick with dust like soot , and the trees were seared and brown . There was no peace in [the place]256-the place , and no loveliness . [Eighty thousand folks]1728-eighty thousand folks toiled together in [the hopeless Tophet]1729-the hopeless tophet , and swarmed , and struggled , and labored , and multiplied , in joyless and endless wrestling against hunger and death . [She]101-bébée got through it somehow , hiding often from [the ferocious youngsters]1730-the ferocious youngsters , and going sleepless rather than lie in [those dens of filth]1731-those dens of filth ; but [she]101-bébée seemed so many , many years older when [Charleroi]95-charleroi lay at last behind [her,—so]1732-her,—so many , many years older than when [she]101-bébée had sat and spun in [the garden]1940-the garden at [home]289-home . When [she]101-bébée was once in [the valley of [the Sambre]96-the sambre]1735-the valley of the sambre [she]101-bébée was more [herself]101-bébée again , only [she]101-bébée felt weaker than [she]101-bébée had ever done , because [she]101-bébée only dared to spend one of [her]101-bébée sous each day , and [one sou]1736-one sou got so little food . In [the woods]515-the woods and fields about [Alne]97-alne [she]101-bébée began to breathe again , like a bird loosed to the air after being shut in a wooden trap . Green corn , green boughs , green turf , mellow chimes of church bells , humming of golden bees , cradle songs of [women]785-women spinning , homely odors of [little herb gardens]1739-little herb gardens and of orchard trees under [cottage walls,—these]1740-cottage walls,—these had been around [her]101-bébée all [her]101-bébée life ; [she]101-bébée only breathed freely among them . [She]101-bébée often felt tired , and [her]101-bébée wooden shoes were wearing so thin that the hot dust of [the road]1011-the road at noonday burnt [her]101-bébée feet through them . Sometimes , too , [she]101-bébée felt a curious brief faintness , such as [she]101-bébée had never known , for the lack of food and the long fatigue began to tell even on [her]101-bébée hardy little body . But [she]101-bébée went on bravely , rarely doing less than [her]101-bébée twenty miles a day , and sometimes more , walking often in the night to save time , and lying down in [cow - sheds]1742-cow - sheds or under haystacks in the noontide . For the most part [people]337-people were kind to [her]101-bébée ; [they]337-people saw [she]101-bébée was so very young and so poor . [Women]785-women would give [her]101-bébée leave to bathe [herself]101-bébée in [[their]785-women bedchambers]1745-their bedchambers , and [children]2553-children would ask [her]101-bébée to wait on [the village bench under the chestnut - tree]1747-the village bench under the chestnut - tree , while [they]2553-children brought [her]101-bébée [their]2553-children pet lamb or [their]2553-children tumbler pigeons to look at , but , for the most part — unless [she]101-bébée was very , very tired — [she]101-bébée would not wait . It took [her]101-bébée so long , and who could tell how it fared with [him]1748-him in [Paris]15-paris ? Into [the little churches]1749-the little churches , scattered over [the wide countries between [Charleroi]95-charleroi and [Erquelinnes]98-erquelinnes]1750-the wide countries between charleroi and erquelinnes , [she]101-bébée would turn aside , indeed ; but , then , that was only to say a prayer for [him]1748-him ; that was not loss to [him]1748-him , but gain . So [she]101-bébée walked on until [she]101-bébée reached [the frontier of [France]11-france]1751-the frontier of france . [She]101-bébée began to get a little giddy ; [she]101-bébée began to see the blue sky and the green level always swirling round [her]101-bébée as if [some one]1967-some one were spinning them to frighten [her]101-bébée , but still [she]101-bébée would not be afraid ; [she]101-bébée went on , and on , and on , till [she]101-bébée set [her]101-bébée last step on [the soil of [Flanders]4-flanders]1753-the soil of flanders . Here a new , strange , terrible , incomprehensible obstacle opposed [her]101-bébée : [she]101-bébée had no papers ; [they]1754-they thrust [her]101-bébée back and spoke to [her]101-bébée as if [she]101-bébée were [a criminal]1755-a criminal . [She]101-bébée could not understand what [they]1754-they could mean . [She]101-bébée had never heard of these laws and rules . [She]101-bébée vaguely comprehended that [she]101-bébée must not enter [France]11-france , and stunned and heartbroken [she]101-bébée dropped down under a tree , and for the first time sobbed as if [her]101-bébée very life would weep itself away . [She]101-bébée could see nothing , understand nothing . There were [the same road]1756-the same road , [the same hedges]1757-the same hedges , [the same fields]1758-the same fields , [the same white cottages]1759-the same white cottages , and [peasants]353-peasants in blue shirts and dun - hued oxen in [the wagons]1761-the wagons . [She]101-bébée saw no mark , no difference , ere [they]1754-they told [her]101-bébée where [she]101-bébée stood was [Belgium]40-belgium , and where [they]1754-they stood was [France]11-france , and that [she]101-bébée must not pass from one into the other . [The men]477-the men took no notice of [her]101-bébée . [They]477-the men went back into [[their]477-the men guard - house]1763-their guard - house , and smoked and drank . A cat sunned [herself]101-bébée under a scarlet bean . The white clouds sailed on before a southerly sky . [She]101-bébée might die here — [he]1764-he there — and nothing seemed to care . After a while [an old hawker]1765-an old hawker came up ; [he]1765-an old hawker was travelling with wooden clocks from [the Black Forest]69-the black forest . [He]1765-an old hawker stopped and looked at [her]101-bébée , and asked [her]101-bébée what [she]101-bébée ailed . [She]101-bébée knelt down at [his]1765-an old hawker feet in the dust . " Oh , help [me]101-bébée ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée cried to [him]1765-an old hawker . " Oh , pray , help [me]101-bébée ! [I]101-bébée have walked all the way from [Brussels]1-brussels — that is [[my]101-bébée country]2742-my country — and now [they]2743-they will not let [me]101-bébée pass [[that house]2744-that house where [the soldiers]1192-the soldiers are]2745-that house where the soldiers are . [They]2743-they say [I]101-bébée have no papers . What papers should [I]101-bébée have ? [I]101-bébée do not know . When [one]1951-one has done no harm , and does not owe a sou anywhere , and has walked all the way — Is it money that [they]2743-they want ? [I]101-bébée have none ; and [they]2743-they stole [my]101-bébée silver clasps in [Brussels]1-brussels ; and if [I]101-bébée do not get to [Paris]15-paris [I]101-bébée must die — die without seeing [him]1767-the old hawker again — ever again , [dear God]2748-dear god ! "[101-bébée] [She]1766-you dropped [her]1766-you head upon the dust and crouched and sobbed there , [her]1766-you courage broken by this new barrier that [she]1766-you had never dreamed would come between [herself]1766-you and [Paris]15-paris . [The old hawker]1767-the old hawker looked at [her]1766-you thoughtfully . [He]1767-the old hawker had seen much of [men]707-men and [women]785-women , and knew truth from counterfeit , and [he]1767-the old hawker was moved by [the child]377-the child 's agony . [He]1767-the old hawker stooped and whispered in [her]1766-you ear , — " Get up quick , and [I]1767-the old hawker will pass [you]1766-you . It is against the law , and [I]1767-the old hawker may go to [prison]2749-prison for it . Never mind ; [one]1951-one must risk something in [this world]1568-this world , or else be [a cur]2752-a cur . [[My]1767-the old hawker daughter]2753-my daughter has stayed behind in [Marbais]99-marbais sweethearting ; [her]2753-my daughter name is on [my]1767-the old hawker passport , and [her]2753-my daughter age and face will do for [yours]1766-you . Get up and follow [me]1767-the old hawker close , and [I]1767-the old hawker will get [you]1766-you through . [Poor little soul]681-poor little soul ! Whatever [your]1766-you woe is it is real enough , and [you]1766-you are such [a young and pretty thing]2755-a young and pretty thing . Get up , [the guards]2756-the guards are in [[their]2756-the guards house]2757-their house , [they]2756-the guards have not seen ; follow [me]1767-the old hawker , and [you]1766-you must not speak a word ; [they]2756-the guards must take [you]1766-you for a German , dumb as wood . "[1767-the old hawker] [She]1771-her got up and obeyed [him]1772-him , not comprehending , but only vaguely seeing that [he]1772-him was friendly to [her]1771-her , and would pass [her]1771-her over into [France]11-france . [The old man]285-the old man made a little comedy at the barrier , and scolded [her]1771-her as though [she]1771-her were [[his]285-the old man daughter]466-his daughter for losing [her]1771-her way as [she]1771-her came to meet [him]1772-him , and then crying like [a baby]347-a baby . [The guards]2756-the guards looked at [her]1771-her carelessly , joked [the hawker]1777-the hawker on [her]1771-her pretty face , looked the papers over , and let [her]1771-her through , believing [her]1771-her [the child of [the clock - maker of the Hartz]1779-the clock - maker of the hartz]1778-the child of the clock - maker of the hartz . Some lies are blessed as truth . " [I]1780-the pedler have done wrong in the law , but not before [God]108-god , [I]1780-the pedler think , [little one]1934-little one , "[1780-the pedler] said [the pedler]1780-the pedler . " Nay , do not thank [me]1780-the pedler , or go on like that ; [we]2759-we are in sight of [the customs men]2760-the customs men still , and if [they]2760-the customs men suspected , it would be the four walls of [a cell]2761-a cell only that [you]1934-little one and [I]1780-the pedler should see to - night . And now tell [me]1780-the pedler [your]1934-little one story , [poor maiden]2762-poor maiden : why are [you]1934-little one on foot through [a strange country]2763-a strange country ? "[1780-the pedler] But [Bébée]101-bébée would not tell [him]1780-the pedler [her]101-bébée story : [she]101-bébée was confused and dazed still . [She]101-bébée did not know rightly what had happened to [her]101-bébée ; but [she]101-bébée could not talk of [herself]101-bébée , nor of why [she]101-bébée travelled thus to [Paris]15-paris . [The old hawker]1767-the old hawker got cross at [her]101-bébée silence , and called [her]101-bébée [an unthankful jade]1782-an unthankful jade , and wished that [he]1767-the old hawker had left [her]101-bébée to [her]101-bébée fate , and parted company with [her]101-bébée at [two cross - roads]1783-two cross - roads , saying [his]1767-the old hawker path did not lie with [hers]101-bébée ; and then when [he]1767-the old hawker had done that , was sorry , and being [a tenderhearted soul]1784-a tenderhearted soul , hobbled back , and would fain press a five - franc piece on [her]101-bébée ; and [Bébée]101-bébée , refusing it all the while , kissed [his]1767-the old hawker old brown hands and blessed [him]1767-the old hawker , and broke away from [him]1767-the old hawker , and so went on again solitary towards [St. Quentin]100-st. quentin . [The country]1785-the country was very flat and poor , and yet [the plains]410-the plains had a likeness in them to [[her]101-bébée own wide Brabant downs , where the tall green wheat was blowing and [the barges]937-the barges dropping down [the sluggish streams]1789-the sluggish streams]1787-her own wide brabant downs , where the tall green wheat was blowing and the barges dropping down the sluggish streams . [She]101-bébée was very footsore ; very weary ; very hungry so often ; but [she]101-bébée was in [France]11-france — in [[his]1767-the old hawker country]1790-his country ; and [her]101-bébée spirit rose with the sense of that nearness to [him]1767-the old hawker . After all , [God]108-god was so good to [her]101-bébée ; there were fine bright days and nights ; a few showers had fallen , but merely passing ones ; the air was so cool and so balmy that it served [her]101-bébée almost as food ; and [she]101-bébée seldom found [people]337-people so unkind that [they]337-people refused for [[her]101-bébée single little sou]1792-her single little sou to give [her]101-bébée a crust of bread and let [her]101-bébée lie in [an outhouse]1793-an outhouse . After all , [God]108-god was very good ; and by the sixteenth or seventeenth day [she]101-bébée would be in [the city of]1794-the city of [Paris]15-paris . [She]101-bébée was a little light - headed at times from insufficient nourishment : especially after waking from strange dreams in [unfamiliar places]1795-unfamiliar places ; sometimes [the soil]1796-the soil felt tremulous under [her]101-bébée , and the sky spun round ; but [she]101-bébée struggled against the feeling , and kept a brave heart , and tried to be afraid of nothing . Sometimes at night [she]101-bébée thought [she]101-bébée saw [old Annémie]142-annémie . " But what if [I]101-bébée do ? "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said to [herself]101-bébée ; " [Annémie]142-annémie never will hurt [me]101-bébée . "[101-bébée] And now , as [she]101-bébée grew nearer [her]101-bébée goal , [her]101-bébée natural buoyancy of spirit returned as it had never done to [her]101-bébée since the evening that [he]1797-him had kissed and left [her]101-bébée . As [her]101-bébée body grew lighter and more exhausted , [her]101-bébée fancy grew keener and more dominant . All things of [the earth]915-the earth and air spoke to [her]101-bébée as [she]101-bébée went along as [they]1799-they had used to do . All that [she]101-bébée had learned from the books in the long cold months came to [her]101-bébée clear and wonderful . [She]101-bébée was not so very ignorant now — ignorant , indeed , beside [him]1797-him — but still knowing something that would make [her]101-bébée able to read to [him]1797-him if [he]1797-him liked it , and to understand if [he]1797-him talked of grave things . [She]101-bébée had no fixed thought of what [she]101-bébée would be to [him]1797-him when [she]101-bébée reached [him]1797-him . [She]101-bébée fancied [she]101-bébée would wait on [him]1797-him , and tend [him]1797-him , and make [him]1797-him well , and be caressed by [him]1797-him , and get all gracious pretty things of leaf and blossom about [him]1797-him , and kneel at [his]1797-him feet , and be quite happy if [he]1797-him only touched [her]101-bébée now and then with [his]1797-him lips;—her thoughts went no further than that;—her love for [him]1797-him was of that intensity and absorption in which nothing But itself is remembered . When [a creature]1800-a creature loves much , even when it is as little and as simple a soul as [Bébée]101-bébée , [the world]370-the world and [all [its]370-the world people]1802-all its people and all its laws and ways are as naught . [They]1803-they cease to exist ; they are as though [they]1803-they had never been . [Whoever]1804-whoever recollects [an outside world]1805-an outside world may play with passion , or may idle with sentiment , but does not love . [She]101-bébée did not hear what [the villagers]1806-the villagers said to [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée did not see [the streets of [the towns]1808-the towns]1807-the streets of the towns as [she]101-bébée passed [them]1806-the villagers . [She]101-bébée kept [herself]101-bébée clean always , and broke fast now and then by sheer instinct of habit , nothing more . [She]101-bébée had no perception what [she]101-bébée did , except of walking — walking — walking always , and seeing [the white road]1809-the white road go by like pale ribbons unrolled . [She]101-bébée got a dreamy , intense , sleepless light in [her]101-bébée blue eyes that frightened [some of those [she]101-bébée passed]1810-some of those she passed . [They]1810-some of those she passed thought [she]101-bébée had been fever - stricken , and was not in [her]101-bébée senses . So [she]101-bébée went across [the dreary lowlands]1811-the dreary lowlands , wearing out [her]101-bébée little sabots , but not wearing out [her]101-bébée patience and [her]101-bébée courage . [She]101-bébée was very dusty and jaded . [Her]101-bébée woollen skirt was stained with weather and torn with briers . But [she]101-bébée had managed always to wash [her]101-bébée cap white in brook water , and [she]101-bébée had managed always to keep [her]101-bébée pretty bright curls soft and silken — for [he]1812-he had liked them so much , and [he]1812-he would soon draw them through [his]1812-he hand again . So [she]101-bébée told [herself]101-bébée a thousand times to give [her]101-bébée strength when the mist would come over [her]101-bébée sight , and [the earth]915-the earth would seem to tremble as [she]101-bébée went . On the fifteenth day from the night when [she]101-bébée had left [[her]101-bébée hut]491-her hut by [the swans ' water]2373-the swans ' water , [Bébée]101-bébée saw [Paris]15-paris . Shining away in the sun ; white and gold ; among woods and [gardens]1816-gardens [she]101-bébée saw [Paris]15-paris . [She]101-bébée was so tired — oh , so tired — but [she]101-bébée could not rest now . There were bells ringing always in [her]101-bébée ears , and a heavy pain always in [her]101-bébée head . But what of [that?—she]215-that?—she was so near to [him]215-that?—she . " Are [you]101-bébée ill , [[you]101-bébée little thing]2764-you little thing ? "[217-a woman] [a woman]217-a woman asked [her]101-bébée who was gathering early cherries in [the outskirts of [the great city]1819-the great city]1818-the outskirts of the great city . [Bébée]101-bébée looked at [her]217-a woman and smiled : " [I]101-bébée do not know — [I]101-bébée am happy . "[101-bébée] And [she]101-bébée went onward . It was evening . The sun had set . [She]101-bébée had not eaten for twenty - four hours . But [she]101-bébée could not pause for anything now . [She]101-bébée crossed [the gleaming river]1820-the gleaming river , and [she]101-bébée heard the cathedral chimes . [Paris]15-paris in all [its]15-paris glory was about [her]101-bébée , but [she]101-bébée took no more note of it than a pigeon that flies through [it]15-paris intent on reaching [home]289-home . [No one]1950-no one looked at or stopped [her]101-bébée ; [a little dusty peasant with a bundle on a stick]1823-a little dusty peasant with a bundle on a stick over [her]101-bébée shoulder . The click - clack of [her]101-bébée wooden shoes on the hot pavements made [none]633-none look up ; [little rustics]1825-little rustics came up every day like this to make [their]1825-little rustics fortunes in [Paris]15-paris . [Some]1826-some grew into golden painted silken flowers , the convolvuli of [their]1826-some brief summer days ; and some drifted into [the Seine water]1827-the seine water , rusted , wind - tossed , fallen leaves , that were wanted of [no man]1125-no man . Anyhow it was so common to see [them]1829-their , pretty but homely things , with [their]1829-their noisy shoes and [their]1829-their little all in a bundle , that [no one]1950-no one even looked once at [Bébée]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée was not bewildered . As [she]101-bébée had gone through [[her]101-bébée own city]1831-her own city , only thinking of the roses in [her]101-bébée basket and of old [Annémie]142-annémie in [[her]101-bébée garret]1832-her garret , so [she]101-bébée went through [Paris]15-paris , only thinking of [him]1833-him for whose sake [she]101-bébée had come thither . Now that [she]101-bébée was really in [[his]1833-him home]1834-his home [she]101-bébée was happy,—happy though [her]101-bébée head ached with that dull odd pain , and all the sunny glare went round and round like a great gilded humming - top , such as [the babies]1835-the babies clapped [their]1835-the babies hands at , at the Kermesse . [She]101-bébée was happy : [she]101-bébée felt sure now that [God]108-god would not let [him]1833-him die till [she]101-bébée got to [him]1833-him . [She]101-bébée was quite glad that [he]1833-him had left [her]101-bébée all that long , terrible winter , for [she]101-bébée had learned so much and was so much more fitted to be with [him]1833-him . Weary as [she]101-bébée was , and strange as the pain in [her]101-bébée head made [her]101-bébée feel , [she]101-bébée was happy , very happy ; a warm flush came on [her]101-bébée little pale cheeks as [she]101-bébée thought how soon [he]1833-him would kiss [them]1836-them , [her]101-bébée whole body thrilled with the old sweet nameless joy that [she]101-bébée had sickened for in vain so long . Though [she]101-bébée saw nothing else that was around [her]101-bébée , [she]101-bébée saw some little knots of moss - roses that [a girl]461-a girl was selling on [the quay]535-the quay , as [she]101-bébée used to sell them in front of [the Maison du Roi]416-the maison du roi . [She]101-bébée had only two sous left , but [she]101-bébée stopped and bought two little rosebuds to take to [him]1833-him . [He]1833-him had used to care for them so much in the summer in [Brabant]3-brabant . [The girl who sold them]1840-the girl who sold them told [her]101-bébée the way to [[the street]694-the street [he]1833-him lived in]1842-the street he lived in ; it was not very far of [the quay]535-the quay . [She]101-bébée seemed to float on air , to have wings like the swallows , to hear beautiful musk all around . [She]101-bébée felt for [her]101-bébée beads , and said aves of praise . [God]108-god was so good . It was quite night when [she]101-bébée reached [the street]694-the street , and sought the number of [[his]1833-him house]1845-his house . [She]101-bébée spoke [his]1833-him name softly , and trembling very much with joy , not with any fear , but it seemed to [her]101-bébée too sacred a thing ever to utter aloud . [An old man]450-an old man looked out of [a den]1847-a den by the door , and told [her]101-bébée to go straight up the stairs to [the third floor]1848-the third floor , and then turn to the right . [The old man]285-the old man chuckled as [he]285-the old man glanced after [her]101-bébée , and listened to the wooden shoes pattering wearily up the broad stone steps . [Bébée]101-bébée climbed them — ten , twenty , thirty , forty . " [He]1833-him must be very poor ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée thought , " to live so high "[101-bébée] ; and yet [the place]256-the place was wide and handsome , and had a look of riches . [Her]101-bébée heart beat so fast , [she]101-bébée felt suffocated ; [her]101-bébée limbs shook , [her]101-bébée eyes had a red blood - like mist floating before them ; but [she]101-bébée thanked [God]108-god each step [she]101-bébée climbed ; a moment , and [she]101-bébée would look upon the only face [she]101-bébée loved . " [He]108-god will be glad ; oh , [I]101-bébée am sure [he]108-god will be glad ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said to [herself]101-bébée , as a fear that had never before come near [her]101-bébée touched [her]101-bébée for a moment — if [he]108-god should not care ? But even then , what did it matter ? Since [he]108-god was ill [she]101-bébée should be there to watch [him]108-god night and day ; and when [he]108-god was well again , if [he]108-god should wish [her]101-bébée to go away — [one]1951-one could always die . " But [he]108-god will be glad — oh , [I]101-bébée know [he]108-god will be glad ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said to the rosebuds that [she]101-bébée carried to [him]108-god . " And if [God]108-god will only let [me]101-bébée save [his]108-god life , what else do [I]101-bébée want more ? "[101-bébée] [His]108-god name was written on a door before [her]101-bébée . The handle of a bell hung down ; [she]101-bébée pulled it timidly . The door unclosed ; [she]101-bébée saw [no one]1950-no one , and went through . There were low lights burning . There were heavy scents that were strange to [her]101-bébée . There was a fantastic gloom from old armor , and old weapons , and old pictures in [the dull rich chambers]1853-the dull rich chambers . The sound of [her]101-bébée wooden shoes was lost in the softness and thickness of the carpets . It was not [the home of [a poor man]1855-a poor man]1854-the home of a poor man . A great terror froze [her]101-bébée heart,—if [she]101-bébée were not wanted [here]1953-here ? [She]101-bébée went quickly through [three rooms]1857-three rooms , seeing [no one]1950-no one and at the end of the third there were folding doors . " [It]2765-it is [I]101-bébée — [Bébée]101-bébée . "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said softly , as [she]101-bébée pushed them gently apart ; and [she]101-bébée held out the two moss - rosebuds . Then the words died on [her]101-bébée lips , and a great horror froze [her]101-bébée , still and silent , there . [She]101-bébée saw [the dusky room]1859-the dusky room as in a dream . [She]101-bébée saw [him]1855-a poor man stretched on the bed , leaning on [his]1855-a poor man elbow , laughing , and playing cards upon the lace coverlet . [She]101-bébée saw [women with loose shining hair and bare limbs , and rubies and diamonds glimmering red and white]1860-women with loose shining hair and bare limbs , and rubies and diamonds glimmering red and white . [She]101-bébée saw [men lying about upon the couch]1861-men lying about upon the couch , throwing dice and drinking and laughing [one with another]1862-one with another . Beyond all [she]101-bébée saw against the pillows of [his]1855-a poor man bed a beautiful brown wicked looking thing like some velvet snake , who leaned over [him]1855-a poor man as [he]1855-a poor man threw down the painted cards upon the lace , and who had cast about [his]1855-a poor man throat [her]101-bébée curved bare arm with the great coils of dead gold all a - glitter on it . And above it all there were odors of wines and flowers , clouds of smoke , shouts of laughter , music of shrill gay voices . [She]101-bébée stood like a frozen creature and saw — the rosebuds ' in [her]101-bébée hand . Then with a great piercing cry [she]101-bébée let the little roses fall , and turned and fled . At the sound [he]1855-a poor man looked up and saw [her]101-bébée , and shook [his]1855-a poor man beautiful brown harlot off [him]1855-a poor man with an oath . But [Bébée]101-bébée flew down through [the empty chambers]1863-the empty chambers and [the long stairway]1864-the long stairway as a hare flies from the hounds ; [her]101-bébée tired feet never paused , [her]101-bébée aching limbs never slackened ; [she]101-bébée ran on , and on , and on , into [the lighted streets]1865-the lighted streets , into the fresh night air ; on , and on , and on , straight to [the river]1866-the river . From its brink [some man]1867-some man 's strength caught and held [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée struggled with it . " Let [me]101-bébée die ! let [me]101-bébée die ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée shrieked to [him]1855-a poor man , and strained from [him]1855-a poor man to get at the cool gray silent water that waited for [her]101-bébée there . Then [she]101-bébée lost all consciousness , and saw the stars no more . When [she]101-bébée came back to any sense of life , the stars were shining still , and the face of [Jeannot]144-jeannot was bending over [her]101-bébée , wet with tears . [He]1855-a poor man had followed [her]101-bébée to [Paris]15-paris when [they]1868-they had missed [her]101-bébée first , and had come straight by [train]2353-train to [the city]225-the city , making sure it was thither [she]101-bébée had come , and there had sought [her]101-bébée many days , watching for [her]101-bébée by [the house of [Flamen]176-flamen]1871-the house of flamen . [She]101-bébée shuddered away from [him]1855-a poor man as [he]1855-a poor man held [her]101-bébée , and looked at [him]1855-a poor man with blank , tearless eyes . " Do not touch [me]101-bébée — take [me]101-bébée [home]289-home . "[101-bébée] That was all [she]101-bébée ever said to [him]1855-a poor man . [She]101-bébée never asked [him]1855-a poor man or told [him]1855-a poor man anything . [She]101-bébée never noticed that it was strange that [he]1855-a poor man should have been here upon [the river - bank]1872-the river - bank . [He]1855-a poor man let [her]101-bébée be , and took [her]101-bébée silently in the cool night back by the iron ways to [Brabant]3-brabant . [She]101-bébée sat quite still and upright in [the wagon]1993-the wagon with the dark lands rushing by [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée never spoke at all . [She]101-bébée had a look that frightened [him]1855-a poor man upon [her]101-bébée face . When [he]1855-a poor man tried to touch [her]101-bébée hand , [she]101-bébée shivered away from [him]1855-a poor man . [The charcoal - burner]433-the charcoal - burner , hardy and strong among [forest - reared men]1875-forest - reared men , cowered like [a child in a corner]1876-a child in a corner , and covered [his]1855-a poor man eyes and wept . So the night wore away . [She]101-bébée had no perception of anything that happened to [her]101-bébée until [she]101-bébée was led through [[her]101-bébée own little garden]1877-her own little garden in the early day , and [[her]101-bébée starling]1878-her starling cried to [her]101-bébée , " [Bonjour]216-bonjour , [Bonjour]216-bonjour ! "[1878-her starling] Even then [she]101-bébée only looked about [her]101-bébée in a bewildered way , and never spoke . Were the sixteen days a dream ? [She]101-bébée did not know . [The women whom [Jeannot]144-jeannot summoned]1879-the women whom jeannot summoned , [[his]144-jeannot mother]598-his mother and [sisters]1054-sisters , and [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs , and [one or two others]1882-one or two others , weeping for what had been the hardness of [their]1879-the women whom jeannot summoned hearts against [her]101-bébée , undressed [her]101-bébée , and laid [her]101-bébée down on [her]101-bébée little bed , and opened the shutters to the radiance of the sun . [She]101-bébée let [them]1879-the women whom jeannot summoned do as [they]1879-the women whom jeannot summoned liked , only [she]101-bébée seemed neither to hear nor speak , and [she]101-bébée never spoke . All that [Jeannot]144-jeannot could tell was that [he]144-jeannot had found [her]101-bébée in [Paris]15-paris , and had saved [her]101-bébée from [the river]1866-the river . [The women]346-the women were sorrowful , and reproached [themselves]346-the women . Perhaps [she]101-bébée had done wrong , but [they]346-the women had been harsh , and [she]101-bébée was so young . The two little sabots with the holes worn through the soles touched [them]346-the women ; and [they]346-the women blamed [themselves]346-the women for having shut [their]346-the women hearts and [their]346-the women doors against [her]101-bébée as [they]346-the women saw the fixed blue eyes , without any light in them , and the pretty mouth closed close against either sob or smile . After all [she]101-bébée was Bébée — the little bright blithe thing that had danced with [[their]346-the women children]1885-their children , and sung to [their]1885-their children singing , and brought [them]1885-their children always the first roses of the year . If [she]101-bébée had been led astray , [they]346-the women should have been gentler with [her]101-bébée . So [they]346-the women told [themselves]346-the women and [each other]318-each other . What had [she]101-bébée seen in that terrible [Paris]15-paris to change [her]101-bébée like this?—they could not tell [She]101-bébée never spoke . [The cock]1887-the cock crowed gayly to the sun . The lamb bleated in [the meadow]2518-the meadow . The bees boomed among the pear - tree blossoms . The gray lavender blew in the open house door . The green leaves threw shifting shadows on the floor . All things were just the same as they had been the year before , when [she]101-bébée had woke to the joy of being [a girl of sixteen]1889-a girl of sixteen . But [Bébée]101-bébée now lay quite still and silent on [her]101-bébée little bed ; as quiet as the waxen Gesù that [they]346-the women laid in the manger at the Nativity . " If [she]101-bébée would only speak ! "[346-the women] [the women]346-the women and [the children]373-the children wailed , weeping sorely . But [she]101-bébée never spoke ; nor did [she]101-bébée seem to know [any one of [them]346-the women]1892-any one of them . Not even the starling as [he]1893-he flew on [her]101-bébée pillow and called [her]101-bébée . " Give [her]101-bébée rest , "[346-the women] [they]346-the women all said ; and one by one moved away , being [poor folk]1894-poor folk and hard working , and unable to lose a whole day . [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs stayed with [her]101-bébée , and [Jeannot]144-jeannot sat in [the porch]2689-the porch where [her]101-bébée little spinning - wheel stood , and rocked [himself]144-jeannot to and fro ; in vain agony , powerless . [He]144-jeannot had done all [he]144-jeannot could , and it was of no avail . Then people who had loved [her]101-bébée , hearing , came up [the green lanes from [the city]225-the city]1896-the green lanes from the city — [the cobbler]638-the cobbler and [the tinman]1899-the tinman , and [the old woman who sold saints]1900-the old woman who sold saints ' pictures by [the Broodhuis]126-the broodhuis . [The Varnhart children]112-varnhart hung about [the garden wicket]1901-the garden wicket , frightened and sobbing . [Old Jehan]185-old jehan beat [his]185-old jehan knees with [his]185-old jehan hands , and said only over and over again , " Another dead — another [dead!—the red mill]2767-dead!—the red mill and [I]185-old jehan see [them]1903-them all dead ! "[185-old jehan] The long golden day drifted away , and the swans swayed to and fro , and the willows grew silver in the sunshine . [Bébée]101-bébée , only , lay quite still and never spoke . [The starling]427-the starling sat above [her]101-bébée head ; [his]427-the starling wings drooped , and [he]427-the starling was silent too . Towards sunset [Bébée]101-bébée raised [herself]101-bébée and called aloud : [they]1903-them ran to [her]101-bébée . " Get [me]101-bébée a rosebud — one with the moss round it , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said to [them]1903-them . [They]1903-them went out into [the garden]1940-the garden , and brought [her]101-bébée one wet with dew . [She]101-bébée kissed it , and laid it in one of [her]101-bébée little wooden shoes that stood upon the bed . " Send [them]1903-them to [him]427-the starling , "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said wearily ; " tell [him]427-the starling [I]101-bébée walked all the way . "[101-bébée] Then [her]101-bébée head drooped ; then momentary consciousness died out : the old dull lifeless look crept over [her]101-bébée face again like the shadow of death . [The starling]427-the starling spread [his]427-the starling broad black wings above [her]101-bébée head . [She]101-bébée lay quite still once more . [The women]346-the women left the rosebud in the wooden shoe , not knowing what [she]101-bébée meant . Night fell . [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs watched beside [her]101-bébée . [Jeannot]144-jeannot went down to [the old church]1907-the old church to beseech [heaven]1908-heaven with all [his]144-jeannot simple , ignorant , tortured soul . [The villagers]1806-the villagers hovered about , talking in low sad voices , and wondering , and dropping one by one into [[their]1806-the villagers homes]660-their homes . [They]1806-the villagers were sorry , very sorry ; but what could [they]1806-the villagers do ? It was quite night . The lights were put out in [the lane]396-the lane . [Jeannot]144-jeannot , with [Father Francis]105-father francis , prayed before [the shrine of the Seven Sorrows]1912-the shrine of the seven sorrows . [Mère Krebs]106-mère krebs slumbered in [her]106-mère krebs rush - bottomed chair ; [she]106-mère krebs was old and worked hard . [The starling]427-the starling was awake . [Bébée]101-bébée rose in [her]101-bébée bed , and looked around , as [she]101-bébée had done when [she]101-bébée had asked for the moss - rosebud . A sense of unutterable universal pain ached over all [her]101-bébée body . [She]101-bébée did not see [[her]101-bébée little home]1914-her little home , [its]1914-her little home four white walls , [its]1914-her little home lattice shining in the moon , [its]1914-her little home wooden bowls and plates , [its]1914-her little home oaken shelf and presses , [its]1914-her little home plain familiar things that once had been so dear,—she did not see them ; [she]101-bébée only saw [the brown woman]1915-the brown woman with [her]1915-the brown woman arm about [his]427-the starling throat . [She]101-bébée sat up in [her]101-bébée bed and slipped [her]101-bébée feet on to the floor ; the pretty little rosy feet that [he]427-the starling had used to want to clothe in silken stockings . Poor little feet ! [she]101-bébée felt a curious compassion for [them]1916-they ; [they]1916-they had served [her]101-bébée so well , and [they]1916-they were so tired . [She]101-bébée sat up a moment with that curious dull agony , aching everywhere in body and in brain . [She]101-bébée kissed the rosebud once more and laid it gently down in the wooden shoe . [She]101-bébée did not see anything that was around [her]101-bébée . [She]101-bébée felt a great dulness that closed in on [her]101-bébée , a great weight that was like iron on [her]101-bébée head . [She]101-bébée thought [she]101-bébée was in [the strange , noisy , cruel city]1917-the strange , noisy , cruel city , with ' [the river]1866-the river close to [her]101-bébée , and all [her]101-bébée dead dreams drifting down [it]1866-the river like [murdered children]1919-murdered children , whilst [that woman]1920-that woman kissed [him]1921-he . [She]101-bébée slipped [her]101-bébée feet on to the floor , and rose and stood upright . There was a door open to the moonlight — the door where [she]101-bébée had sat spinning and singing in a thousand happy days ; the lavender blew ; the tall , unbudded green lilies swayed in the wind ; [she]101-bébée looked at them , and knew none of them . The night air drifted through [her]101-bébée linen dress , and played on [her]101-bébée bare arms , and lifted the curls of [her]101-bébée hair ; the same air that had played with [her]101-bébée so many times out of mind when [she]101-bébée had been a little tottering thing that measured its height by the red rosebush . But it brought [her]101-bébée no sense of where [she]101-bébée was . All [she]101-bébée saw was [the woman who kissed [him]1921-he]1922-the woman who kissed him . There was [the water beyond]1923-the water beyond ; [the kindly calm water]1924-the kindly calm water , all green with the moss and the nests of the ouzels and the boughs of the hazels and willows , where the swans were asleep in the reeds , and the broad lilies spread wide and cool . But [she]101-bébée did not see any memory in it . [She]101-bébée thought it was [the cruel gray river in [the strange white city]1926-the strange white city]1925-the cruel gray river in the strange white city : and [she]101-bébée cried to it ; and went out into the old familiar ways , and knew none of them ; and ran feebly yet fleetly through the bushes and flowers , looking up once at the stars with a helpless broken blind look , like a thing that is dying . " [He]1921-he does not want [me]101-bébée ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée said to [them]1927-them ; " [he]1921-he does not want me!—other [women]785-women kiss [him]1921-he there ! "[101-bébée] Then with a low fluttering sound like a bird 's when its wings are shot , and yet it tries to rise , [she]101-bébée hovered a moment over [the water]300-the water , and stretched [her]101-bébée arms out to it . " [He]1921-he does not want [me]101-bébée ! "[101-bébée] [she]101-bébée murmured ; " [he]1921-he does not want [me]101-bébée — and [I]101-bébée am so tired . [Dear God]108-god ! "[101-bébée] Then [she]101-bébée crept down , as [a weary child]1929-a weary child creeps to [its mother]224-its mother , and threw [herself]101-bébée forward , and let the green dark waters take [her]101-bébée where [they]1927-them had found [her]101-bébée amidst the lilies , a little laughing yearling thing . There [she]101-bébée soon lay , quite quiet , with [her]101-bébée face turned to the stars , and the starling poised above to watch [her]101-bébée as [she]101-bébée slept . [She]101-bébée had been only [Bébée]101-bébée : the ways of [God]108-god and [man]1931-man had been too hard for [her]101-bébée . When [the messengers of [Flamen]176-flamen]1932-the messengers of flamen came that day , [they]1932-the messengers of flamen took [him]176-flamen back a dead moss - rose and a pair of little wooden shoes worn through with walking . " [One creature]2769-one creature loved [me]176-flamen once , "[176-flamen] [he]176-flamen says to [women who wonder why the wooden shoes are there]1933-women who wonder why the wooden shoes are there .
